OpenTHUG: let's port THUG on Linux
SkaterCorePhysicsComponent.cpp
См. документацию.

8 #include <sk/objects/rail.h>

13 #include <sk/components/skaterrotatecomponent.h>

16 #include <sk/components/skaterendruncomponent.h>

18 #include <sk/components/skaterloopingsoundcomponent.h>

20 #include <sk/components/skaterflipandrotatecomponent.h>
21 #include <sk/components/skaterphysicscontrolcomponent.h>
22 #include <sk/components/skatergapcomponent.h>

24 #include <gel/objtrack.h>
25 #include <gel/object/compositeobject.h>
26 #include <gel/object/compositeobjectmanager.h>
27 #include <gel/scripting/checksum.h>
28 #include <gel/scripting/script.h>
29 #include <gel/scripting/struct.h>
30 #include <gel/scripting/symboltable.h>
31 #include <gel/components/inputcomponent.h>
32 #include <gel/components/skitchcomponent.h>
33 #include <gel/components/triggercomponent.h>
34 #include <gel/components/trickcomponent.h>
35 #include <gel/components/railmanagercomponent.h>

47 #include <core/math/slerp.h>
48 
49 #define FLAGEXCEPTION(X) GetObject()->SelfEvent(X)
50 
51 void TrackingLine(int type, Mth::Vector &start, Mth::Vector &end)
52 {
53  if (Script::GetInt(CRCD(0x19fb78fa,"output_tracking_lines")))
54  {
55 // Gfx::AddDebugLine(start, end, 0xffffff);
56  printf ("Tracking%d %.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f\n",type, start[X], start[Y], start[Z], end[X], end[Y], end[Z]);
57  }
58 }
59 
60 extern bool g_CheatsEnabled;
61 
62 namespace Obj
63 {
64  Mth::Vector acid_hold;
65 
66 /******************************************************************/
67 /* */
68 /* */
69 /******************************************************************/
70 
71 CBaseComponent* CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::s_create()
72 {
73  return static_cast< CBaseComponent* >( new CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent );
74 }
75 
76 /******************************************************************/
77 /* */
78 /* */
79 /******************************************************************/
80 
81 CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent() : CBaseComponent()
82 {
83  SetType( CRC_SKATERCOREPHYSICS );
84 
85  mp_input_component = NULL;
86  mp_trigger_component = NULL;
87  mp_sound_component = NULL;
88  mp_trick_component = NULL;
89  mp_rotate_component = NULL;
90  mp_score_component = NULL;
91  mp_balance_trick_component = NULL;
92  mp_state_component = NULL;
93  mp_movable_contact_component = NULL;
94  mp_physics_control_component = NULL;
95  mp_walk_component = NULL;
96 
97  mp_coll_cache = Nx::CCollCacheManager::sCreateCollCache();
98 }
99 
100 /******************************************************************/
101 /* */
102 /* */
103 /******************************************************************/
104 
105 CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::~CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent()
106 {
107  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(mp_coll_cache);
108 }
109 
110 /******************************************************************/
111 /* */
112 /* */
113 /******************************************************************/
114 
115 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::InitFromStructure( Script::CStruct* pParams )
116 {
117  Dbg_MsgAssert(GetObject()->GetType() == SKATE_TYPE_SKATER, ("CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent added to non-skater composite object"));
118 
119  m_rolling_friction = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78f80ec4, "Physics_Rolling_Friction"));
120 
121  GetPos().Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
122  DUMP_POSITION;
123 
124  GetMatrix().Identity();
125  ResetLerpingMatrix();
126 
127  m_display_normal.Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
128  m_current_normal = m_display_normal;
129  m_last_display_normal = m_display_normal;
130 }
131 
132 /******************************************************************/
133 /* */
134 /* */
135 /******************************************************************/
136 
137 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::RefreshFromStructure( Script::CStruct* pParams )
138 {
139  InitFromStructure(pParams);
140 }
141 
142 /******************************************************************/
143 /* */
144 /* */
145 /******************************************************************/
146 
147 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::Finalize ( )
148 {
149  mp_input_component = GetInputComponentFromObject(GetObject());
150  mp_sound_component = GetSkaterSoundComponentFromObject(GetObject());
151  mp_trigger_component = GetTriggerComponentFromObject(GetObject());
152  mp_trick_component = GetTrickComponentFromObject(GetObject());
153  mp_rotate_component = GetSkaterRotateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
154  mp_score_component = GetSkaterScoreComponentFromObject(GetObject());
155  mp_balance_trick_component = GetSkaterBalanceTrickComponentFromObject(GetObject());
156  mp_state_component = GetSkaterStateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
157  mp_movable_contact_component = GetMovableContactComponentFromObject(GetObject());
158  mp_physics_control_component = GetSkaterPhysicsControlComponentFromObject(GetObject());
159  mp_walk_component = GetWalkComponentFromObject(GetObject());
160 
161  Dbg_Assert(mp_input_component);
162  Dbg_Assert(mp_sound_component);
163  Dbg_Assert(mp_trigger_component);
164  Dbg_Assert(mp_trick_component);
165  Dbg_Assert(mp_rotate_component);
166  Dbg_Assert(mp_score_component);
167  Dbg_Assert(mp_balance_trick_component);
168  Dbg_Assert(mp_movable_contact_component);
169  Dbg_Assert(mp_physics_control_component);
170  Dbg_Assert(mp_walk_component);
171 }
172 
173 /******************************************************************/
174 /* */
175 /* */
176 /******************************************************************/
177 
178 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::Update()
179 {
180  DUMP_POSITION;
181 
182  m_frame_length = Tmr::FrameLength();
183 
184  // bool up = GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f;
185 
186  m_landed_this_frame = false;
187 
188  m_began_frame_in_lip_state = GetState() == LIP;
189  m_began_frame_in_transfer = GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS);
190 
191  handle_tensing();
192 
193  limit_speed();
194 
195  SetFlagFalse(SNAPPED_OVER_CURB); // this flag only gets set for one frame, to fix camera snaps
196  SetFlagFalse(SNAPPED); // this flag only gets set for one frame, to fix camera snaps
197 
198  setup_default_collision_cache();
199 
200  switch (GetState())
201  {
202  case GROUND:
203  // Mick: Remember the last ground position for calculating which side of the rail we're on later.
204  // Note, we do this BEFORE we move as the movement might take us off the ground
205  m_last_ground_pos = GetPos();
206  do_on_ground_physics();
207  maybe_skitch();
208  break;
209 
210  case AIR:
211  do_in_air_physics();
212  if (GetState() == GROUND)
213  {
214  m_landed_this_frame = true;
215  }
216  break;
217 
218  case WALL:
219  do_wallride_physics();
220  break;
221 
222  case LIP:
223  do_lip_physics();
224  break;
225 
226  case RAIL:
227  do_rail_physics();
228  break;
229 
230  case WALLPLANT:
231  do_wallplant_physics();
232  break;
233  }
234 
235  handle_post_transfer_limit_overrides();
236 
237  // NOTE: moved this call from after CSkaterRotateComponent::Update to before it
238  maybe_stick_to_rail();
239 
240  update_special_friction_index();
241 
242  // if (up && GetVel()[Y] < 0.0f)
243  // {
244  // DUMPF(GetPos()[Y]);
245  // }
246 
247  if (m_vert_air_last_frame != (GetState() == AIR && GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS)))
248  {
249  m_vert_air_last_frame = !m_vert_air_last_frame;
250  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(m_vert_air_last_frame ? CRCD(0xf225fe69, "SkaterEnterVertAir") : CRCD(0x5e27200a, "SkaterExitVertAir"));
251  }
252 
253  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
254  // Gfx::AddDebugArrow(GetPos(), GetPos() + 60.0f * GetMatrix()[Z], RED, 0, 1);
255  // Gfx::AddDebugArrow(GetPos(), GetPos() + 60.0f * GetMatrix()[X], BLUE, 0, 1);
256  // Gfx::AddDebugArrow(GetPos(), GetPos() + 60.0f * GetMatrix()[Y], GREEN, 0, 1);
257  #endif
258 
259  CFeeler::sClearDefaultCache();
260 }
261 
262 /******************************************************************/
263 /* */
264 /* */
265 /******************************************************************/
266 
267 CBaseComponent::EMemberFunctionResult CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::CallMemberFunction( uint32 Checksum, Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
268 {
269  switch ( Checksum )
270  {
271  // @script | Jump |
272  // @flag BonelessHeight |
273  case CRCC(0x584cf9e9, "Jump"):
274  do_jump(pParams);
275  break;
276 
277  // @script | Flipped | true if flipped
278  case CRCC(0xc7a712c, "Flipped"):
279  return GetFlag(FLIPPED) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
280 
281  // @script | Switched | true if switched
282  case CRCC(0x8f66b80b, "Switched"):
283  return IsSwitched() ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
284 
285  // @script | Crouched | true if skater crouched
286  case CRCC(0x4adc6c2a, "Crouched"):
287  return GetFlag(TENSE) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
288 
289  // @script | OnGround | true if current state is on ground
290  case CRCC(0x5ea287f2, "OnGround"):
291  return GetState() == GROUND ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
292 
293  // @script | InAir | true if current state is in air
294  case CRCC(0x3527fc07, "InAir"):
295  return GetState() == AIR ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
296 
297  // @script | OnWall | true if current state is on wall
298  case CRCC(0xa32c1a15, "OnWall"):
299  return GetState() == WALL ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
300 
301  // @script | OnLip | true if current state is on lip
302  case CRCC(0x5cb1fbd8, "OnLip"):
303  return GetState() == LIP ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
304 
305  // @script | OnRail | true if current state is on rail
306  case CRCC(0xe9851e62, "OnRail"):
307  return GetState() == RAIL ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
308 
309  // @script | InWallplant | true if current state is in wallplant
310  case CRCC(0xa64dcf8b, "InWallplant"):
311  return GetState() == WALLPLANT ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
312 
313  // @script | FirstTimeOnThisRail | true if this is the first time we grinded this rail wihout doing something else
314  // like skating or wallriding
315  case CRCC(0x262d42d5,"FirstTimeOnThisRail"):
316  return GetFlag(NEW_RAIL) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
317 
318  // @script | StartSkitch | Start skitch physics
319  // This will send a SkitchOn exception to the object
320  case CRCC(0xca6b3809, "StartSkitch"):
321  start_skitch();
322  break;
323 
324  // @script | Skitching | Returns True if we are skitching
325  case CRCC(0x9c6a7e41, "Skitching"):
326  return GetFlag(SKITCHING) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
327 
328  // @script | StopSkitch | Stop Skitch physics
329  // this wills send a SkitchOff exeception to the object
330  case CRCC(0x32dcc9cf, "StopSkitch"):
331  StopSkitch();
332  break;
333 
334  // @script | CancelWallpush | Cancels the current wallpush event
335  case CRCC(0x5e8f9e77, "CancelWallpush"):
336  SetFlagTrue(CANCEL_WALL_PUSH);
337  break;
338 
339  // @script | AirTimeLessThan | true if the air time is
340  // less than the specified time
341  // @uparm 1.0 | time (default is milliseconds)
342  // @flag seconds | time in seconds
343  // @flag frames | time in frames
344  case CRCC(0xc890a84, "AirTimeLessThan"):
345  // @script | AirTimeGreaterThan | true if the air time is
346  // greater than the specified time
347  // @uparm 1.0 | time (default is milliseconds)
348  // @flag seconds | time in seconds
349  // @flag frames | time in frames
350  case CRCC(0xbbf2b570, "AirTimeGreaterThan"):
351  {
352  float t = 0;
353  pParams->GetFloat(NO_NAME, &t);
354 
355  Tmr::Time TestTime;
356  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xd029f619, "seconds")) || pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x49e0ee96, "second")))
357  {
358  TestTime = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(t * 1000);
359  }
360  else if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x19176c5, "frames")) || pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x4a07c332, "frame")))
361  {
362  TestTime = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(t * (1000 / 60));
363  }
364  else
365  {
366  TestTime = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(t);
367  }
368 
369  Tmr::Time AirTime;
370  if (GetState() == AIR || GetState() == WALL)
371  {
372  AirTime = Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_went_airborne_time);
373  }
374  else
375  {
376  AirTime = m_landed_time - m_went_airborne_time;
377  }
378 
379  if (Checksum == CRCD(0xc890a84, "AirTimeLessThan"))
380  {
381  return AirTime < TestTime ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
382  }
383  else
384  {
385  return AirTime > TestTime ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
386  }
387  }
388 
389  // @script | GetAirTime | Puts the air time, in seconds, into a param called airtime
390  case CRCC(0xde583e34, "GetAirTime"):
391  {
392  Tmr::Time AirTime;
393  if (GetState() == AIR || GetState() == WALL)
394  {
395  AirTime = Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_went_airborne_time);
396  }
397  else
398  {
399  AirTime = m_landed_time - m_went_airborne_time;
400  }
401  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0xad6bcdb4, "AirTime"), AirTime * (1.0f / 1000.0f));
402  break;
403  }
404 
405  // @script | GetAirTimeLeft | Puts the amount of air time left before landing, in seconds, into a param called AirTimeLeft
406  case CRCC(0x1996b797, "GetAirTimeLeft"):
407  {
408  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x7e2a8993, "AirTimeLeft"),
409  Mth::ClampMin(calculate_time_to_reach_height(GetPos()[Y] - mp_state_component->m_height, GetPos()[Y], GetVel()[Y]), 0.0f));
410  break;
411  }
412 
413  // @script | Braking | true if skater is braking
414  case CRCC(0x1f8bbd05, "Braking"):
415  return is_braking() ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
416 
417  case CRCC(0xebbcf455, "CanBrakeOff"):
418  m_pressing_down_brakes = false;
419  break;
420 
421  case CRCC(0xbc19e291, "CanBrakeOn"):
422  m_pressing_down_brakes = true;
423  break;
424 
425  // @script | CanKick | true if skater can kick
426  case CRCC(0x2f66333, "CanKick"):
427  return can_kick() ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
428 
429  // @script | CanKickOn | sets can kick to true
430  case CRCC(0x68bf6c13, "CanKickOn"):
431  m_force_cankick_off = false;
432  break;
433 
434  // @script | CanKickOff | sets can kick to false
435  case CRCC(0xe8deb0d7, "CanKickOff"):
436  m_force_cankick_off = true;
437  break;
438 
439  // @script | ForceAutokickOn | turns on auto kick
440  case CRCC(0x34dcfc97, "ForceAutokickOn"):
441  m_auto_kick = true;
442  break;
443 
444  // @script | ForceAutoKickOff | turns off auto kick
445  case CRCC(0x257947e, "ForceAutokickOff"):
446  m_auto_kick = false;
447  break;
448 
449  // @script | AutoKickIsOff | true if auto kick is off
450  case CRCC(0x1baa1d9, "AutoKickIsOff"):
451  return m_auto_kick == false ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
452 
453  // @script | RestoreAutokick | restores auto kick to
454  // original preferences
455  case CRCC(0x9fcfdfeb, "RestoreAutokick"):
456  m_auto_kick = Mdl::Skate::Instance()->mp_controller_preferences[GetSkater()->m_skater_number].AutoKickOn;
457  break;
458 
459  // @script | DoCarPlantBoost | boost after doing car plant
460  case CRCC(0x17846595, "DoCarPlantBoost"):
461  {
462  GetVel()[Y] = Mth::ClampMin(GetVel()[Y], 0.0f);
463  GetVel()[Y] += GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xcb49b3f2, "Carplant_upward_boost"));
464 
465  DUMP_VELOCITY;
466 
467  Mth::Vector front = GetVel();
468  front[Y] = 0.0f;
469  if (front.LengthSqr() < 10.0f * 10.0f)
470  {
471  front = GetMatrix()[Z];
472  front[Y] = 0.0f;
473  if (front.LengthSqr() < 0.01f * 0.01f)
474  {
475  front.Set(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
476  }
477  }
478  front.Normalize();
479  GetVel() += front * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xb7422173, "Carplant_forward_boost"));
480 
481  DUMP_VELOCITY;
482  break;
483  }
484 
485  // @script | HandleLipOllieDirection |
486  case CRCC(0x259cb90d, "HandleLipOllieDirection"):
487  {
488  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
489 
490  Mth::Vector out = GetMatrix()[Z];
491  out[Y] = 0.0f;
492  out.Normalize();
493  Mth::Vector along(out[Z], 0.0f, -out[X], 0.0f);
494 
495  // We've jumped off a lip, so we want to give us some velocity to the left
496  if (control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
497  {
498  // don't allow right jumping
499  return CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
500  }
501  else if (BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS)
502  {
503  GetVel() += out * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1f96c224, "Lip_side_hop_speed"));
504  DUMP_VELOCITY;
505  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
506  }
507  else if (control_pad.m_left.GetPressed()
508  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_left.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x3080e9e7, "Lip_held_jump_out_time")))
509  {
510  GetVel() += out * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xdc818b7e, "Lip_side_jump_speed"));
511  DUMP_VELOCITY;
512  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
513  }
514  if (control_pad.m_up.GetPressed()
515  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x9b25142a, "Lip_held_jump_along_time")))
516  {
517  GetVel() -= along * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1ab3809f, "Lip_along_jump_speed"));
518  DUMP_VELOCITY;
519  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
520  }
521  else if (control_pad.m_down.GetPressed()
522  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_down.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x9b25142a,"Lip_held_jump_along_time")))
523  {
524  GetVel() += along * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1ab3809f, "Lip_along_jump_speed"));
525  DUMP_VELOCITY;
526  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
527  }
528  else
529  {
530  return CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
531  }
532  }
533 
534  // @script | OrientToNormal |
535  case CRCC(0x1d1fd4f0, "OrientToNormal"):
536  m_display_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
537  m_current_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
538  new_normal(m_feeler.GetNormal());
539  break;
540 
541  // @script | SetSpeed |
542  // @uparm 0.0 | speed in inches per second, so 3000 is very very fast
543  // The skater's max speed is about 1100 inches per second (depends on stats)
544  // this is usually used in conjunction with Overridelimits, to provide a temporary speed boost
545  case CRCC(0x383b939b, "SetSpeed"):
546  {
547  float Speed = 0.0f;
548  pParams->GetFloat(NO_NAME, &Speed);
549  float length_sqr = GetVel().LengthSqr();
550  if (length_sqr < 0.001f)
551  {
552  GetVel() = GetMatrix()[Z];
553  }
554  else
555  {
556  GetVel() *= 1.0f / sqrtf(length_sqr);
557  }
558  GetVel() *= Speed;
559  DUMP_VELOCITY;
560  break;
561  }
562 
563  // @script | NoSpin | sets flag, disabling spin
564  case CRCC(0x54ef2b79, "NoSpin"):
565  mNoSpin = true;
566  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
567  break;
568 
569  // @script | CanSpin | sets flag enabling spin
570  case CRCC(0xe2998b9, "CanSpin"):
571  mNoSpin = false;
572  break;
573 
574  // @script | InBail | sets is_bailing flag
575  case CRCC(0x6fc5aae0, "InBail"):
576  {
577  SetFlagTrue(IS_BAILING);
578  break;
579  }
580 
581  // @script | NotInBail | clears is_bailing flag
582  case CRCC(0xbd4303f4, "NotInBail"):
583  {
584  SetFlagFalse(IS_BAILING);
585  break;
586  }
587 
588  // @script | IsInBail | true if bailing (as defined by is_bailing flag)
589  case CRCC(0xa901a50c, "IsInBail"):
590  return GetFlag(IS_BAILING) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
591 
592  // @script | BailOn | turn bails on
593  case CRCC(0xe0df1f0a, "BailOn"):
594  m_bail = true;
595  break;
596 
597  // @script | BailOff | turn bails off
598  case CRCC(0x8c3d7864, "BailOff"):
599  m_bail = false;
600  break;
601 
602  // @script | BailIsOn | true if bails on
603  case CRCC(0xe1d5168, "BailIsOn"):
604  return m_bail ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
605 
606 
607  // @script | FrontTruckSparks | true if sparks should be coming from the front trucks, false if from rear
608  case CRCC(0xe0760055, "FrontTruckSparks"):
609  return m_front_truck_sparks ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
610  break;
611 
612  // @script | SetFrontTruckSparks | sets sparks to come from front trucks
613  case CRCC(0x19d0e5fb, "SetFrontTruckSparks"):
614  m_front_truck_sparks = true;
615  break;
616 
617  // @script | SetRearTruckSparks | sets sparks to come from rear trucks
618  case CRCC(0xb48ec756, "SetRearTruckSparks"):
619  m_front_truck_sparks = false;
620  break;
621 
622  // @script | SetState | sets the state to the specified state
623  // @uparm name | state name (lip, air, ground)
624  case CRCC(0x948ebf96, "SetState"):
625  {
626  uint32 StateChecksum = 0;
627  pParams->GetChecksum(NO_NAME, &StateChecksum);
628 
629  if (GetState() == LIP && StateChecksum != CRCD(0xa549b57b, "Lip"))
630  {
631  // Trigger the lip off event.
632  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_LIP_OFF);
633  }
634 
635  // If we are going to "LIP" via script then clear the rail node, as it's a patch to get the skater to freeze
636  if (GetState() != LIP && StateChecksum == CRCD(0xa549b57b, "Lip"))
637  {
638  mp_rail_node = NULL;
639  }
640 
641  // if script alters state from wallride (like for a bail), then snap upright
642  // note, this command does not support setting TO wall, if it does, we should check here
643  if (GetState() == WALL)
644  {
645  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
646  ResetLerpingMatrix();
647  }
648 
649  switch (StateChecksum)
650  {
651  case 0:
652  break;
653  case CRCC(0x439f4704, "Air"):
654  SetState(AIR);
655  break;
656  case CRCC(0x58007c97, "Ground"):
657  m_last_ground_feeler.SetTrigger(0); // prevent spurious gaps
658  SetState(GROUND);
659  break;
660  case CRCC(0xa549b57b, "Lip"):
661  SetState(LIP);
662  break;
663  default:
664  Dbg_Assert(false);
665  break;
666  }
667  break;
668  }
669 
670  // @script | SetRailSound | sets the rail sound to either grind or slide
671  // @uparm Grind | pass either Grind or Slide
672  case CRCC(0x947fccf4, "SetRailSound"):
673  {
674  uint32 rail_sound_checksum = 0;
675  pParams->GetChecksum(NO_NAME, &rail_sound_checksum, Script::ASSERT);
676  Dbg_MsgAssert(rail_sound_checksum == CRCD(0x255ed86f,"Grind") || rail_sound_checksum == CRCD(0x8d10119d, "Slide"),
677  ("\n%s\nBad rail sound type '%s' sent to SetRailSound", pScript->GetScriptInfo(), Script::FindChecksumName(rail_sound_checksum)));
678  if (rail_sound_checksum == CRCD(0x8d10119d, "Slide"))
679  {
680  SetFlagTrue(RAIL_SLIDING);
681  }
682  else
683  {
684  SetFlagFalse(RAIL_SLIDING);
685  }
686  break;
687  }
688 
689  // @script | LockVelocityDirection | When passed the flag On this will cause the skater's
690  // velocity to be locked in its current direction and be unaffected by the skater's rotation.
691  // Only works when on the ground however.
692  // @flag On | Enable
693  // @flag Off | Disable (Ie, back to normal)
694  case CRCC(0xacb82c02, "LockVelocityDirection"):
695  m_lock_velocity_direction = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xf649d637, "On"));
696  break;
697 
698  // @script | SetRollingFriction | change the rolling friction value
699  // @flag Default | use the default value
700  // @uparm 0.0 | friction coeff
701  case CRCC(0x510f983b, "SetRollingFriction"):
702  pParams->GetFloat(NO_NAME, &m_rolling_friction);
703  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x1ca1ff20, "Default")))
704  {
705  if (m_special_friction_duration == 0.0f)
706  {
707  m_rolling_friction = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78f80ec4, "Physics_Rolling_Friction"));
708  }
709  }
710  break;
711 
712  // @script | SetGrindTweak |
713  // @uparm int | grind tweak
714  case CRCC(0x71b993b7, "SetGrindTweak"):
715  pParams->GetInteger(NO_NAME, &mGrindTweak);
716  break;
717 
718  // @script | Ledge | true if ledge
719  case CRCC(0x315d9ed4, "Ledge"):
720  return mLedge ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
721 
722  // @script | BadLedge | true if bad ledge
723  case CRCC(0xbe371b7b, "BadLedge"):
724  return mBadLedge ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
725 
726  // @script | SkateInAble | Do a collision check using a horizontal line a bit below the skater, and return true if it hits something skatable.
727  // @flag Left | go left to right
728  // Parameters in physics.q: SkateInAble_HorizOffset and SkateInAble_DownOffset
729  // @flag Lip | This will do a check to see if the other side of the spine that the
730  // skater might be doing a lip trick on is skateinable.
731  // The collision check is down relative to the skater, but horizontal relative to
732  // the world because of the skater's wacky orientation when doing a lip trick.
733  // The direction of the collision check is towards the skater, so that it detects the
734  // other side of the spine.
735  // Parameters in physics.q: SkateInAble_LipHorizOffset and SkateInAble_LipDownOffset
736  case CRCC(0x55934543, "SkateInAble"):
737  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xa549b57b, "Lip")))
738  {
739  float HorizOff = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xb92cbe3b, "SkateInAble_LipHorizOffset"));
740  float DownOff = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xefdfe781, "SkateInAble_LipDownOffset"));
741  m_col_end = GetPos();
742  m_col_end[Y] -= DownOff;
743  m_col_start = m_col_end - HorizOff * GetMatrix()[Y];
744  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
745  {
746  return m_col_flag_vert ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
747  }
748  else
749  {
750  // If the first check fails, do another check straight down. This is for when the skater is doing a lip trick on a high up rail that
751  // still has vert beneath it.
752  HorizOff = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x108613cb, "SkateInAble_LipExtraCheckHorizOffset"));
753  DownOff = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xf9dc446d, "SkateInAble_LipExtraCheckDownOffset"));
754  m_col_start = GetPos() - HorizOff * GetMatrix()[Y];
755  m_col_end = m_col_start;
756  m_col_end[Y] -= DownOff;
757  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
758  {
759  return m_col_flag_vert ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
760  }
761  }
762  }
763  else
764  {
765  float HorizOff=GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xc78ebe56,"SkateInAble_HorizOffset"));
766  Mth::Vector a = GetPos() + HorizOff * GetMatrix()[X];
767  a[Y] -= GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xfca3378c,"SkateInAble_DownOffset"));
768  Mth::Vector b = a - 2.0f * HorizOff * GetMatrix()[X];
769 
770  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x85981897,"Left")))
771 
772  {
773  m_col_start = a;
774  m_col_end = b;
775  }
776  else
777  {
778  m_col_start = b;
779  m_col_end = a;
780  }
781 
782  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
783  {
784  return m_col_flag_vert ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
785  }
786  }
787  return CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
788 
789  // @script | LastSpinWas | check if last spin was frontside or backside (requires one flag)
790  // @flag Backside |
791  // @flag Frontside |
792  case CRCC(0x6c8a1316, "LastSpinWas"):
793  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x47953f00, "Backside")))
794  {
795  if (GetFlag(FLIPPED))
796  {
797  return !mYAngleIncreased ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
798  }
799  else
800  {
801  return mYAngleIncreased ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
802  }
803  }
804  else if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x996d5512, "Frontside")))
805  {
806  if (GetFlag(FLIPPED))
807  {
808  return mYAngleIncreased ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
809  }
810  else
811  {
812  return !mYAngleIncreased ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
813  }
814  }
815  else
816  {
817  Dbg_MsgAssert(false, ("LastSpinWas requires a FrontSide or BackSide flag"));
818  }
819  break;
820 
821  // @script | LandedFromSpine |
822  case CRCC(0x448e3630, "LandedFromSpine"):
823  return mLandedFromSpine ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
824 
825  // @script | LandedFromVert |
826  case CRCC(0xf37ce040, "LandedFromVert"):
827  return mLandedFromVert ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
828 
829  // @script | SetLandedFromVert | sets the mlandedfromvert flag
830  // (check with LandedFromVert)
831  case CRCC(0x133e1293, "SetLandedFromVert"):
832  mLandedFromVert = true;
833  break;
834 
835  // @script | ResetLandedFromVert | clears mlandedfromvert flag
836  // (check with LandedFromVert)
837  case CRCC(0xf922431, "ResetLandedFromVert"):
838  mLandedFromVert = false;
839  break;
840 
841  // @script | IsInVertAir | check if VERT_AIR flag is set
842  case CRCC(0xdfb8f052, "InVertAir"):
843  return GetFlag(VERT_AIR) ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
844 
845  // @script | AllowLipNoGrind |
846  case CRCC(0xc5b4b390, "AllowLipNoGrind"):
847  mAllowLipNoGrind = true;
848  break;
849 
850  // @script | ClearAllLipNoGrind |
851  case CRCC(0xb9eebff6, "ClearAllowLipNoGrind"):
852  mAllowLipNoGrind = false;
853  break;
854 
855  // @script | NoRailTricks | don't allow rail tricks
856  // (turn on with AllowRailTricks)
857  case CRCC(0xec681a59, "NoRailTricks"):
858  mNoRailTricks = true;
859  break;
860 
861  // @script | AllowRailTricks | turn off with NoRailTricks
862  case CRCC(0x65a559a, "AllowRailTricks"):
863  mNoRailTricks = false;
864  break;
865 
866  // @script | TurnToFaceVelocity | turn to face the proper direction
867  case CRCC(0x461e5b92, "TurnToFaceVelocity"):
868  // Mick: Don't do it if vel is too short as skater will collapse
869  if (GetVel().LengthSqr() < 0.01f * 0.01f) break;
870 
871  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
872  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
873  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
874  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
875  GetMatrix()[Y] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], GetMatrix()[X]);
876  GetMatrix()[Y].Normalize();
877 
878  ResetLerpingMatrix();
879  break;
880 
881  // @script | OverrideLimits | Overrides the limits to the maximum speed that the skater
882  // can achieve. This allows us to do temporary speed boosts whihc are much faster
883  // than regular gameplay.
884  // You can specify a time that this speed limit will last for
885  // @parm float | max | Maximum speed in inches per second (normal gameplay is around 1000, so 5000 is nice)
886  // @parmopt float | max_max | max | usualy the same as above. It's a hard cap, making it bigger that max will give
887  // you a smoother limit to the speed.
888  // @parmopt float | friction | 0.0000020 | air friction. Slows you down at a rate proportional to speed. So reduce this to stay fast longer
889  // @parmopt float | gravity | physics default | down_gravity. gravity that slows you down when going up a slope
890  // @parmopt float | time | 10000000000000,0f | time in seconds that this effect should last for
891  // @flag end | end the effect (other parameters are unneeded and ignored if end is flagged)
892  case CRCC(0x90f1d8d5, "OverrideLimits"):
893  {
894  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xff03cc4e, "end")))
895  {
896  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
897  }
898  else
899  {
900  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x6289dd76, "max"), &m_override_max, Script::ASSERT);
901  m_override_max_max = m_override_max;
902  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x73a19e3a, "max_max"), &m_override_max_max);
903  m_override_limits_time = 10000000000000.0f;
904  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x906b67ba, "time"), &m_override_limits_time);
905  m_override_air_friction = 0.0000020f;
906  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xedf3e7f4, "friction"), &m_override_air_friction);
907  m_override_down_gravity = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x6618a713, "Physics_Ground_Gravity"));
908  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xa5e2da58, "gravity"), &m_override_down_gravity);
909 
910  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xdf312928, "NoTimeLimit")))
911  {
912  // magic number meaning no time limit
913  m_override_limits_time = -1.0f;
914  }
915  }
916  break;
917  }
918 
919  // @script | SetSpecialFriction | This command is used in the Revert script to specify a set of friction values that should be used for
920  // each Revert in the combo. m_special_friction_index gets reset as soon as the combo ends, ie by the ClearPanel_Landed & ClearPanel_Bailed
921  // functions.
922  // @uparm [] | array of friction values
923  case CRCC(0x5e8d9b80,"SetSpecialFriction"):
924  {
925  Script::CArray* pArray = NULL;
926  pParams->GetArray(NO_NAME, &pArray);
927  Dbg_MsgAssert(pArray, ("\n%s\nSetSpecialFriction requires an array of friction values", pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
928  if (m_special_friction_index >= static_cast< int >(pArray->GetSize()))
929  {
930  m_special_friction_index = static_cast< int >(pArray->GetSize()) - 1;
931  }
932  m_rolling_friction = pArray->GetFloat(m_special_friction_index);
933  if (m_special_friction_index == 0)
934  {
935  m_special_friction_decrement_time_stamp = Tmr::GetTime();
936  }
937  ++m_special_friction_index;
938 
939  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x79a07f3f, "Duration"), &m_special_friction_duration);
940  break;
941  }
942 
943  // @script | OverrideCancelGround | Overrided the Cancel_Ground flag in gaps
944  // for use with reverts
945  // @flag Off | turn this flag off
946  case CRCC(0xb94bc0c6, "OverrideCancelGround"):
947  SetFlag(OVERRIDE_CANCEL_GROUND, !pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xd443a2bc, "Off")));
948  break;
949 
950  // @script | SetExtraPush |
951  // @parmopt float | radius | 48.0 | wall push radius
952  // @parmopt float | speed | 100.0 | wall push speed
953  // @parmopt float | turn | 6.0 | wall rotate speed
954  case CRCC(0xe47ff4b5, "SetExtraPush"):
955  {
956  m_wall_push_radius = 48.0f;
957  m_wall_push_speed = 100.0f;
958  m_wall_rotate_speed = 6.0f;
959  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xc48391a5, "radius"), &m_wall_push_radius);
960  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xf0d90109, "speed"), &m_wall_push_speed);
961  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xdfdfeab8, "turn"), &m_wall_rotate_speed);
962  break;
963  }
964 
965  // @script | GetMatrixNormal | places the skater's matrix normal in x, y, and z
966  case CRCC(0x5144783, "GetMatrixNormal"):
967  {
968  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x7323e97c, "x"), GetMatrix()[Y][X]);
969  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x0424d9ea, "y"), GetMatrix()[Y][Y]);
970  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x9d2d8850, "z"), GetMatrix()[Y][Z]);
971  break;
972  }
973 
974  // Overloading the CMotionComponent member function for skater specific logic
975  case CRCC(0x8819dd8b, "Obj_MoveToNode"):
976  {
977  CMotionComponent* p_motion_component = GetMotionComponentFromObject(GetObject());
978  Dbg_Assert(p_motion_component);
979 
980  // call the member function, which will set m_matrix and m_pos
981  bool result = p_motion_component->CallMemberFunction( Checksum, pParams, pScript );
982 
983  // and copy this into m_display_matrix
984  ResetLerpingMatrix();
985 
986  // set the shadow to stick to his feet, assuming we are on the ground
987  // Note: These are used by the simple shadow, not the detailed one.
988  CShadowComponent* p_shadow_component = GetShadowComponentFromObject(GetObject());
989  Dbg_Assert(p_shadow_component);
990 
991  p_shadow_component->SetShadowPos( GetSkater()->m_pos );
992  p_shadow_component->SetShadowNormal( GetSkater()->m_matrix[Y] );
993 
994  m_safe_pos = GetPos(); // needed for uberfrig
995  GetOldPos() = GetPos(); // needed for camera, so it thinks we've stopped
996 
997  GetObject()->SetTeleported();
998 
999  // Force an update of the skater's camera if this is a local skater
1000  if( GetSkater()->IsLocalClient())
1001  {
1002  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj = GetSkater()->GetCamera();
1003  if (p_obj)
1004  {
1005  p_obj->Update(); // Not the best way of doing it...
1006  }
1007  }
1008 
1009  if (!pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0xd607e2e6,"NoReset") ))
1010  {
1011  // assume we want the skater to stop...
1012  m_last_ground_feeler.SetTrigger(0); // patch to stop spurious gaps
1013  GetVel().Set();
1014  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1015  SetState(GROUND);
1016 
1017  // Make sure the flippedness of the skater is in a stable state
1018  // that reflects if he is goofy or not
1019  SetFlag(FLIPPED, !GetSkater()->m_isGoofy);
1020 
1021  // reset any flippedness of animation
1022  CSkaterFlipAndRotateComponent* p_flip_and_rotate_component = GetSkaterFlipAndRotateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
1023  Dbg_Assert(p_flip_and_rotate_component);
1024  p_flip_and_rotate_component->ApplyFlipState();
1025  }
1026  else
1027  {
1028  // the "NoReset" flag is set
1029  // so velocity is maintained
1030  // but we need to check if the orient flag is set
1031  // as that indicates that we want the velocity
1032  // to be oriented as well.
1033  // (if NoReset was set, then velocity will be zero)
1034  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0x90a91232, "orient") ))
1035  {
1036  float y_vel = GetVel()[Y]; // y velocity is preserved.....
1037  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
1038  float speed = GetVel().Length(); // how fast are we going?
1039  GetVel() = GetMatrix()[Z] * speed; // face forward, at that speed
1040  GetVel()[Y] = y_vel;
1041  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1042  }
1043  }
1044  return result ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
1045  }
1046 
1047  // Used by the create-a-goal cursor to initialise the cursor position.
1048  // Cannot use the current skater's position because he might have just bailed by
1049  // jumping into water, which would then cause the cursor to get stuck.
1050  case 0xf7e21884: // GetLastGroundPos
1051  {
1052  pScript->GetParams()->AddVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"Pos"),m_last_ground_pos[X],m_last_ground_pos[Y],m_last_ground_pos[Z]);
1053  break;
1054  }
1055 
1056  default:
1057  return CBaseComponent::MF_NOT_EXECUTED;
1058  }
1059  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
1060 }
1061 
1062 /******************************************************************/
1063 /* */
1064 /* */
1065 /******************************************************************/
1066 
1067 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::GetDebugInfo(Script::CStruct *p_info)
1068 {
1069 #ifdef __DEBUG_CODE__
1070  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_info,("NULL p_info sent to CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::GetDebugInfo"));
1071 
1072  CBaseComponent::GetDebugInfo(p_info);
1073 #endif
1074 }
1075 
1076 /******************************************************************/
1077 /* */
1078 /* */
1079 /******************************************************************/
1080 
1081 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::Reset ( )
1082 {
1083  // In Network games, don't set the skater to 0,0,0 because he is about to be teleported to a starting position and 0,0,0 means nothing.
1084  if (!GameNet::Manager::Instance()->InNetGame())
1085  {
1086  /*
1087  GetPos().Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1088  GetOldPos().Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1089  m_safe_pos.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1090  */
1091  GetOldPos() = GetPos();
1092  m_safe_pos = GetPos();
1093  DUMP_POSITION;
1094  }
1095 
1096  m_pre_lip_pos.Set();
1097 
1098  /*
1099  GetMatrix().Identity();
1100  ResetLerpingMatrix();
1101  */
1102 
1103  m_state_change_timestamp = Tmr::GetTime();
1104 
1105  GetVel().Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1106  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1107 
1108  SetState(GROUND);
1109  m_previous_state = GROUND;
1110 
1111  for (int flag = NUM_ESKATERFLAGS; flag--; )
1112  {
1113  SetFlagTrue(static_cast< ESkaterFlag >(flag));
1114  SetFlagFalse(static_cast< ESkaterFlag >(flag));
1115  }
1116  SetFlag(FLIPPED, !GetSkater()->m_isGoofy);
1117 
1118  mp_movable_contact_component->LoseAnyContact();
1119 
1120  // bit nasty, prevents us getting "SKATE_OFF_EDGE" triggers
1121  m_last_ground_feeler.SetTrigger(0);
1122 
1123  m_wall_push_radius = 0.0f;
1124 
1125  m_tense_time = 0;
1126 
1127  mWallrideTime = 0;
1128 
1129  mNoSpin = false;
1130 
1131  m_bail = false;
1132 
1133  m_force_cankick_off = false;
1134  m_pressing_down_brakes = true;
1135 
1136  mp_state_component->mJumpedOutOfLipTrick = false;
1137 
1138  // mp_rail_node points to previous rail grinded, which might no longer be valid
1139  // best to set it to NULL (fixed crash in park editor with multiple test-plays TT#678)
1140  mp_rail_node = NULL;
1141 
1142  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
1143  m_transfer_overrides_factor = 1.0f;
1144 
1145  m_last_wallplant_time_stamp = 0;
1146  m_last_wallpush_time_stamp = 0;
1147 
1148  m_last_jump_time_stamp = 0;
1149 
1150  m_special_friction_duration = 0.0f;
1151 }
1152 
1153 /******************************************************************/
1154 /* */
1155 /* */
1156 /******************************************************************/
1157 
1158 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::ReadySkateState ( bool to_ground_state, const SRailData* p_rail_data, const SAcidDropData* p_acid_drop_data )
1159 {
1160  // setup the state in preparation for being in skating mode next object update
1161 
1162  // reset all flags except FLIPPED
1163  ResetFlags();
1164 
1165  if (to_ground_state)
1166  {
1167  SetState(GROUND);
1168  m_previous_state = GROUND;
1169  }
1170  else
1171  {
1172  SetState(AIR);
1173  m_previous_state = AIR;
1174 
1175  // no in-air orientation control after walking
1176  SetFlagTrue(NO_ORIENTATION_CONTROL);
1177 
1178  if (mp_walk_component->m_disallow_acid_drops)
1179  {
1180  SetFlagTrue(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
1181  }
1182  }
1183 
1184  m_state_change_timestamp = Tmr::GetTime();
1185 
1186  ResetLerpingMatrix();
1187 
1188  m_display_normal = m_last_display_normal = m_current_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
1189 
1190  GetOldPos() = m_safe_pos = GetPos();
1191 
1192  // bit nasty, prevents us getting "SKATE_OFF_EDGE" triggers
1193  m_last_ground_feeler.SetTrigger(0);
1194 
1195  m_wall_push_radius = 0.0f;
1196 
1197  m_tense_time = 0;
1198 
1199  mWallrideTime = 0;
1200 
1201  mNoSpin = false;
1202 
1203  // m_bail = false;
1204 
1205  m_force_cankick_off = false;
1206  m_pressing_down_brakes = true;
1207 
1208  mp_state_component->mJumpedOutOfLipTrick = false;
1209 
1210  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
1211  m_transfer_overrides_factor = 1.0f;
1212 
1213  m_last_wallplant_time_stamp = 0;
1214  m_last_wallpush_time_stamp = 0;
1215 
1216  m_last_jump_time_stamp = 0;
1217 
1218  // handle special transitions
1219  if (p_rail_data)
1220  {
1221  // TT8717. If walker had a movable contact, but that contact was not the same as the object containing the relavent rail manager component,
1222  // the skater was asserting in do_rail_physics. We need to lose any old contact and acquire the appropriate contact.
1223  mp_movable_contact_component->LoseAnyContact();
1224  if (p_rail_data->p_movable_contact)
1225  {
1226  mp_movable_contact_component->ObtainContact(p_rail_data->p_movable_contact);
1227  }
1228  got_rail(p_rail_data->rail_pos, p_rail_data->p_node, p_rail_data->p_rail_man, true, true);
1229  GetOldPos() = m_safe_pos = GetPos();
1230  }
1231  else if (p_acid_drop_data)
1232  {
1233  enter_acid_drop(*p_acid_drop_data);
1234  }
1235 
1236  #if 0
1237  const char* p_state_names [ ] =
1238  {
1239  "GROUND",
1240  "AIR",
1241  "WALL",
1242  "LIP",
1243  "RAIL",
1244  "WALLPLANT"
1245  };
1246  DUMPS(p_state_names[GetState()]);
1247  #endif
1248 }
1249 
1250 /******************************************************************/
1251 /* */
1252 /* */
1253 /******************************************************************/
1254 
1255 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::CleanUpSkateState ( )
1256 {
1257  if (m_vert_air_last_frame)
1258  {
1259  m_vert_air_last_frame = false;
1260  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0x5e27200a, "SkaterExitVertAir"));
1261  }
1262 
1263  // longer rerail delay when walking
1264  m_rerail_time = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe4412eb7, "Rail_walk_rerail_time")));
1265 
1266  // lip time counts towards rerail delay when walking
1267  if (m_lip_time > m_rail_time)
1268  {
1269  m_rail_time = m_lip_time;
1270  }
1271 
1272  // no grinding from walking after jumping out of a lip
1273  if (GetState() == AIR && m_previous_state == LIP)
1274  {
1275  SetFlagFalse(CAN_RERAIL);
1276  }
1277 
1278  // Extra clean up so that an observing camera will act OK while walking. Note that observing cameras always use skater camera logic, even when the
1279  // observed player is walking.
1280  mp_state_component->m_state = GROUND;
1281  mp_state_component->m_camera_display_normal.Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
1282  mp_state_component->m_camera_current_normal.Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
1283  mp_state_component->m_spine_vel.Set();
1284  mp_state_component->mJumpedOutOfLipTrick = false;
1285 }
1286 
1287 /******************************************************************/
1288 /* */
1289 /* */
1290 /******************************************************************/
1291 
1292 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::ResetFlags ( )
1293 {
1294  // reset all flags except FLIPPED
1295  for (int flag = NUM_ESKATERFLAGS; flag--; )
1296  {
1297  ESkaterFlag skater_flag = static_cast< ESkaterFlag >(flag);
1298  if (skater_flag == FLIPPED) continue;
1299  SetFlagTrue(skater_flag);
1300  SetFlagFalse(skater_flag);
1301  }
1302 }
1303 
1304 /******************************************************************/
1305 /* */
1306 /* */
1307 /******************************************************************/
1308 
1309 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::SetState ( EStateType state )
1310 {
1311  if (mp_state_component->m_state != state)
1312  {
1313  m_state_change_timestamp = Tmr::GetTime();
1314  m_previous_state = mp_state_component->m_state;
1315  }
1316 
1317  // if going out of lip state, and previous lip pos is valid (not zero), then move back to the previous lip position (so we drop down nicely)
1318  if (mp_state_component->m_state == LIP
1319  && state != LIP
1320  && (m_pre_lip_pos[X] != 0.0f || m_pre_lip_pos[Y] != 0.0f || m_pre_lip_pos[Z] != 0.0f))
1321  {
1322  // *** (SetState(LIP)) kind of nasty, but we want to allow them to move through the lip
1323  // we leave m_old_trigger_pos alone
1324  GetPos() = m_pre_lip_pos;
1325  GetOldPos() = GetPos();
1326  DUMP_POSITION;
1327  }
1328 
1329  // If setting the state to anything other than lip then kill the pre_lip_pos
1330  if (state != LIP)
1331  {
1332  m_pre_lip_pos.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1333  }
1334 
1335  if (state != GROUND)
1336  {
1337  // start recording graffiti tricks
1338  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted( true );
1339  }
1340 
1341  if (mp_state_component->m_state == RAIL && state != RAIL)
1342  {
1343  SetFlagFalse(RAIL_SLIDING);
1344  }
1345 
1346  if (mp_state_component->m_state == AIR && state != AIR)
1347  {
1348  // If going from AIR to any other state, record the landing time. Required for the AirTimeLessThan and AirTimeGreaterThan functions.
1349  m_landed_time = Tmr::GetTime();
1350 
1351  SetFlagFalse(NO_ORIENTATION_CONTROL);
1352  SetFlagFalse(OLLIED_FROM_RAIL);
1353  }
1354  else if (mp_state_component->m_state != AIR && state == AIR)
1355  {
1356  // If going to AIR, record the takeoff time, unless going from WALL to AIR.
1357  // (The 'unless' bit fixes TT493, where hitting the ground from doing a wall-ride was not setting a big enough airtime)
1358  if (mp_state_component->m_state != WALL)
1359  {
1360  m_went_airborne_time = Tmr::GetTime();
1361  }
1362 
1363  // Reset the spin tracking stuff.
1364  mp_trick_component->mTallyAngles = 0.0f;
1365 
1366  // Clear the L1 and R1 triggers, since they're used for spin taps.
1367  mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_L1.ClearTrigger();
1368  mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_R1.ClearTrigger();
1369  // Just to be sure
1370  m_tap_turns = 0.0f;
1371  }
1372 
1373  mp_state_component->m_state = state;
1374 
1375  mp_sound_component->SetState(state);
1376 }
1377 
1378 /******************************************************************/
1379 /* */
1380 /* */
1381 /******************************************************************/
1382 
1383 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::ReverseFacing ( )
1384 {
1385  GetMatrix()[Z] = -GetMatrix()[Z];
1386  GetMatrix()[X] = -GetMatrix()[X];
1387  ResetLerpingMatrix();
1388  mRail_Backwards = !mRail_Backwards;
1389 
1390  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1391  if (DebugSkaterScripts && GetObject()->GetType() == SKATE_TYPE_SKATER)
1392  {
1393  printf("%d: Rotating skater\n", (int) Tmr::GetRenderFrame());
1394  }
1395  #endif
1396 }
1397 
1398 /******************************************************************/
1399 /* */
1400 /* */
1401 /******************************************************************/
1402 
1403 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::CollideWithOtherSkaterLost ( CCompositeObject* p_other_skater )
1404 {
1405  // reset all flags except FLIPPED
1406  ResetFlags();
1407 
1408  SetState(AIR);
1409 }
1410 
1411 /******************************************************************/
1412 /* */
1413 /* */
1414 /******************************************************************/
1415 
1416 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::limit_speed ( )
1417 {
1418  float save_y = GetVel()[Y];
1419  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
1420 
1421  float speed = GetVel().Length();
1422  float max_max_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat"));
1423  float max_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x2eacddb3, "Skater_Max_Speed_Stat"));
1424 
1425  if (m_override_limits_time != 0.0f)
1426  {
1427  // -1.0f is a magic number causing no time limit
1428  if (m_override_limits_time != -1.0f)
1429  {
1430  m_override_limits_time -= m_frame_length;
1431  if (m_override_limits_time < 0.0f)
1432  {
1433  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
1434  }
1435  }
1436  max_max_speed = m_override_max_max;
1437  max_speed = m_override_max;
1438  }
1439 
1440  if (speed > max_max_speed)
1441  {
1442  speed = max_max_speed;
1443  GetVel().Normalize(speed);
1444  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1445  }
1446 
1447  if (speed > max_speed)
1448  {
1449  apply_wind_resistance(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x850eb87a, "Physics_Heavy_Air_Friction")));
1450  }
1451 
1452  GetVel()[Y] = save_y;
1453 
1454  // decrement the special friction counter
1455  if (m_special_friction_duration != 0.0f)
1456  {
1457  m_special_friction_duration -= m_frame_length;
1458  if (m_special_friction_duration <= 0.0f)
1459  {
1460  // reset the special friction to default
1461  m_special_friction_duration = 0.0f;
1462  m_rolling_friction = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78f80ec4, "Physics_Rolling_Friction"));
1463  }
1464  }
1465 }
1466 
1467 /******************************************************************/
1468 /* */
1469 /* */
1470 /******************************************************************/
1471 
1472 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::apply_wind_resistance ( float friction )
1473 {
1474  // air friction is proportional to the square of the velocity; this is a limiting friction, and has much more effect at high speeds
1475  float speed_squared = GetVel().LengthSqr();
1476  if (speed_squared < 0.00001f) return;
1477 
1478  Mth::Vector air_friction = GetVel();
1479  air_friction.Normalize(friction * 60.0f * m_frame_length * speed_squared);
1480 
1481  if (air_friction.LengthSqr() > speed_squared)
1482  {
1483  GetVel().Set();
1484  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1485  }
1486  else
1487  {
1488  GetVel() -= air_friction;
1489  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1490  }
1491 }
1492 
1493 /******************************************************************/
1494 /* */
1495 /* */
1496 /******************************************************************/
1497 
1498 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_on_ground_physics ( )
1499 {
1500  // clear any flags that have no meaning when on the ground
1501  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
1502  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
1503  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
1504  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
1505  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
1506  SetFlagFalse(IN_RECOVERY);
1507  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
1508 
1509  // ground skateing will cancel any memory of what rail we were on, so the next one seems fresh
1510  mp_rail_node = NULL;
1511  m_last_rail_trigger_node_name = 0;
1512 
1513  // rotate velocity, so it lays in the plane we are on: (as skaters orientation can lag behind)
1514  // Dave note: calling RotateToPlane() with too small |vector| causes Nan problems - fix at some point.
1515  if( GetVel().Length() > 0.001f )
1516  {
1517  GetVel().RotateToPlane(m_current_normal);
1518  }
1519 
1520  // get gravitational force
1521  Mth::Vector gravity(0.0f, GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x6618a713, "Physics_Ground_Gravity")), 0.0f);
1522 
1523  // allow for override if we are going up the slope (we might want to set gravity to zero when rolling up a slope)
1524  if (m_override_limits_time != 0.0f && GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f)
1525  {
1526  gravity.Set(0.0f, m_override_down_gravity, 0.0f);
1527  }
1528 
1529  // project gravity onto the plane we are on
1530  gravity.ProjectToPlane(m_current_normal);
1531 
1532  // add gravity into our velocity, adjusting for time
1533  GetVel() += gravity * m_frame_length;
1534  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1535 
1536  // based on if we are doing a balance trick, then either handle braking/kicking, or do the balance physics
1537  switch (mp_balance_trick_component->mBalanceTrickType)
1538  {
1539  case 0:
1540  // Only do braking & speeding up when not doing a balance trick like a manual
1541  if (is_trying_to_brake())
1542  {
1543  do_brake();
1544  }
1545  else
1546  {
1547  m_braking = false;
1548  if (can_kick())
1549  {
1550  do_kick();
1551  }
1552  }
1553  break;
1554 
1555  case CRCC(0xac90769, "NoseManual"):
1556  case CRCC(0xef24413b, "Manual"):
1557  m_braking = false;
1558 
1559  mp_balance_trick_component->mManual.DoManualPhysics();
1560 
1561  // start recording graffiti tricks
1562  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted(true);
1563 
1564  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->GetCheat(CRCD(0xb38341c9, "CHEAT_PERFECT_MANUAL")))
1565  {
1566  // Here, set the flag. It may seem redundant, but the above line is very likely
1567  // to be hacked by gameshark. They probably won't notice this one, which will
1568  // set the flags as if they had actually enabled the cheat -- which enables us
1569  // to detect that it has been turned on more easily.
1570  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->SetGlobalFlag( Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0xb38341c9, "CHEAT_PERFECT_MANUAL")));
1571  mp_balance_trick_component->mManual.mManualLean = 0.0f;
1572  mp_balance_trick_component->mManual.mManualLeanDir = 0.0f;
1573  g_CheatsEnabled = true;
1574  }
1575  break;
1576 
1577  case CRCC(0x3506ce64, "Skitch"):
1578  mp_balance_trick_component->mSkitch.DoManualPhysics();
1579  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->GetCheat(CRCD(0x69a1ce96, "CHEAT_PERFECT_SKITCH")))
1580  {
1581  // Here, set the flag. It may seem redundant, but the above line is very likely
1582  // to be hacked by gameshark. They probably won't notice this one, which will
1583  // set the flags as if they had actually enabled the cheat -- which enables us
1584  // to detect that it has been turned on more easily.
1585  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->SetGlobalFlag( Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x69a1ce96, "CHEAT_PERFECT_SKITCH")));
1586  mp_balance_trick_component->mSkitch.mManualLean = 0.0f;
1587  mp_balance_trick_component->mSkitch.mManualLeanDir = 0.0f;
1588  g_CheatsEnabled = true;
1589  }
1590  break;
1591 
1592  case CRCC(0x255ed86f, "Grind"):
1593  case CRCC(0x8d10119d, "Slide"):
1594  {
1595  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1596  CSkaterEndRunComponent* p_endrun_component = GetSkaterEndRunComponentFromObject(GetObject());
1597  Dbg_Assert(p_endrun_component);
1598  Dbg_MsgAssert(!p_endrun_component->IsEndingRun() || !p_endrun_component->RunHasEnded(), ("Grind balance trick done on ground?"));
1599  #endif
1600  break;
1601  }
1602 
1603  case CRCC(0xa549b57b, "Lip"):
1604  {
1605  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1606  CSkaterEndRunComponent* p_endrun_component = GetSkaterEndRunComponentFromObject(GetObject());
1607  Dbg_Assert(p_endrun_component);
1608  Dbg_MsgAssert(!p_endrun_component->IsEndingRun() || !p_endrun_component->RunHasEnded(), ("Lip balance trick done on ground?"));
1609  #endif
1610  break;
1611  }
1612 
1613  default:
1614  {
1615  Dbg_Assert(false);
1616  break;
1617  }
1618  }
1619 
1620  // Ground friction is rolling friction + wind resistance
1621  // Update velocity for friction before using velocity
1622  handle_ground_friction();
1623 
1624  // if too close to a wall, then adjust velocity to move the skater away from it
1625  // the distance that is checked can be changed by script, and probably gets big in bails, to stop the skater clipping through walls
1626  push_away_from_walls();
1627 
1628  // Calculate how much we want to move, based on the velocity
1629  Mth::Vector m_movement = GetVel() * m_frame_length;
1630 
1631  // when skitching, we get sucked into the skitch point
1632  if (GetFlag(SKITCHING))
1633  {
1634  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact() && mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject())
1635  {
1636  GetVel() = mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject()->GetVel() * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xdef25b34, "skitch_speed_match"));
1637  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1638  }
1639  m_movement.Set();
1640  move_to_skitch_point();
1641  }
1642 
1643  // if we are in contact with something, then factor in that "movement," but not if (we are skitching, and in not in initial movement)
1644  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos())) // still need to update it every frame, otherwise it gets confused
1645  {
1646  if (!GetFlag(SKITCHING))
1647  {
1648  // handle movement due to contact seperately from normal physic movement
1649 
1650  GetPos() += mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
1651  GetOldPos() = GetPos(); // (WITH CONTACT) frig, as movement is due to something carying us, no need to incorporate that into collision
1652  m_safe_pos = GetPos(); // (WITH CONTACT) frig, as movement is due to something carying us, no need to incorporate that into collision
1653  DUMP_POSITION;
1654 
1655  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->IsRotated())
1656  {
1657  GetMatrix() *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
1658  m_lerping_display_matrix *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
1659  }
1660  }
1661 
1662  }
1663 
1664  // set "move_again" flag, for while loop
1665  // generally this will be cleared after the first time through the loop
1666  // but it can be set again, indicating that out movmeent was brought short
1667  // by hitting a curver surface that we can track around (like a Qp)
1668  bool move_again = true;
1669 
1670  // we only let them move again once
1671  // so we have a flag that says if we have already done it this frame
1672  bool already_moved_again = false;
1673 
1674  while (move_again)
1675  {
1676  move_again = false;
1677 
1678  Mth::Vector start_pos = GetPos(); // remember where we started on this iteration
1679  GetPos() += m_movement; // Move him
1680  DUMP_POSITION;
1681 
1682  // Handle collisions //////////////////////////////////////////////
1683  if (!GetFlag(SKITCHING)) // if skitching, then dont bother with forward collision
1684  {
1685  handle_forward_collision();
1686  }
1687 
1688 
1689  // Mick - removed the test for m_moving_to_skitch for now
1690  // as we want the cars to be able to drag the player over gaps and jumps
1691  // and it does not seem to look bad this way
1692  // the only problem might be during very abrupt cahnges in ground angle,
1693  // or maybe very uneven ground
1694  if (GetFlag(SKITCHING) /* && m_moving_to_skitch*/)
1695  {
1696  // moving to skitch point, so don't snap to ground, as
1697  // we might snap onto the vehicle
1698  // instead, just project the skater onto the plane of the car
1699 
1700  // Dan: We still need to update terrain, however
1701  m_feeler.m_start = GetPos() + 36.0f * GetMatrix()[Y];
1702  m_feeler.m_end = GetPos() - 200.0f * GetMatrix()[Y];
1703  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
1704  {
1705  set_terrain(m_feeler.GetTerrain());
1706  }
1707  }
1708  else
1709  {
1710  snap_to_ground();
1711  }
1712 
1713  // now see how far we have moved
1714  // interestingly we often move more than we are supposed to
1715  // probably due to the "snap to ground" stuff.
1716  Mth::Vector actual_movement_vector;
1717  actual_movement_vector = GetPos() - start_pos;
1718  float actual_distance_moved = actual_movement_vector.Length();
1719  float attempted_distance = m_movement.Length();
1720 
1721  if (!already_moved_again && GetState() == GROUND)
1722  {
1723  if (actual_distance_moved < (attempted_distance - 0.1f))
1724  {
1725  m_movement = GetVel();
1726  m_movement.Normalize(); // get new direction of travel
1727  m_movement *= attempted_distance; // at old speed
1728  m_movement *= 1.0f - actual_distance_moved / attempted_distance; // scale to account for movement
1729  move_again = true;
1730  already_moved_again = true;
1731  }
1732  }
1733  }
1734 
1735  // The remaining "ground physics" should only be done if we are still on the ground (might have skated off it)
1736  if (GetState() == GROUND)
1737  {
1738  handle_ground_rotation();
1739 
1740  // don't let the board slide sideways
1741  // K: Avoid anything that might change the velocity direction if this flag is set.
1742  if (!m_lock_velocity_direction)
1743  {
1744  remove_sideways_velocity(GetVel());
1745  }
1746 
1747  if (!GetFlag(SKITCHING))
1748  {
1749  // check if we are too close to a wall, and pop us out and away
1750  check_side_collisions();
1751 
1752  // check if we are moving slowly and leaning, and mush us more away from a wall if so
1753  check_leaning_into_wall();
1754  }
1755 
1756  // K: This flag is to allow the skater to be rotated on the ground without affecting his
1757  // velocity direction, so also disable the flipping otherwise 360 rotations won't be possible.
1758  if (!m_lock_velocity_direction)
1759  {
1760  // might have gone upa slope, and gravity pulled us down, so we are not skating backwards
1761  flip_if_skating_backwards();
1762  }
1763 
1764  // Check for jumping
1765  if (maybe_flag_ollie_exception())
1766  {
1767  maybe_straight_up();
1768  SetFlagTrue(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
1769  }
1770 
1771  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_last_ground_feeler.GetNodeChecksum());
1772 
1773  m_tap_turns = 0.0f;
1774  }
1775 
1776  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1777  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3ae85eef, "skater_trails")))
1778  {
1779  Gfx::AddDebugLine(GetPos() + m_current_normal, GetOldPos() + m_current_normal, GREEN, 0, 0);
1780  }
1781  #endif
1782 }
1783 
1784 /******************************************************************/
1785 /* */
1786 /* */
1787 /******************************************************************/
1788 
1789 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::is_trying_to_brake ( )
1790 {
1791  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
1792 
1793  // if not autokick, and not accelerating (square pressed), and going slow, then brake
1794  if (!m_auto_kick && !control_pad.m_square.GetPressed() && GetVel().Length() < 50.0f)
1795  {
1796  return true;
1797  }
1798 
1799  return control_pad.m_down.GetPressed() // Down must be pressed
1800  && m_pressing_down_brakes // and must be enabled
1801  &&
1802  (
1803  GetVel().Length() < 50.0f // and either going really slow
1804  ||
1805  (
1806  !control_pad.m_right.GetPressed() // or not pressed right or left
1807  &&
1808  !control_pad.m_left.GetPressed()
1809  )
1810  ||
1811  ( // or going backwards
1812  Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), GetMatrix()[Z]) < 0.0f
1813  )
1814  );
1815 }
1816 
1817 /******************************************************************/
1818 /* */
1819 /* */
1820 /******************************************************************/
1821 
1822 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_brake ( )
1823 {
1824  // Handle braking
1825 
1826  m_braking = true;
1827 
1828  if (on_steep_slow_slope())
1829  {
1830  m_braking = false;
1831  return;
1832  }
1833 
1834  float speed = GetVel().Length();
1835 
1836  // if already really slow (or stopped), then just stop
1837  if (speed < GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe5d73f6f, "Physics_Brake_Acceleration")) * 2.0f * m_frame_length)
1838  {
1839  GetVel().Set();
1840  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1841  }
1842  else
1843  {
1844  #if 0 // old code, this check doesn't seem necessary given the above if branch; Dan
1845  // Mth::Vector forward = GetVel();
1846  // forward.Normalize();
1847  // forward *= -PHYSICS_BRAKE_ACCELERATION;
1848  // Mth::Vector old_vel = GetVel(); // remember old velocity
1849  // m_vel += forward * m_frame_length; // apply braking force
1850  // if (Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), old_vel) < 0.0f) // if the velocty now in other direction
1851  // {
1852  // GetVel().Set(); // then clear it to zero velocity
1853  // }
1854  #else
1855  Mth::Vector brake = GetVel();
1856  brake.Normalize(-GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe5d73f6f, "Physics_Brake_Acceleration")) * m_frame_length);
1857  GetVel() += brake;
1858  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1859  #endif
1860  }
1861 }
1862 
1863 /******************************************************************/
1864 /* */
1865 /* */
1866 /******************************************************************/
1867 
1868 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::on_steep_slow_slope ( )
1869 {
1870  float speed = GetVel().Length();
1871  if (speed < GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x62a1fa03,"Skater_max_sloped_turn_speed"))
1872  && m_current_normal[Y] < GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xc3527ef2, "Skater_max_sloped_turn_cosine")))
1873  {
1874  return true;
1875  }
1876  return false;
1877 }
1878 
1879 /******************************************************************/
1880 /* */
1881 /* */
1882 /******************************************************************/
1883 
1884 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::can_kick ( )
1885 {
1886  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
1887 
1888  if (m_force_cankick_off)
1889  {
1890  return false;
1891  }
1892 
1893  // don't allow kicking if autokick is off and square not pressed
1894  if (!m_auto_kick && !control_pad.m_square.GetPressed())
1895  {
1896  return false;
1897  }
1898 
1899  // don't allow kicking (accelerating) if "down" is pressed
1900  // as we would either be braking or sharp turning
1901  if (control_pad.m_down.GetPressed())
1902  {
1903  return false;
1904  }
1905 
1906  float speed = GetVel().Length();
1907 
1908  if (!GetFlag(TENSE))
1909  {
1910  if (speed > GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4610c2e3, "Skater_Max_Standing_Kick_Speed_Stat")))
1911  {
1912  return false;
1913  }
1914  }
1915  else
1916  {
1917  if (speed > GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x92e0247c, "Skater_Max_Crouched_Kick_Speed_Stat")))
1918  {
1919  return false;
1920  }
1921  }
1922 
1923  Dbg_Assert(m_auto_kick || control_pad.m_square.GetPressed());
1924 
1925  return true;
1926 }
1927 
1928 /******************************************************************/
1929 /* */
1930 /* */
1931 /******************************************************************/
1932 
1933 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_kick ( )
1934 {
1935  // Get skater's forward direction
1936  Mth::Vector forward;
1937 
1938  // K: Avoid anything that might change the velocity direction if this flag is set.
1939  if (m_lock_velocity_direction)
1940  {
1941  forward = GetVel();
1942 
1943  // Make sure the skater doesn't get stuck unable to move.
1944  if (forward.Length() < 0.5f)
1945  {
1946  forward = GetMatrix()[Z];
1947  }
1948  else
1949  {
1950  forward.Normalize();
1951  }
1952  }
1953  else
1954  {
1955  forward = GetMatrix()[Z];
1956  }
1957 
1958  if (GetFlag(TENSE))
1959  {
1960  forward *= GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x3d24128e, "Physics_crouching_Acceleration_stat"));
1961  }
1962  else
1963  {
1964  forward *= GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x5f9b864d, "Physics_Standing_Acceleration_stat"));
1965  }
1966 
1967  // apply to velocity
1968  GetVel() += forward * m_frame_length;
1969  DUMP_VELOCITY;
1970 }
1971 
1972 /******************************************************************/
1973 /* */
1974 /* */
1975 /******************************************************************/
1976 
1977 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_ground_friction ( )
1978 {
1979  // Apply the various type of friction that are acting when on the ground
1980 
1981  // if no autokick, and we are not bailing, and we have default friction then don't apply any friction
1982  // as it sucks to slow down when you do not have autokick
1983  if (!m_auto_kick && !GetFlag(IS_BAILING) && m_rolling_friction == GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78f80ec4, "Physics_Rolling_Friction")))
1984  {
1985  // autokick friction
1986  // currently none
1987  }
1988  else
1989  {
1990  // non-autokick friction
1991  handle_wind_resistance();
1992  handle_rolling_resistance();
1993  }
1994 }
1995 
1996 /******************************************************************/
1997 /* */
1998 /* */
1999 /******************************************************************/
2000 
2001 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_wind_resistance ( )
2002 {
2003  // Wind resistance differs, based on if we are crouched or not (as when we are crouched, we have a lower profile, so less wind resistance)
2004 
2005  float crouched_friction = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbed96eda, "Physics_Crouched_Air_Friction"));
2006  float standing_friction = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1a78b6fc, "Physics_Standing_Air_Friction"));
2007 
2008  if (m_override_limits_time != 0.0f)
2009  {
2010  crouched_friction = m_override_air_friction;
2011  standing_friction = m_override_air_friction;
2012  }
2013 
2014  if (GetFlag(TENSE))
2015  {
2016  apply_wind_resistance(crouched_friction);
2017  }
2018  else
2019  {
2020  apply_wind_resistance(standing_friction);
2021  }
2022 }
2023 
2024 /******************************************************************/
2025 /* */
2026 /* */
2027 /******************************************************************/
2028 
2029 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_rolling_resistance ( )
2030 {
2031  // Only have rolling resistance if we are not going slow on a steep slope.
2032  if (!slide_off_slow_steep_slope())
2033  {
2034  apply_rolling_friction();
2035  }
2036 }
2037 
2038 /******************************************************************/
2039 /* */
2040 /* */
2041 /******************************************************************/
2042 
2043 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::slide_off_slow_steep_slope ( )
2044 {
2045  // If we are on very steep ground and moving slowly then do not allow the skater to brake
2046  if (on_steep_slow_slope())
2047  {
2048  float speed = GetVel().Length();
2049 
2050  Mth::Vector forward;
2051  if (speed < 0.001f)
2052  {
2053  forward = GetMatrix()[Z];
2054  }
2055  else
2056  {
2057  forward = GetVel();
2058 
2059  }
2060 
2061  Mth::Vector fall(0.0f, -1.0f, 0.0f);
2062  fall.ProjectToPlane(m_current_normal);
2063 
2064  float angle = Mth::GetAngleAbout(forward, fall, GetMatrix()[Y]);
2065  float rot = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x7dd5678b, "Skater_Slow_Turn_on_slopes")) * Mth::Sgn(angle) * m_frame_length;
2066  if (Mth::Abs(rot) > Mth::Abs(angle))
2067  {
2068  // just about done, so just turn the last bit of angle left
2069  rot = angle;
2070  }
2071  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(rot);
2072  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(rot);
2073 
2074  return true;
2075  }
2076 
2077  return false;
2078 }
2079 
2080 /******************************************************************/
2081 /* */
2082 /* */
2083 /******************************************************************/
2084 
2085 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::apply_rolling_friction ( )
2086 {
2087  // apply a constant braking friction; if the velocity reaches 0, then we will stop (and not change direction)
2088  // This funtion will typically be used for rolling resistance
2089 
2090  // rolling friction is a constant, and is mostly noticable at slow speeds
2091  // if your speed is less than that produced by the force of rolling friction, then you will abruptly stop
2092  Mth::Vector rolling_friction = GetVel();
2093  float length = rolling_friction.Length();
2094 
2095  if (length < 0.0001f)
2096  {
2097  GetVel().Set();
2098  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2099  return;
2100  }
2101 
2102  rolling_friction *= 60.0f * m_rolling_friction * m_frame_length / length;
2103 
2104  if (rolling_friction.LengthSqr() > length * length)
2105  {
2106  GetVel().Set();
2107  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2108  }
2109  else
2110  {
2111  GetVel() -= rolling_friction;
2112  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2113  }
2114 }
2115 
2116 /******************************************************************/
2117 /* */
2118 /* */
2119 /******************************************************************/
2120 
2121 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::push_away_from_walls ( )
2122 {
2123  if (!m_wall_push_radius || !m_wall_push_speed) return;
2124 
2125  m_wall_push.Set();
2126  m_wall_dist = 1.0f;
2127 
2128  Mth::Vector start, end;
2129 
2130  start = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xb45b39e2, "Skater_side_collide_height"));
2131 
2132  end = start + GetMatrix()[X] * m_wall_push_radius;
2133  check_for_wall_push(start, end, 0);
2134 
2135  end = start - GetMatrix()[X] * m_wall_push_radius;
2136  check_for_wall_push(start, end, 1);
2137 
2138  end = start + GetMatrix()[Z] * m_wall_push_radius;
2139  check_for_wall_push(start, end, 2);
2140 
2141  end = start - GetMatrix()[Z] * m_wall_push_radius;
2142  check_for_wall_push(start, end, 3);
2143 
2144  if (m_wall_dist == 1.0f) return;
2145 
2146  float push_speed = m_wall_push_speed * (1.0f - m_wall_dist);
2147  m_wall_push.Normalize(push_speed);
2148  GetVel() += m_wall_push;
2149  GetVel().RotateToPlane(m_current_normal);
2150  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2151 
2152  // if facing into the wall, then rotate away from it
2153  if (Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], m_feeler.GetNormal()) < 0.0f)
2154  {
2155  Mth::Vector target = GetMatrix()[Z];
2156  target.RotateToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal());
2157  float angle = Mth::GetAngleAbout(GetMatrix()[Z], target, GetMatrix()[Y]);
2158 
2159  float rot = m_wall_rotate_speed * Mth::Sgn(angle) * m_frame_length;
2160  if (Mth::Abs(rot) > Mth::Abs(angle))
2161  {
2162  // just about done, so just turn the last bit of angle left
2163  rot = angle;
2164  }
2165  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(rot);
2166  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(rot);
2167  }
2168 }
2169 
2170 /******************************************************************/
2171 /* */
2172 /* */
2173 /******************************************************************/
2174 
2175 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_for_wall_push ( const Mth::Vector& start, const Mth::Vector& end, int index )
2176 {
2177  // do not allow a push in this direction until a push in any other direction has NOT happenend for half a second
2178  // this should prevent the nasty flickering
2179  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
2180  {
2181  if (i == index) continue;
2182 
2183  // get time for opposite direction
2184  Tmr::Time t = Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_push_time[index ^ 1]);
2185 
2186  if (t > 500)
2187  {
2188  return;
2189  }
2190  }
2191 
2192  m_col_start = start;
2193  m_col_end = end;
2194 
2195  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
2196  {
2197  m_wall_push += m_feeler.GetNormal();
2198  if (m_feeler.GetDist() < m_wall_dist)
2199  {
2200  m_wall_dist = m_feeler.GetDist();
2201  }
2202  m_push_time[index] = Tmr::GetTime();
2203  }
2204 }
2205 
2206 /******************************************************************/
2207 /* */
2208 /* */
2209 /******************************************************************/
2210 
2211 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::move_to_skitch_point ( )
2212 {
2213 
2214  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
2215 
2216  if (!mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact() || !mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject())
2217  {
2218  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x47d44b84, "OffMeterBottom"));
2219  return;
2220  }
2221 
2222  CCompositeObject* p_skitch_object = mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject();
2223 
2224  CSkitchComponent* p_skitch_comp = GetSkitchComponentFromObject(p_skitch_object);
2225  Dbg_Assert(p_skitch_comp);
2226 
2228  // Do moving between the skitch nodes
2229  // if L1 or R1 pressed
2230  // Basically we just look for nodes to the left or right of us at a
2231  // one foot interval
2232  // up a a maximum of 10 feet
2233  // if one is found, then switch the m_node_index to that node
2234 
2235  float dir = 0.0f;
2236 
2237  if (control_pad.m_L1.GetTriggered())
2238  {
2239  control_pad.m_L1.ClearTrigger();
2240  dir = 1.0f;
2241  }
2242 
2243  if (control_pad.m_R1.GetTriggered())
2244  {
2245  control_pad.m_R1.ClearTrigger();
2246  dir = -1.0f;
2247  }
2248 
2249  if (control_pad.m_L2.GetTriggered())
2250  {
2251  control_pad.m_L2.ClearTrigger();
2252  dir = 1.0f;
2253  }
2254 
2255  if (control_pad.m_R2.GetTriggered())
2256  {
2257  control_pad.m_R2.ClearTrigger();
2258  dir = -1.0f;
2259  }
2260 
2261  // if moving, and either was not moving or moving in opposite direction, then we can actually try looking for a node
2262  if (dir != 0.0f && (!m_moving_to_skitch || dir != m_skitch_dir))
2263  {
2264  float len = 6.0f;
2265  float step = 6.0f;
2266  float max = 12.0f * 10.0f;
2267  while (len < max)
2268  {
2269  // get an offset to the right or left
2270  Mth::Vector offset = GetMatrix()[X]; // X points left, from the camera's POV
2271  offset *= len * dir;
2272  Mth::Vector test_pos = GetPos() + offset;
2273 
2274  // see if there is a skitch point there
2275  Mth::Vector dummy(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
2276  int index = p_skitch_comp->GetNearestSkitchPoint(&dummy, test_pos);
2277 
2278  // if there is, then switch to that point
2279  if (index != m_skitch_index)
2280  {
2281  m_skitch_index = index;
2282  m_moving_to_skitch = true;
2283  m_skitch_dir = dir;
2284 
2285  if (dir == 1.0f)
2286  {
2287  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x74bf80cf, "SkitchLeft"));
2288  }
2289  else
2290  {
2291  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x2e7474b5, "SkitchRight"));
2292  }
2293  break;
2294  }
2295 
2296  len += step;
2297  }
2298  }
2299 
2300  //
2301  // end of moving between skitch nodes
2303 
2304  if (!mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact() || !GetFlag(SKITCHING)) return;
2305 
2307  // Do the actual movement
2308 
2309  Mth::Vector skitch_point;
2310  if (!p_skitch_comp->GetIndexedSkitchPoint( &skitch_point, m_skitch_index)) return;
2311 
2312  // zero out W component to prevent overflows (in theory this should not be necessary)
2313  GetPos()[W] = 0.0f;
2314 
2315  Mth::Vector target = skitch_point + GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x21fb182c, "skitch_offset")) * -p_skitch_object->GetMatrix()[Z];
2316 
2317  if (m_moving_to_skitch)
2318  {
2319  Mth::Vector con_move = mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
2320 
2321  GetPos() += con_move;
2322  DUMP_POSITION;
2323 
2324  Mth::Vector dir = target - GetPos();
2325  float dir_length_sqr = dir.LengthSqr();
2326  float suck_speed = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x97496256, "skitch_suck_speed")) * m_frame_length;
2327 
2328  // if skater is stuck in a wall, then end the skitch when car is fifteen feet away
2329  if (dir_length_sqr > FEET(15.0f) * FEET(15.0f))
2330  {
2331  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x47d44b84, "OffMeterBottom"));
2332  return;
2333  }
2334 
2335  if (dir_length_sqr <= suck_speed * suck_speed)
2336  {
2337  // we have arrived, so no need for sucking later
2338  GetPos() = target;
2339  m_moving_to_skitch = false;
2340  DUMP_POSITION;
2341  }
2342  else
2343  {
2344  dir *= suck_speed / sqrtf(dir_length_sqr);
2345  GetPos() += dir;
2346  DUMP_POSITION;
2347  }
2348  }
2349  else
2350  {
2351  GetPos() = target;
2352  DUMP_POSITION;
2353  }
2354 
2355  // Copy the objects Display matrix over the skater's
2356  // will orient the skater the same way as the thing that is dragging it, so if the car looks solid, then so should the skater...
2357  GetMatrix() = p_skitch_object->GetDisplayMatrix();
2358 
2359  // we also set the display matrix, to avoid little glitches
2360  ResetLerpingMatrix();
2361 }
2362 
2363 /******************************************************************/
2364 /* */
2365 /* */
2366 /******************************************************************/
2367 
2368 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_forward_collision ( )
2369 {
2370  if (GetPos() == GetOldPos()) return;
2371 
2372  Mth::Vector forward = GetPos() - GetOldPos();
2373  forward.Normalize();
2374 
2375  Mth::Vector up_offset = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd4205c9b, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Height"));
2376
