2377  m_col_start = GetOldPos() + up_offset;
2378 
2379  m_col_end = GetPos() + up_offset + forward * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x20102726, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Length"));
2380 
2381  if (!get_member_feeler_collision()) return;
2382 
2383  // we have hit something going forward
2384  // either it is a wall, and we need to bounce off it or it is a steep QP, and we need to stick to it.
2385  // (note, with the slow normal changing, then it is possible that we might even collide with the poly that we are on
2386 
2387  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
2388 
2389  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(normal, m_current_normal);
2390 
2391  // For fairly shallow curves, the dot between two normals will be pretty large
2392  // it's very important here to distinguish between a tight curve (like in a narrow QP) and a direct hit with a wall.
2393 
2394  if (!m_col_flag_skatable || Mth::Abs(dot) < 0.01f)
2395  {
2396  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_BONK, m_feeler);
2397  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
2398 
2399  bounce_off_wall(normal);
2400  }
2401  else
2402  {
2403  // it's a qp, stick to it
2404 
2405  // Just move our contact point to the point of collision. This is not right, as it could kill a lot of the movement for this frame
2406  // but should do for now (and stops you falling through)
2407  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint();
2408 
2409  // move it off the surface a little, so we are not IN it (which would be indeterminates as to which side)
2410  GetPos() += normal * 0.1f;
2411  DUMP_POSITION;
2412  }
2413 }
2414 
2415 /******************************************************************/
2416 /* */
2417 /* */
2418 /******************************************************************/
2419 
2420 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::bounce_off_wall ( const Mth::Vector& normal )
2421 {
2422  if (check_for_wallpush()) return;
2423 
2424  // Given the normal of the wall, then bounce off it, turning the skater away from the wall
2425 
2426  Mth::Vector forward = GetPos() - GetOldPos();
2427  Mth::Vector movement = forward; // remember how far we moved
2428  forward.Normalize();
2429 
2430  Mth::Vector up_offset = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd4205c9b,"Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Height"));
2431 
2432  float turn_angle;
2433  float angle = rotate_away_from_wall(normal, turn_angle);
2434 
2435  float min = Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1483fd01, "Wall_Bounce_Dont_Slow_Angle")));
2436 
2437  if (Mth::Abs(angle) > min)
2438  {
2439  float old_speed = GetVel().Length();
2440 
2441  // The maximum value of Abs(angle) would be PI/2 (90 degrees), so scale the velocity
2442  float x = Mth::Abs(angle) - min;
2443  x /= (Mth::PI / 2.0f) - min; // get in the range 0 .. 1
2444  x = 1.0f - x; // invert, as we want to stop when angle is 90
2445 
2446  GetVel() *= x;
2447  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2448 
2449  // if (negative ^ flipped) then backwards flail, otherwise forward flail
2450 
2451  if (old_speed > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbe0a58a0, "Wall_Bounce_Dont_Flail_Speed")))
2452  {
2453  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
2454  {
2455  Mth::Vector up_offset = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd4205c9b,"Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Height"));
2456  Mth::Vector start = up_offset+GetOldPos();
2457  Mth::Vector end = up_offset+GetPos();
2458  TrackingLine(1, start, end); // 1 = wall bounce flail
2459  }
2460  #endif
2461 
2462  if ((angle < 0.0f) ^ (GetFlag(FLIPPED)))
2463  {
2464  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0xb4101d70,"FlailLeft"));
2465  }
2466  else
2467  {
2468  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x756a7535,"FlailRight"));
2469  }
2470 
2471  // Player's terrain isn't set to the terrain in m_feeler, as this is a wall we're bouncing off of (or chain link fence or something)...
2472  // Steve: we gots ta figure out how to do this...
2473  // Perhaps have another terrain value sent to client skaters that tell them to play a bonk sound?
2474  mp_sound_component->PlayBonkSound( old_speed / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), m_feeler.GetTerrain());
2475  }
2476  }
2477 
2478  // Bit of a patch here to move the skater away from the wall
2479  // Not needed so much with new sideways collision checks but we keep it in for low ledges.
2480  // Should perhaps standardize the height so collision checks for side and front but we'd probably still have problems.
2481 
2482  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() - up_offset;
2483  GetPos() += normal * 6.0f;
2484  DUMP_POSITION;
2485 
2486  // Now the majority of cases have been taken care of; we need to see if the skater is going to get stuck in a corner.
2487 
2488  float old_speed = movement.Length(); // get how much we moved last time
2489  Mth::Vector next_movement = GetVel(); // get new direction of velocity
2490  forward = GetVel();
2491  forward.Normalize();
2492  next_movement = forward * old_speed; // extend by same movment as last time
2493 
2494  m_col_start = GetPos() + up_offset;
2495  m_col_start += up_offset;
2496 
2497  m_col_end = GetPos() + up_offset + next_movement
2498  + forward * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x20102726, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Length"));
2499 
2500  if (get_member_feeler_collision() && GetSkater()->IsLocalClient())
2501  {
2502  // Just rotating the skater will lead to another collision, so try just inverting the skater's velocity from it's original and halving it....
2503 
2504  // First reverse the rotation, and rotate 180 degrees
2505  GetVel().RotateY(Mth::DegToRad(180.0f) - turn_angle);
2506  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(Mth::DegToRad(180.0f) - turn_angle);
2507  ResetLerpingMatrix();
2508 
2509  GetVel() *= 0.5f;
2510  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2511 
2512  if (old_speed > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbe0a58a0, "Wall_Bounce_Dont_Flail_Speed")))
2513  {
2514  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0xb4101d70, "FlailLeft"));
2515  }
2516  }
2517 }
2518 
2519 /******************************************************************/
2520 /* */
2521 /* */
2522 /******************************************************************/
2523 
2524 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::snap_to_ground ( )
2525 {
2526  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
2527 
2528  float up_dot = 0.0f;
2529 
2530  // Since we really don't want to loose contact with the ground while skitching, we use a much bigger snap up dist
2531  // The problem will come when we get dragged down a slope. The car will flatten out well ahead of us, so pushing us down through the slop
2532  // (as we are a few feet behind it) and we will be so far under the ground that our normal snap up will not be able to dig us out of it,
2533  // so we go in air, uberfrig, and get dragged to a random spot under the level.
2534  // (This would not happen if we just skitch on flat ground)
2535 
2536  // Dan: snap_to_ground is never called while skitching
2537  // if (GetFlag(SKITCHING))
2538  // {
2539  // m_col_start = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x5c0d9610,"Physics_Ground_Snap_Up_SKITCHING")); // much above feet
2540  // }
2541  // else
2542  // {
2543  m_col_start = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe4d79235, "Physics_Ground_Snap_Up")); // bit above the feet
2544  // }
2545 
2546  m_col_end = GetMatrix()[Y] * -200.0f; // WAY! below the feet, we check distance later
2547 
2548  m_col_start += GetPos();
2549  m_col_end += GetPos();
2550 
2551  bool sticking = false;
2552  // get disatnce to ground and snap the skater to it, but only if the ground is skatable, otherwise we just go to "AIR"
2553  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
2554  {
2555  Mth::Vector movement = GetPos() - m_feeler.GetPoint();
2556  float drop_dist = movement.Length();
2557  float drop_sign = Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], movement); // might be approx +/- 0.00001f
2558  if (!m_col_flag_skatable)
2559  {
2560  // if below the face (or very close to it), then push us away from it
2561  if (drop_sign < 0.001f)
2562  {
2563  // at point of contact, and move away from surface
2564  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() + m_feeler.GetNormal();
2565  DUMP_POSITION;
2566  }
2567  }
2568  else
2569  {
2570  sticking = true;
2571 
2572  // Note the two ways of calculating the angle between two faces
2573  // the more "accurate" method simply takes angle between the two normals
2574  // however, this fails to account for the direction the skater is travelling
2575  // when in conjunction with the "snap" up.
2576  // If the skater approaches a slope from the side, then he can snap up to the slope
2577  // however, if the angle between the ground and the face to which we are snapping up to
2578  // is too great, then we transition to in-air
2579  // and will drop through the slope
2580  // the solution is to take the angle between the front vector rotated onto each face.
2581 
2582  // Firstly we check the angle between the two faces
2583  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
2584 
2585  Mth::Vector forward = GetMatrix()[Z];
2586  float front_dot = Mth::DotProduct(forward,normal);
2587 
2588  Mth::Vector old_forward = forward;
2589  forward.RotateToPlane(normal);
2590  old_forward.RotateToPlane(m_current_normal);
2591 
2592  // angle between front vectors, projected onto faces
2593  up_dot = Mth::DotProduct(forward, old_forward);
2594 
2595  float stick_angle_cosine;
2596  if (!control_pad.m_up.GetPressed())
2597  {
2598  stick_angle_cosine = cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xef161c2a, "Ground_stick_angle"))));
2599  }
2600  else
2601  {
2602  stick_angle_cosine = cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x4138283e, "Ground_stick_angle_forward"))));
2603  }
2604 
2605  if (front_dot > 0.0f && up_dot > 0.0f && up_dot < stick_angle_cosine)
2606  {
2607  sticking = false;
2608  }
2609  else
2610  {
2611  // only need to test if snap is downwards
2612  if (drop_sign > 0.0f)
2613  {
2614  // angle between the old plane and the new plane is either the same, or withing the set limits
2615  // (like, < 60 degrees, or so, see physics.q) now calculate the drop distance, based on the angle
2616 
2617 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
2618  float angle = acosf(Mth::Clamp(up_dot, -1.0f, 1.0f));
2619 #else
2620  float angle = acosf(up_dot);
2621 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
2622 
2623  Mth::Vector last_move = GetPos() - GetOldPos();
2624 
2625  float max_drop = last_move.Length() * tanf(angle);
2626 
2627  float min_drop = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x899ba3d0, "Physics_Ground_Snap_Down"));
2628  // if (GetFlag(SKITCHING))
2629  // {
2630  // min_drop = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x20df7e33, "Physics_Ground_Snap_Down_Skitching"));
2631  // }
2632 
2633  if (max_drop < min_drop)
2634  {
2635  max_drop = min_drop;
2636  }
2637 
2638  if (drop_dist > max_drop)
2639  {
2640  sticking = false;
2641  }
2642  }
2643 
2644  if (sticking)
2645  {
2646  SetFlag(LAST_POLY_WAS_VERT, m_col_flag_vert);
2647  new_normal(normal);
2648  }
2649  }
2650  }
2651 
2652  if (sticking)
2653  {
2654  // if there is a collision, then snap to it
2655  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint();
2656  DUMP_POSITION;
2657 
2658  if (GetState() == GROUND && movement.Length() > 2.0f)
2659  {
2660  // curbs are assumed to be between parallel surfaces, so check this...
2661  if (up_dot > 0.99f)
2662  {
2663  SetFlag(SNAPPED_OVER_CURB, true);
2664  }
2665  }
2666 
2667  // will return trivially if terrain is already set to this type...
2668  set_terrain(m_feeler.GetTerrain());
2669 
2670  adjust_normal();
2671 
2672  // check to see if we have skated onto a movable object
2673  check_movable_contact();
2674 
2675  // still on ground, so store the latest ground collision data
2676  // check first to see if we are about to change
2677  if (m_last_ground_feeler.GetSector() != m_feeler.GetSector())
2678  {
2679  // changin sectors, so check the sector we came from and the one we are going to
2680  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF, m_last_ground_feeler);
2681  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
2682 
2683  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO, m_feeler);
2684  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
2685  }
2686 
2687  if (!mp_trick_component->GraffitiTrickStarted())
2688  {
2689  // clear the graffiti trick buffer if we're moving to a new world sector, but haven't started our trick yet...
2690  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted(false);
2691  }
2692 
2693  set_last_ground_feeler(m_feeler);
2694  }
2695  }
2696 
2697  // skated off surface into the air
2698  if (!sticking)
2699  {
2700  SetState(AIR);
2701  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0xd96f01f1, "SkaterOffEdge"));
2702  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x3b1001b6, "GroundGone"));
2703 
2704  maybe_straight_up();
2705 
2706  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
2707  {
2708  SetFlagTrue(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
2709 
2710  // we want to break vert, but don't want to go into spine physics for a frame
2711  // so don't do this check if we are trying to break the spine
2712  // (we can still break vert or spine on the next frame, when in the air)
2713  if (!BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS)
2714  {
2715  maybe_break_vert();
2716  }
2717 
2718  // if we did not break vert now
2719  // then only allow us to break vert later if we've been tapping the "up" button
2720  // this is indicated by us having RELEASED or Pressed in teh last few ticks
2721  if (static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetReleasedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x6bb5b751, "Skater_vert_active_up_time"))
2722  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x6bb5b751, "Skater_vert_active_up_time")))
2723  {
2724  // "UP" was not pressed any time recently, so don't let us break late
2725  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
2726  }
2727  }
2728  else if (BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS)
2729  {
2730  SAcidDropData acid_drop_data;
2731  if (maybe_acid_drop(true, GetPos(), GetOldPos(), GetVel(), acid_drop_data))
2732  {
2733  enter_acid_drop(acid_drop_data);
2734  }
2735  }
2736 
2737  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF_EDGE, m_last_ground_feeler);
2738  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
2739  }
2740 }
2741 
2742 /******************************************************************/
2743 /* */
2744 /* */
2745 /******************************************************************/
2746 
2747 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::new_normal ( Mth::Vector normal )
2748 {
2749  if (Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark())
2750  {
2751  // check if this new normal will make us lean into a wall
2752  if (normal[Y] > 0.0f)
2753  {
2754  CFeeler feeler(GetPos(), GetPos() + 72.0f * normal);
2755  if (feeler.GetCollision())
2756  {
2757  normal.Set(0.0f,1.0f,0.0f);
2758  }
2759  }
2760  }
2761 
2762  if (normal != m_current_normal)
2763  {
2764  m_current_normal = normal; // remember this, for detecting if it changes
2765  m_last_display_normal = m_display_normal; // remember start position for lerping
2766  m_normal_lerp = 1.0f; // set lerp counter
2767 
2768  GetMatrix()[Y] = normal;
2769  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Y); // set regular normal immediately
2770  }
2771 }
2772 
2773 /******************************************************************/
2774 /* */
2775 /* */
2776 /******************************************************************/
2777 
2778 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::adjust_normal ( )
2779 {
2782  //
2783  // As the skater moves over the ground, he will go from being in contact
2784  // with one polygon, to another.
2785  // The "normal" of a polygon is the vector perpendicular to the surface of
2786  // the polygon, and the skater is normally aligned so that the "up" vector
2787  // of the skater (the Y component of the orientation matrix) is the same
2788  // as the normal or the polgon he is in contact with.
2789  //
2790  // However, as we go from one polygon to another (in a quarterpipe, for example)
2791  // the normal will change abruptly, and this looks very jerky
2792  // So, we try to smooth this out by remembering the old normal, and interpolating
2793  // towards the current display normal
2794  // this is done at a fixed speed, controled by the script value "Normal_Lerp_Speed"
2795  // whihc is defined in phsyics.q
2796  //
2797  // m_normal_lerp represents how far off the current face normal we are, it
2798  // will vary from 1.0 (still at the last display normal) to 0.0 (at current normal)
2799  // the intermediate normal is stored in m_display_normal
2800  // and is also copied directly into m_lerping_display_matrix, to rotate the skater
2801 
2802  // if m_normal_lerp is 0.0, then we don't need to do anything, as we should already be there
2803  if (m_normal_lerp != 0.0f) // if lerping
2804  {
2805  // If the last display normal is the same as the current normal, then we can't interpolate between them
2806  if (m_last_display_normal == m_current_normal)
2807  {
2808  m_normal_lerp = 0.0f;
2809  }
2810  else
2811  {
2812  // adjust lerp at constant speed from 1.0 to 0.0, accounting for framerate
2813  m_normal_lerp -= GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd8120182, "Normal_Lerp_Speed")) * m_frame_length * 60.0f;
2814 
2815  // if gone all the way, then clear lerping values and set m_display_normal to be the current face normal
2816  if (m_normal_lerp <= 0.0f)
2817  {
2818  m_normal_lerp = 0.0f;
2819  m_display_normal = m_current_normal;
2820  }
2821  else
2822  {
2823  // Still between old and current normal, so calculate intermediate normal
2824  m_display_normal = Mth::Lerp(m_current_normal, m_last_display_normal, m_normal_lerp);
2825  m_display_normal.Normalize();
2826  }
2827  }
2828  }
2829 
2830  // Now update the orientation matrix.
2831  // We need our up (Y) vector to be this vector
2832  // if it changes, rotate the X and Z vectors to match
2833  if (m_lerping_display_matrix[Y] != m_display_normal)
2834  {
2835  // lerp the y axis
2836  m_lerping_display_matrix[Y] = m_display_normal;
2837  m_lerping_display_matrix.OrthoNormalizeAbout(Y);
2838  m_lerping_display_matrix[X] = GetMatrix()[X];
2839  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z] = GetMatrix()[Z];
2840  }
2841 }
2842 
2843 /******************************************************************/
2844 /* */
2845 /* */
2846 /******************************************************************/
2847 
2848 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_movable_contact ( )
2849 {
2850  // given m_feeler is our current contact point with the ground, then check if our mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact() information needs updating
2851 
2852  if (GetFlag(SKITCHING)) return;
2853 
2854  if (mp_movable_contact_component->CheckForMovableContact(m_feeler))
2855  {
2856  GetVel() -= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject()->GetVel();
2857  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2858  }
2859 }
2860 
2861 /******************************************************************/
2862 /* */
2863 /* */
2864 /******************************************************************/
2865 
2866 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_straight_up ( )
2867 {
2868  // Skater has just left gound, either jumped, or skated off it
2869  // so we need to check if the ground we left was flagged as VERT and if it is,
2870  // then we need to set our skater's velocity and orientation so they go straight up
2871 
2872  if (GetFlag(LAST_POLY_WAS_VERT))
2873  {
2874  TrackingLine(3, GetOldPos(), GetPos()); // 3 = going vert
2875 
2876  // Get the normal to the plane we jumped from
2877  Mth::Vector up_plane_normal = m_current_normal;
2878 
2879  m_vert_normal = m_current_normal;
2880  m_vert_pos = GetOldPos();
2881 
2882  // move vert pos down one inch to better track subtle changes in edge height
2883  m_vert_pos[Y] -= 1.0f;
2884 
2885  // clear any Y component to this plane, makes it vertical
2886  up_plane_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
2887 
2888  if (up_plane_normal.Length() > 0.001f)
2889  {
2890  // and re-normalize to get a unit normal to the vertical plane.
2891  up_plane_normal.Normalize();
2892 
2893  GetVel().RotateToPlane(up_plane_normal);
2894  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2895 
2896  new_normal(up_plane_normal);
2897 
2898  // Fall line is used for auto turn
2899  m_fall_line = GetMatrix()[Z];
2900  m_fall_line[Y] = -m_fall_line[Y];
2901 
2902  // offset the jumper away from the plane by an inch
2903  GetPos() += up_plane_normal * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78384871, "Physics_Vert_Push_Out"));
2904  DUMP_POSITION;
2905 
2906  SetFlagTrue(VERT_AIR);
2907  SetFlagTrue(TRACKING_VERT);
2908  SetFlagTrue(AUTOTURN);
2909  m_vert_upstep = 6.0f;
2910  }
2911  else
2912  {
2913  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
2914  }
2915  }
2916  else
2917  {
2918  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
2919  }
2920 }
2921 
2922 /******************************************************************/
2923 /* */
2924 /* */
2925 /******************************************************************/
2926 
2927 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_break_vert ( )
2928 {
2929  // We "Break Vert" when we are pressing forward at the start of transitioning from the ground into a "vert" state
2930  // however, we need to defer the test until there is no ground in that "forward" direction (which will be directly beneath the skater's feet)
2931 
2932  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
2933 
2934  if (
2935  (
2936  control_pad.m_up.GetPressed()
2937  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x9d2f8cc8, "Skater_vert_push_time"))
2938  && !control_pad.m_left.GetPressed() // must be JUST up, to avoid accidents when turning
2939  && !control_pad.m_right.GetPressed()
2940  && !control_pad.m_square.GetPressed() // and don't break if trying to do a trick involving up
2941  && !control_pad.m_circle.GetPressed()
2942  )
2943  ||
2944  (
2945  BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS
2946  )
2947  )
2948  {
2949  // aha... up is pressed, so we want to break the air poly
2950 
2951  if (!BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS)
2952  {
2953  // normal breaking the air polygon, we just fly forward
2954 
2955  float speed = GetVel().Length() * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x13f33b41, "physics_break_air_speed_scale"));
2956 
2957  GetVel()[X] += -m_display_normal[X] * speed;
2958  GetVel()[Z] += -m_display_normal[Z] * speed;
2959  GetVel()[Y] *= GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x848c5cd6, "physics_break_air_up_scale"));
2960  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2961 
2962  // Now, since we broke the vert poly, the way it was set up, the skater will have alrready been snapped to vertical position
2963  // so we need to rotate him forwads 45 degrees to componsate
2964  GetMatrix().RotateXLocal(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd757f4bb, "Skater_Break_Vert_forward_tilt"))));
2965 
2966  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR); // just regular air, if we broke the air poly
2967  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT); // and certainly not tracking the vert
2968  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT); // and as we broke vert, we don't want to do it again
2969  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED); // allow acid drops once once again
2970 
2971  // and we want to be going in the direction of our velocity, so set front x and Z, but leave Y
2972  Mth::Vector vel_normal = GetVel();
2973  vel_normal.Normalize();
2974 
2975  GetMatrix()[Z][X] = vel_normal[X];
2976  GetMatrix()[Z][Z] = vel_normal[Z];
2977  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
2978  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Z);
2979  }
2980  else
2981  {
2982  if (!maybe_spine_transfer())
2983  {
2984  // cannot find a transfer target, so just break the air polygon
2985  GetVel()[X] += -m_display_normal[X] * 24.0f;
2986  GetVel()[Z] += -m_display_normal[Z] * 24.0f;
2987  DUMP_VELOCITY;
2988  GetMatrix().RotateXLocal(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd757f4bb, "Skater_Break_Vert_forward_tilt"))));
2989 
2990  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR); // just regular air, if we broke the air poly
2991  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT); // and certainly not tracking the vert
2992  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT); // and as we broke vert, we don't want to do it again
2993  SetFlagTrue(IN_RECOVERY); // tell him to just upright himself
2994 
2995  // and we want to be going in the direction of our velocity, so set front X and Z, but leave Y
2996  Mth::Vector vel_normal = GetVel();
2997  vel_normal.Normalize();
2998 
2999  GetMatrix()[Z][X] = vel_normal[X];
3000  GetMatrix()[Z][Z] = vel_normal[Z];
3001  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
3002  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Z);
3003 
3004  return;
3005  }
3006  }
3007 
3008  ResetLerpingMatrix();
3009  }
3010 }
3011 
3012 /******************************************************************/
3013 /* */
3014 /* */
3015 /******************************************************************/
3016 
3017 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_spine_transfer ( )
3018 {
3019  // Break spin button is pressed, so try to break the spine
3020 
3021  // The line to check along is the skater's forward directinal vector, rotated onto the XZ plane
3022  // if you go straight up the wall, then this will be the same as the normal of the wall (in XY) as we previously calculated
3023  // however we also want to handle the cases where you approach the QP at an angle
3024 
3025  // Need to take the forward vector (Z) and rotate it "forward" 90 degrees
3026  // Rotate about an axis perpendicular to both the horizontal part of m_matrix[Y] and also the world up (0,1,0)
3027 
3028  Mth::Vector skater_up = GetMatrix()[Y]; // skater_up is expected to be horizontal here, as we are "vert"
3029  skater_up[Y] = 0.0f;
3030  skater_up.Normalize();
3031 
3032  // get a vector perpendicular to the plane containing m_matrix[Z] and the world up
3033  #if 0 // old code - crossing by axis alined vector bugs me
3034  // Mth::Vector world_up(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
3035  // Mth::Vector side = Mth::CrossProduct(skater_up, world_up);
3036  #else
3037  Mth::Vector side(-skater_up[Z], 0.0f, skater_up[X], 0.0f);
3038  #endif
3039 
3040  // assuming we have not slowed down much, then our velocity should roughly be in the direction we took off from
3041  Mth::Vector forward = -GetVel();
3042  forward.Normalize();
3043 
3044  Mth::Vector wall_out = forward; // forward facing vector
3045  wall_out.Rotate(side, Mth::PI / 2.0f); // rotate fowrad 90 degrees
3046 
3047  float speed;
3048  float dist = 12.0f;
3049  float time = 1.0f;
3050  bool hip_transfer = false;
3051 
3052  CFeeler feeler;
3053 
3054  // Here the "wall" is what we are currently skating on, anything with "wall" in the name refers to that
3055 
3056  Mth::Vector target;
3057  Mth::Vector target_normal;
3058  bool target_found = false;
3059 
3060  // First find a point beneath our current position
3061  // Nice long line, higher than we can posibly jump
3062  feeler.m_start = GetPos() + wall_out * 0.5f;
3063  feeler.m_end = GetPos() + wall_out * 0.5f;
3064  feeler.m_end[Y] -= 4000.0f;
3065 
3066  // ignore everything that is NOT vert
3067  // feeler.SetIgnore(0, mFD_VERT);
3068 
3069  Mth::Vector wall_pos;
3070  if (feeler.GetCollision())
3071  {
3072  wall_pos = feeler.GetPoint();
3073 
3074  Mth::Vector start_normal = feeler.GetNormal();
3075  start_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
3076  start_normal.Normalize();
3077 
3078  target_found = look_for_transfer_target(-wall_out, start_normal, hip_transfer, target, target_normal);
3079 
3080  if (!target_found)
3081  {
3082  Mth::Vector left_along_vert(-start_normal[Z], 0.0f, start_normal[X]);
3083 
3084  // no target was found in the forward direction, perhaps we should look slightly left or right; look in the horizontal direction which is
3085  // halfway between the previous search direction and the plane of the vert
3086  if (mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_left.GetPressed() && !mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_right.GetPressed())
3087  {
3088  Mth::Vector search_dir = left_along_vert + -wall_out;
3089  search_dir.Normalize();
3090  target_found = look_for_transfer_target(search_dir, start_normal, hip_transfer, target, target_normal);
3091  }
3092  else if (mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_right.GetPressed() && !mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_left.GetPressed())
3093  {
3094  Mth::Vector search_dir = -left_along_vert + -wall_out;
3095  search_dir.Normalize();
3096  target_found = look_for_transfer_target(search_dir, start_normal, hip_transfer, target, target_normal);
3097  }
3098  }
3099  }
3100 
3101  if (!target_found) return false;
3102 
3103  Mth::Vector XZ_to_target = target - wall_pos;
3104  XZ_to_target[Y] = 0.0f;
3105  dist = XZ_to_target.Length();
3106 
3107  // We are only going to allow this later if the target point is the same level
3108  // as the takeoff point, and we have a clear line
3109  // so set it to this now, so we calculate the time correctly
3110  target[Y] = GetPos()[Y];
3111 
3112  // if the two faces are not really perpendicular or if the spine is wider than
3113  // then we determine that we are on a "hip" and we just want to go across it without drifting left or right
3114  // so we want to project all our velocity straight up
3115 
3116  Mth::Vector horizontal_target_normal = target_normal;
3117  horizontal_target_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
3118  horizontal_target_normal.Normalize();
3119 
3120  Mth::Vector cache_vel = GetVel();
3121 
3122  float face_dot = Mth::Abs(Mth::DotProduct(skater_up, horizontal_target_normal));
3123  if (face_dot < 0.9f)
3124  {
3125  GetVel()[Y] = GetVel().Length();
3126  GetVel()[X] = 0.0f;
3127  GetVel()[Z] = 0.0f;
3128  DUMP_VELOCITY;
3129  }
3130  else
3131  {
3132  // if spine more than two feet wide, then also don't allow drift
3133  if (dist > FEET(2.0f))
3134  {
3135  GetVel()[Y] = GetVel().Length();
3136  GetVel()[X] = 0.0f;
3137  GetVel()[Z] = 0.0f;
3138  DUMP_VELOCITY;
3139  }
3140  }
3141 
3142  // one inch out, to ensure miss the lip
3143  dist += 1.0f;
3144 
3145  #if 0 // old transfer code
3146  // get angle to rotate about, being the vector perpendicular to the world up vector and the difference between the two face normals
3147  // (generally for a spine these normals will be opposite, however they might be up to 90 degrees or more off when doing a hip)
3148 
3149  Mth::Vector normal_diff = target_normal - skater_up;
3150  normal_diff[Y] = 0.0f;
3151  normal_diff.Normalize();
3152 
3153  m_spine_rotate_axis[X] = -normal_diff[Z];
3154  m_spine_rotate_axis[Y] = 0.0f;
3155  m_spine_rotate_axis[Z] = normal_diff[X];
3156  m_spine_rotate_axis[W] = 0.0f;;
3157  #endif
3158 
3159  // for gravity calculations, temporarily pretend we are doing spine physics, so g is constant
3160  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3161  time = calculate_time_to_reach_height(target[Y], GetPos()[Y], GetVel()[Y]);
3162  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3163 
3164  // subtract some frames of time, to ensure we make it
3165  // time -= m_frame_length * 2.0f;
3166 
3167  if (time < 0.1f)
3168  {
3169  time = 0.1f;
3170  }
3171 
3172  speed = dist / time;
3173 
3174  // if spine more than two foot wide, then make sure that we have enough speed to get over it
3175  // otherwise, just do a little pop over, and allow them to recover
3176  if (dist > 24.0f && speed * speed > GetVel().LengthSqr())
3177  {
3178  return false;
3179  }
3180 
3181  // we have found a target point, either by looking directly in front or by doing the drop-down method
3182  // but we don't want to go for it until there is a clear line from our current position to the target
3183 
3184  Mth::Vector target_XZ = target;
3185  target_XZ[Y] = GetPos()[Y];
3186 
3187  feeler.m_start = GetPos();
3188  feeler.m_end = target_XZ;
3189  if (feeler.GetCollision())
3190  {
3191  // don't do anything. We have a valid transfer but we can wait until we get high enough before we try for it
3192  return true;
3193  }
3194 
3195  // setup the transfer's matrix slerp
3196 
3197  Mth::Vector land_facing;
3198  if (!hip_transfer)
3199  {
3200  land_facing = target - GetPos();
3201  land_facing[Y] = -(land_facing[X] * target_normal[X] + land_facing[Z] * target_normal[Z]) / target_normal[Y];
3202  land_facing.Normalize();
3203  }
3204  else
3205  {
3206  Mth::Vector offset = target - GetPos();
3207  offset.Normalize();
3208  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(offset, horizontal_target_normal);
3209  if (dot < 0.0f)
3210  {
3211  land_facing.Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
3212  }
3213  else
3214  {
3215  land_facing.Set(0.0f, -1.0f, 0.0f);
3216  }
3217  }
3218 
3219  Mth::Matrix transfer_slerp_start = GetMatrix();
3220 
3221  // calculate the facing we want when we land; retain our horizontal direction and choose a vertical component which puts us parallel so the target
3222  // poly's plane
3223 
3224  // calculate goal matrix
3225  Mth::Matrix transfer_slerp_goal;
3226  transfer_slerp_goal[Z] = land_facing;
3227  transfer_slerp_goal[Z].ProjectToPlane(target_normal);
3228  transfer_slerp_goal[Z].Normalize();
3229  transfer_slerp_goal[Y] = target_normal;
3230  transfer_slerp_goal[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(transfer_slerp_goal[Y], transfer_slerp_goal[Z]);
3231  transfer_slerp_goal[W].Set();
3232 
3233  // store the goal facing for use in adjusting the velocity at land time
3234  m_transfer_goal_facing = transfer_slerp_goal[Z];
3235 
3236  // if the skater is entering the spine transfer with an odd facing due to rotation, we want to preserve that angle in the slerp's goal matrix
3237 
3238  // calculate the deviation between the skater's velocity and facing
3239  float angle = Mth::GetAngleAbout(GetMatrix()[Z], cache_vel, GetMatrix()[Y]);
3240 
3241  // be a bit forgiving for hip transfers, as you often have to hit left/right to trigger them, which causes rotation
3242  if (Mth::Abs(angle) < Mth::DegToRad(30.0f))
3243  {
3244  angle = 0.0f;
3245  }
3246 
3247  // rotate goal facing to reflect the deviation in the initial facing
3248  transfer_slerp_goal.RotateYLocal(-angle);
3249 
3250  // setup the slerp state
3251  m_transfer_slerper.setMatrices(&transfer_slerp_start, &transfer_slerp_goal);
3252  m_transfer_slerp_timer = 0.0f;
3253  m_transfer_slerp_duration = Mth::ClampMin(time, 0.9f); // clamp the time to stop super fast rotations
3254  m_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix = transfer_slerp_start;
3255 
3256  // insure that the slerp takes us over the top, and doesn't invert us
3257  Mth::Matrix slerp_test;
3258  m_transfer_slerper.getMatrix(&slerp_test, 0.5f);
3259  if (slerp_test[Y][Y] < 0.0f)
3260  {
3261  m_transfer_slerper.invertDirection();
3262  }
3263 
3264  // remember the height we are aiming for, so when we come down through this height
3265  // then we remove the non vert velocity (or make it very small....)
3266  m_transfer_target_height = target[Y];
3267 
3268  // set velocity over the wall fast enough to land on the target point
3269  mp_state_component->m_spine_vel = (target - GetPos()) / time; // velocity from start to target
3270  mp_state_component->m_spine_vel[Y] = 0.0f; // but ignore Y, as gravity handles that...
3271 
3272  // tell the code we are doing spine physics, so we lean quicker
3273  if (!hip_transfer)
3274  {
3275  GetObject()->SpawnAndRunScript(CRCD(0xa5179e9e, "SkaterAwardTransfer")); // award a trick (might want to do it as an exception later)
3276  }
3277  else
3278  {
3279  GetObject()->SpawnAndRunScript(CRCD(0x283bb5d6, "SkaterAwardHipTransfer")); // award a trick (might want to do it as an exception later)
3280  }
3281 
3282  // no late jumps during a transfer
3283  GetObject()->RemoveEventHandler(CRCD(0x8ffefb28, "Ollied"));
3284 
3285  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS); // flag in spin physics, to do the lean forward, and also allow downcoming lip tricks
3286  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
3287  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT); // we are still vert, but not tracking the vert
3288  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT); // and as we "broke" vert, we don't want to do it again
3289 
3290  return true;
3291  }
3292 
3293 /******************************************************************/
3294 /* */
3295 /* */
3296 /******************************************************************/
3297 
3298 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::look_for_transfer_target ( const Mth::Vector& search_dir, const Mth::Vector& start_normal, bool& hip_transfer, Mth::Vector& target, Mth::Vector& target_normal )
3299 {
3300  // take a bunch of steps forward until we find one
3301  // This is not very good, as we have to do 80 collision checks....
3302  // we really need to optimize our collision detection to be able to select a set of "nearby" object
3303  // or to select a set that intersects a sphere, or a plane
3304  // (here, we could just get the set that intersects the plane)
3305  // this could be statically cached by the colision code, and have one set
3306  // or perhaps more flexibly, each "feeler" could have a set of objects
3307  // that it deals with (defaulting to the set of all objects)
3308 
3309  CFeeler feeler;
3310 
3311  // setup collision cache
3312  Nx::CCollCache* p_coll_cache = Nx::CCollCacheManager::sCreateCollCache();
3313  Mth::CBBox bbox;
3314  Mth::Vector p;
3315  p = GetPos() + search_dir * 10.0f;
3316  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3317  p[Y] -= 4000.0f;
3318  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3319  p = GetPos() + search_dir * 500.0f;
3320  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3321  p[Y] -= 4000.0f;
3322  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3323  p_coll_cache->Update(bbox);
3324  feeler.SetCache(p_coll_cache);
3325 
3326  for (float step = 10.0f; step < 500.0f; step += 6.0f)
3327  {
3328  // First find a VERT point a bit in front of us
3329  // can be some distance below us
3330  // allowing us to transfer from high to low pools
3331  // (and low to high, proving you can jump up from the low point to the high point first)
3332  feeler.m_start = GetPos() + search_dir * step; // start at current height
3333  feeler.m_end = feeler.m_start;
3334  feeler.m_end[Y] -= 4000.0f; // long way below
3335 
3336  if (feeler.GetCollision() && (feeler.GetFlags() & mFD_VERT) && is_vert_for_transfers(feeler.GetNormal()))
3337  {
3338  Mth::Vector horizontal_normal = feeler.GetNormal();
3339  horizontal_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
3340  horizontal_normal.Normalize();
3341  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(start_normal, horizontal_normal);
3342  if (dot <= 0.95f)
3343  {
3344  target = feeler.GetPoint();
3345  target_normal = feeler.GetNormal();
3346 
3347  hip_transfer = dot > -0.866f;
3348 
3349  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3350  // feeler.DebugLine(255, 100, 100, 0);
3351 
3352  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3353 
3354  return true;
3355  }
3356  else
3357  {
3358  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3359  // feeler.DebugLine(100, 255, 100, 0);
3360  }
3361  }
3362  else
3363  {
3364  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3365  // feeler.DebugLine(100, 100, 255, 0);
3366  }
3367  }
3368 
3369  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3370 
3371  return false;
3372 }
3373 
3374 /******************************************************************/
3375 /* */
3376 /* */
3377 /******************************************************************/
3378 
3379 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_acid_drop ( bool skated_off_edge, const Mth::Vector &pos, const Mth::Vector& old_pos, Mth::Vector& vel, SAcidDropData& acid_drop_data )
3380 {
3381  // horizontal direction in which a drop would occur
3382  Mth::Vector drop_direction;
3383  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsSkating())
3384  {
3385  drop_direction = vel;
3386  drop_direction[Y] = 0.0f;
3387  float length = drop_direction.Length();
3388  if (length < 0.01f) return false;
3389  drop_direction *= 1.0f / length;
3390  }
3391  else
3392  {
3393  drop_direction = mp_walk_component->m_facing;
3394  }
3395 
3396  bool target_found = false;
3397  Mth::Vector target;
3398 
3399  // in order not to miss vert polys with a thin horizontal projection, we check for them starting at this frame's initial position
3400  Mth::Vector search_pos = old_pos;
3401  search_pos[Y] = Mth::Max(pos[Y], old_pos[Y]);
3402 
3403  float scan_distance = 500.0f;
3404  float scan_height = 0.0f;
3405  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking())
3406  {
3407  if (mp_walk_component->m_state == CWalkComponent::WALKING_GROUND)
3408  {
3409  // and use a reduced scan distance
3410  scan_distance = Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xe50a9d56, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Walking_On_Ground_Search_Distance"));
3411 
3412  // and look for vert polys above us
3413  scan_height = 200.0f;
3414  }
3415  else
3416  {
3417  // look slightly behind us for acid drops (we may be facing down a vert we're standing on)
3418  search_pos -= 12.0f * drop_direction;
3419  }
3420  }
3421 
3422  CFeeler feeler;
3423 
3424  // setup collision cache
3425  Nx::CCollCache* p_coll_cache = Nx::CCollCacheManager::sCreateCollCache();
3426  Mth::CBBox bbox;
3427  Mth::Vector p;
3428  p = search_pos;
3429  p[Y] += scan_height;
3430  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3431  p[Y] -= 4200.0f;
3432  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3433  p = search_pos + drop_direction * scan_distance;
3434  p[Y] += scan_height;
3435  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3436  p[Y] -= 4200.0f;
3437  bbox.AddPoint(p);
3438  p_coll_cache->Update(bbox);
3439  feeler.SetCache(p_coll_cache);
3440 
3441  Mth::Vector target_normal;
3442  Mth::Vector horizontal_target_normal;
3443  float distance;
3444  for (distance = 0.01f; distance < scan_distance; distance += 3.0f)
3445  {
3446  // look for a vert poly below us
3447  feeler.m_start = search_pos + distance * drop_direction;
3448  feeler.m_end = feeler.m_start;
3449  feeler.m_start[Y] += scan_height;
3450  feeler.m_end[Y] -= 4000.0f;
3451  if (feeler.GetCollision() && (feeler.GetFlags() & mFD_VERT) && is_vert_for_transfers(feeler.GetNormal()))
3452  {
3453  // the horizontal projection of the vert's normal just correspond somewhat to our direction
3454  target_normal = horizontal_target_normal = feeler.GetNormal();
3455  horizontal_target_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
3456  horizontal_target_normal.Normalize();
3457 
3458  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking() && mp_walk_component->m_state == CWalkComponent::WALKING_AIR)
3459  {
3460  // special acceptance rules for walking in-air acid drops
3461  target_found = Mth::DotProduct(drop_direction, horizontal_target_normal) <= -0.25f
3462  || Mth::DotProduct(drop_direction, horizontal_target_normal) >= 0.05f;
3463  }
3464  else
3465  {
3466  target_found = Mth::DotProduct(drop_direction, horizontal_target_normal) >= 0.05f;
3467  }
3468 
3469  if (target_found)
3470  {
3471  target = feeler.GetPoint();
3472  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3473  // feeler.DebugLine(255, 100, 100, 0);
3474  break;
3475  }
3476  else
3477  {
3478  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3479  // feeler.DebugLine(100, 255, 100, 0);
3480  }
3481  }
3482  else
3483  {
3484  // feeler.m_end[Y] += 3960.0f;
3485  // feeler.DebugLine(100, 100, 255, 0);
3486  }
3487 
3488  // use a larger incrememt at larger distances, as we have several frames yet to find these polys
3489  if (distance > 100.0f)
3490  {
3491  distance += 24.0f;
3492  }
3493  }
3494 
3495  if (!target_found)
3496  {
3497  // no valid acid drop target found
3498  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3499  return false;
3500  }
3501 
3502  float original_target_height = target[Y];
3503 
3504  // because our search began behind us, the horizontal offset to the target may not be forward
3505  Mth::Vector horizontal_offset = target - pos;
3506  horizontal_offset[Y] = 0.0f;
3507  distance = horizontal_offset.Length();
3508  if (Mth::DotProduct(horizontal_offset, drop_direction) < 0.0f)
3509  {
3510  distance = -distance;
3511  }
3512  drop_direction = horizontal_offset / distance;
3513 
3514  // stash a copy of velocity so we can pretend it has an adjusted value
3515  Mth::Vector hold_vel = vel;
3516 
3517  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking())
3518  {
3519  // because when walking they are necessarily in the same direction, project our horizontal velocity in the drop direction
3520  vel.ProjectToNormal(drop_direction);
3521  vel[Y] = hold_vel[Y];
3522  }
3523 
3524  // calculate our effective horizontal velocity
3525  float initial_horiz_speed = sqrtf(vel[X] * vel[X] + vel[Z] * vel[Z]);
3526 
3527  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking())
3528  {
3529  // boost our effective horizontal speed up to maximum run speed
3530  float horizontal_boost = mp_walk_component->get_run_speed();
3531  if (initial_horiz_speed < horizontal_boost)
3532  {
3533  vel[X] = horizontal_boost * GetWalkComponentFromObject(GetObject())->m_facing[X];
3534  vel[Z] = horizontal_boost * GetWalkComponentFromObject(GetObject())->m_facing[Z];
3535  initial_horiz_speed = horizontal_boost;
3536  }
3537  }
3538 
3539  // give a slight upward pop
3540  if (skated_off_edge)
3541  {
3542  vel[Y] = Mth::Max(vel[Y], GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x95a79c32, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Pop_Speed")));
3543  }
3544 
3545  // but limit upward speed to something reasonable
3546  if (!mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking() || mp_walk_component->m_state != CWalkComponent::WALKING_GROUND)
3547  {
3548  vel[Y] = Mth::Min(vel[Y], 2.0f * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x95a79c32, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Pop_Speed")));
3549  }
3550 
3551  // grab the acceleration we will have during our acid drop
3552  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3553  float acceleration = get_air_gravity();
3554  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3555 
3556  // calculate what height we would have if we used our current horizontal velocity to reach the target position
3557  float final_height;
3558  if (distance > 0.0f && initial_horiz_speed > 0.0001f)
3559  {
3560  float time_to_target = distance / initial_horiz_speed;
3561  final_height = pos[Y] + vel[Y] * time_to_target + 0.5f * acceleration * time_to_target * time_to_target;
3562  }
3563  else
3564  {
3565  // for backwards acid drops, just act as through we are directly over the target point
3566  final_height = pos[Y];
3567  }
3568 
3569  // if we need to jump up to the target
3570  if (mp_physics_control_component->IsWalking() && vel[Y] > 0.0f && pos[Y] < target[Y])
3571  {
3572  // check to see if we'll ever reach that height with our effective upward velocity
3573  float max_height = pos[Y] + vel[Y] * vel[Y] / (-2.0f * acceleration);
3574  float time_to_target = Mth::Abs(distance) / initial_horiz_speed;
3575  float time_to_max_height = vel[Y] / -acceleration;
3576  if (time_to_target < time_to_max_height)
3577  {
3578  // effectively, this means that we're willing to reduce our horizontal boost in order allow more time to reach the required height
3579  final_height = max_height;
3580  }
3581  }
3582 
3583  // if we can't reach the target with our current velocity, ditch the acid drop
3584  if (final_height < target[Y])
3585  {
3586  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3587  vel = hold_vel;
3588  return false;
3589  }
3590 
3591  // calculate the air time before the acid drop would hit its true target; prevent acid drops from occuring moments before landing
3592  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3593  float time_to_reach_target_height = calculate_time_to_reach_height(original_target_height, pos[Y], vel[Y]);
3594  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3595  if (time_to_reach_target_height < Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x32c20f7e, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Min_Air_Time")))
3596  {
3597  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3598  vel = hold_vel;
3599  return false;
3600  }
3601 
3602  // ensure that we have a clear shot to the target
3603 
3604  bool clear_path = false;
3605 
3606  // keep shifting our target point up until we can get a clear shot to it, or we get to an unreachable height
3607  while (target[Y] < final_height)
3608  {
3609  feeler.m_start = pos;
3610 
3611  // check a path constructed from two concatenated lines, with the midpoint halfway along the acid drop trajectory; this is an attempt
3612  // to allow most acid drop which might be disallowed by a ledge which would block a straight line
3613 
3614  // calculate the time span required to fall to the target height
3615  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3616  float half_time_to_reach_target_height = 0.5f * calculate_time_to_reach_height(target[Y], pos[Y], vel[Y]);
3617  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3618 
3619  // calculate the spine velocity which would be used for this target
3620  float required_speed = 0.5f * distance / half_time_to_reach_target_height;
3621 
3622  // calculate the height we will be at halfway through the acid drop
3623  float height_halfway = pos[Y] + vel[Y] * half_time_to_reach_target_height
3624  + 0.5f * acceleration * Mth::Sqr(half_time_to_reach_target_height);
3625 
3626  // calculate the point halfway through the acid drop
3627  Mth::Vector halfway_point = pos;
3628  halfway_point[Y] = height_halfway;
3629  halfway_point += required_speed * half_time_to_reach_target_height * drop_direction;
3630 
3631  // check for collisions alone the two-line path
3632  feeler.m_end = halfway_point;
3633  if (!feeler.GetCollision())
3634  {
3635  // feeler.DebugLine(255, 255, 0);
3636  feeler.m_start = feeler.m_end;
3637  feeler.m_end = target;
3638  feeler.m_end[Y] += 1.0f;
3639  if (!feeler.GetCollision())
3640  {
3641  // feeler.DebugLine(255, 255, 0);
3642  clear_path = true;
3643  break;
3644  }
3645  else
3646  {
3647  // feeler.DebugLine(0, 0, 0, 0);
3648  }
3649  }
3650 
3651  // feeler.DebugLine(0, 0, 0, 0);
3652 
3653  // try a higher target point
3654  target[Y] += 24.0f;
3655  }
3656 
3657  // no clear path was found along the acid drop
3658  if (!clear_path)
3659  {
3660  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3661  vel = hold_vel;
3662  return false;
3663  }
3664  DUMP_VELOCITY;
3665 
3666  Nx::CCollCacheManager::sDestroyCollCache(p_coll_cache);
3667 
3668  acid_drop_data.target_pos = target;
3669  acid_drop_data.target_normal = target_normal;
3670  acid_drop_data.true_target_height = original_target_height;
3671  return true;
3672 }
3673 
3674 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::enter_acid_drop ( const SAcidDropData& acid_drop_data )
3675 {
3676  const Mth::Vector& target_pos = acid_drop_data.target_pos;
3677  const Mth::Vector& target_normal = acid_drop_data.target_normal;
3678  const float& true_target_height = acid_drop_data.true_target_height;
3679 
3680  // setup the skater state for the acid drop
3681 
3682  Mth::Vector horizontal_offset = target_pos - GetPos();
3683  horizontal_offset[Y] = 0.0f;
3684  float distance = horizontal_offset.Length();
3685  if (Mth::DotProduct(horizontal_offset, GetVel()) < 0.0f)
3686  {
3687  distance = -distance;
3688  }
3689  Mth::Vector drop_direction = horizontal_offset / distance;
3690 
3691  // calculate the spine speed required to reach the target given our current vertical velocity
3692  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3693  float time_to_reach_target_height = calculate_time_to_reach_height(target_pos[Y], GetPos()[Y], GetVel()[Y]);
3694  float required_speed = distance / time_to_reach_target_height;
3695  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3696  mp_state_component->m_spine_vel.Set(required_speed * drop_direction[X], 0.0f, required_speed * drop_direction[Z]);
3697  acid_hold = mp_state_component->m_spine_vel;
3698 
3699  // once we reach this height, the skater's horizontal velocity will be zeroed out
3700  m_transfer_target_height = target_pos[Y];
3701 
3702  // Gfx::AddDebugStar(target, 24.0f, RED, 0);
3703 
3704  // enter the acid drop state
3705  SetFlagTrue(SPINE_PHYSICS);
3706  SetFlagTrue(VERT_AIR);
3707  SetFlagTrue(IN_ACID_DROP);
3708  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
3709  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
3710 
3711  // zero our horizontal velocity
3712  GetVel()[X] = 0.0f;
3713  GetVel()[Z] = 0.0f;
3714  DUMP_VELOCITY;
3715 
3716  // setup the acid drop's matrix slerp
3717 
3718  Mth::Matrix acid_drop_slerp_start = GetMatrix();
3719 
3720  // calculate the facing we want when we land; retain our horizontal direction and choose a vertical component which puts us parallel so the target
3721  // poly's plane
3722  Mth::Vector land_facing = drop_direction;
3723  land_facing[Y] = -(land_facing[X] * target_normal[X] + land_facing[Z] * target_normal[Z]) / target_normal[Y];
3724  land_facing.Normalize();
3725 
3726  // calculate goal matrix
3727  Mth::Matrix acid_drop_slerp_goal;
3728  acid_drop_slerp_goal[Z] = land_facing;
3729  acid_drop_slerp_goal[Z].ProjectToPlane(target_normal);
3730  acid_drop_slerp_goal[Z].Normalize();
3731  acid_drop_slerp_goal[Y] = target_normal;
3732  acid_drop_slerp_goal[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(acid_drop_slerp_goal[Y], acid_drop_slerp_goal[Z]);
3733  acid_drop_slerp_goal[W].Set();
3734 
3735  // store the goal facing for use in adjusting the velocity at land time
3736  m_transfer_goal_facing = acid_drop_slerp_goal[Z];
3737 
3738  // setup a good camera matrix for the acid drop (before applying any deviation preserving adjustments)
3739  m_acid_drop_camera_matrix = acid_drop_slerp_goal;
3740  if (m_acid_drop_camera_matrix[Z][Y] > 0.0f)
3741  {
3742  m_acid_drop_camera_matrix[Z] *= -1.0f;
3743  m_acid_drop_camera_matrix[X] *= -1.0f;
3744  }
3745 
3746  // if the skater is entering the acid drop with an odd facing due to rotation, we want to preserve that angle in the slerp's goal matrix
3747 
3748  // calculate the deviation between the skater's velocity and facing
3749  Mth::Vector horizontal_facing = GetMatrix()[Z];
3750  horizontal_facing[Y] = 0.0f;
3751  float angle = Mth::GetAngleAbout(horizontal_facing, drop_direction, GetMatrix()[Y]);
3752 
3753  // rotate goal facing to reflect the deviation in the initial facing
3754  acid_drop_slerp_goal.RotateYLocal(-angle);
3755 
3756  // setup the slerp state
3757  m_transfer_slerper.setMatrices(&acid_drop_slerp_start, &acid_drop_slerp_goal);
3758  m_transfer_slerp_timer = 0.0f;
3759  m_transfer_slerp_duration = time_to_reach_target_height;
3760  m_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix = acid_drop_slerp_start;
3761 
3762  // trigger the appropriate script
3763  Script::CStruct* p_params = new Script::CStruct;
3764  p_params->AddFloat(CRCD(0xbb00fe40, "DropHeight"), GetPos()[Y] - true_target_height);
3765  GetObject()->SpawnAndRunScript(CRCD(0xc7ed5fef, "SkaterAcidDropTriggered"), -1, false, false, p_params);
3766 
3767  // no late jumps during an acid drop
3768  GetObject()->RemoveEventHandler(CRCD(0x8ffefb28, "Ollied"));
3769 }
3770 
3771 /******************************************************************/
3772 /* */
3773 /* */
3774 /******************************************************************/
3775 
3776 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_post_transfer_limit_overrides ( )
3777 {
3778  // After a transfer, if we are above our standard speed limits, we ignore those limits for a short duration. Over the duration the speed limits
3779  // lerp from our starting speed down to the standard speed limits. Only non-air time is counted towards the duration.
3780 
3781  // detect leaving an acid drop
3782  if (m_began_frame_in_transfer && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS) && !GetFlag(IS_BAILING))
3783  {
3784  // only override limits if we start above the limits
3785  float standard_max = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x2eacddb3, "Skater_Max_Speed_Stat"));
3786  float speed = GetVel().Length();
3787  if (speed < 1.25f * standard_max) return;
3788 
3789  // setup state to ignore speed limits
3790  m_transfer_overrides_factor = Mth::Min(speed / standard_max, GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xc6b38be0, "Physics_Transfer_Speed_Limit_Override_Max")));
3791 
3792  // large values
3793  m_override_max = 1e20f;
3794  m_override_max_max = 1e20f;
3795  }
3796  else if (m_transfer_overrides_factor == 1.0f) return;
3797 
3798  // turn on speed limit overrides
3799  m_override_limits_time = -1.0f;
3800 
3801  // count our timer down
3802  m_transfer_overrides_factor -= m_frame_length * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xf9b006aa, "Physics_Transfer_Speed_Limit_Override_Drop_Rate"));
3803 
3804  // end the ignoring of speed limits if the duration is up
3805  if (m_transfer_overrides_factor < 1.0f)
3806  {
3807  m_transfer_overrides_factor = 1.0f;
3808  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
3809  return;
3810  }
3811 
3812  // grab the standard speed limit
3813  float standard_max = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x2eacddb3, "Skater_Max_Speed_Stat"));
3814 
3815  // calculate the appropriate speed limit based on the time since the acid drop and the speed at the end of the acid drop
3816  float time_based_appropriate_max = m_transfer_overrides_factor * standard_max;
3817 
3818  // calculate a speed limit based on the current speed; thus, if we break during the ignoring of speed limits, our speed limits will turn back on
3819  float speed_based_appropriate_max = 1.1f * GetVel().Length();
3820 
3821  // take the lowest speed limit; never increase the speed limit
3822  float appropriate_max;
3823  if (GetState() != AIR)
3824  {
3825  appropriate_max = Mth::Min3(time_based_appropriate_max, speed_based_appropriate_max, m_override_max);
3826  }
3827  else
3828  {
3829  // in air, don't drop the limits when your current speed drops; otherwise you lose your overrides as the top of vert air
3830  appropriate_max = Mth::Min(time_based_appropriate_max, m_override_max);
3831  }
3832 
3833  // end the ignoring of speed limits if the duration is up
3834  if (appropriate_max < standard_max)
3835  {
3836  m_transfer_overrides_factor = 1.0f;
3837  m_override_limits_time = 0.0f;
3838  return;
3839  }
3840 
3841  // set the artificially high speed limit override
3842  m_override_max = appropriate_max;
3843 
3844  // the max max speed limit will never fall below the standard max max speed limit
3845  m_override_max_max = m_override_max / standard_max * GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x2eacddb3, "Skater_Max_Speed_Stat"));
3846 
3847  PERIODIC(10)
3848  {
3849  printf("Post-Transfer Speed Limit Overrides: current / standard = %.2f\n", m_override_max / standard_max);
3850  }
3851 }
3852 
3853 /******************************************************************/
3854 /* */
3855 /* */
3856 /******************************************************************/
3857 
3858 float CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::get_air_gravity ( )
3859 {
3860  // given that we are in the air, figure out what gravity to use
3861  // based on if we are VERT or regular air and the cheat modes
3862  // make sure that if you use this in calculations, then your flags do not change while you expect it to be the same
3863  float gravity;
3864 
3865  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) || GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS)) // Note, spine is treated same as vert
3866  {
3867  // gravity = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xfaa40754, "Physics_Air_Gravity")) / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x441c38a0, "Physics_vert_hang_Stat"));
3868  gravity = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xfaa40754, "Physics_Air_Gravity")) / GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x441c38a0, "Physics_vert_hang_Stat"));
3869  }
3870  else
3871  {
3872  // gravity = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xfaa40754, "Physics_Air_Gravity")) / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xc31ca696, "Physics_Air_hang_Stat"));
3873  gravity = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xfaa40754, "Physics_Air_Gravity")) / GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xc31ca696, "Physics_Air_hang_Stat"));
3874  }
3875 
3876  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->GetCheat(CRCD(0x9c8c6df1, "CHEAT_MOON")))
3877  {
3878  // Here, set the flag. It may seem redundant, but the above line is very likely
3879  // to be hacked by gameshark. They probably won't notice this one, which will
3880  // set the flags as if they had actually enabled the cheat -- which enables us
3881  // to detect that it has been turned on more easily.
3882  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->SetGlobalFlag( Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x9c8c6df1, "CHEAT_MOON")));
3883  gravity *= GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xec128f0, "moon_gravity"));
3884  g_CheatsEnabled = true;
3885  }
3886 
3887  return gravity;
3888 }
3889 
3890 /******************************************************************/
3891 /* */
3892 /* */
3893 /******************************************************************/
3894 
3895 float CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::calculate_time_to_reach_height ( float target_height, float pos_Y, float vel_Y )
3896 {
3897  // s = ut - 1/2 * g * t^2 (note, -g = a in the more traditional formula)
3898  // solve this using the quadratic equation, gives us the formula below
3899  // Note the sign of s is important.....
3900  float distance = pos_Y - target_height;
3901  float velocity = vel_Y;
3902  float acceleration = -get_air_gravity();
3903  return (velocity + sqrtf(velocity * velocity + 2.0f * acceleration * distance)) / acceleration;
3904 }
3905 
3906 /******************************************************************/
3907 /* */
3908 /* */
3909 /******************************************************************/
3910 
3911 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_ground_rotation ( )
3912 {
3913  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
3914 
3915  float rot = 0.0f;
3916  float speed = GetVel().Length();
3917 
3918  if (control_pad.m_left.GetPressed())
3919  {
3920  if (!control_pad.m_down.GetPressed())
3921  {
3922  rot = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x374e056b, "Physics_Ground_Rotation"));
3923  }
3924  else
3925  {
3926  rot = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x7933a8ef, "Physics_Ground_Sharp_Rotation"));
3927  if (speed < 10.0f)
3928  {
3929  // If not moving, then we want more control over turning, so ramp up the turing speed over a second
3930  int pressed_time = control_pad.m_left.GetPressedTime();
3931  if (pressed_time < STOPPED_TURN_RAMP_TIME)
3932  {
3933  rot = rot * pressed_time / STOPPED_TURN_RAMP_TIME;
3934  }
3935  }
3936  }
3937  }
3938  else if (control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
3939  {
3940  if (!control_pad.m_down.GetPressed())
3941  {
3942  rot = -GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x374e056b, "Physics_Ground_Rotation"));
3943  }
3944  else
3945  {
3946  rot = -GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x7933a8ef, "Physics_Ground_Sharp_Rotation"));
3947  if (speed < 10.0f)
3948  {
3949  // If not moving, then we want more control over turning, so ramp up the turing speed over a second
3950  int pressed_time = control_pad.m_right.GetPressedTime();
3951  if (pressed_time < STOPPED_TURN_RAMP_TIME)
3952  {
3953  rot = rot * pressed_time / STOPPED_TURN_RAMP_TIME;
3954  }
3955  }
3956  }
3957  }
3958 
3959  /*
3960  bool do_cess = false;
3961  if (CESS_SLIDE_BUTTONS)
3962  {
3963  float cess_turn_min_speed = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xae84e34a, "cess_turn_min_speed"));
3964  if (speed > cess_turn_min_speed)
3965  {
3966  do_cess = true;
3967 
3968  float cess_turn_cap_speed = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x8242c4fe, "cess_turn_cap_speed"));
3969 
3970  float scale = speed;
3971  if (scale > cess_turn_cap_speed)
3972  {
3973  scale = cess_turn_cap_speed;
3974  }
3975  scale -= cess_turn_min_speed;
3976  scale /= cess_turn_cap_speed - cess_turn_min_speed;
3977 
3978  rot = rot * scale * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x22834151, "cess_turn_multiplier"));
3979  }
3980  }
3981  */
3982 
3983  if (rot == 0.0f) return;
3984 
3985  rot *= m_frame_length;
3986 
3987  mYAngleIncreased = rot > 0.0f;
3988 
3989  // K: Avoid anything that might change the velocity direction if this flag is set.
3990  if (!m_lock_velocity_direction /* && !do_cess*/)
3991  {
3992  GetVel().RotateY(rot); // Note: Need to rotate this about UP vector
3993  DUMP_VELOCITY;
3994  }
3995 
3996  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(rot);
3997  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(rot);
3998 }
3999 
4000 /******************************************************************/
4001 /* */
4002 /* */
4003 /******************************************************************/
4004 
4005 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::remove_sideways_velocity ( Mth::Vector& vel )
4006 {
4007  // Remove any non-forward component of the velocity
4008 
4009  float speed = vel.Length(); // get size of velocity
4010  if (speed > 0.00001f)
4011  {
4012  // if (!USE_BIKE_PHYSICS)
4013  // {
4014  vel *= 1.0f / speed; // get unit vector in direction of velocity
4015  float direction = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(vel, GetMatrix()[Z])); // get fwds or backwards
4016 
4017  vel = GetMatrix()[Z]; // get forward direction
4018  vel *= speed * direction; // apply all speed in this direction
4019  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4020  // }
4021  // else
4022  // {
4023  // Mth::Vector old_vel = vel;
4024 
4025  // vel.ProjectToNormal(GetMatrix()[Z]); // leave forward velocity alone
4026 
4027  // old_vel -= GetVel(); // find remaining sideways velocity
4028 
4029  // old_vel *= 1.0f - GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x53385759, "cess_Friction"));
4030  // vel += old_vel;
4031  // DUMP_VELOCITY;
4032  // }
4033  }
4034 }
4035 
4036 /******************************************************************/
4037 /* */
4038 /* */
4039 /******************************************************************/
4040 
4041 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_side_collisions ( )
4042 {
4043  // check for collisins left and right of the skater; if we get collisions on both sides then restore him to the original position
4044 
4045  Mth::Vector debounce = GetPos();
4046 
4047  float side_col = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x406b425f, "Skater_side_collide_length"));
4048 
4049  if (check_side(-1.0f, side_col))
4050  {
4051  if (check_side(1.0f, side_col))
4052  {
4053  GetPos() = debounce; // two collisions, back to safety
4054  DUMP_POSITION;
4055  }
4056  }
4057  else
4058  {
4059  if (check_side(1.0f, side_col))
4060  {
4061  if (check_side(-1.0f, side_col))
4062  {
4063  GetPos() = debounce; // two collisions, back to safety
4064  DUMP_POSITION;
4065  }
4066  }
4067  }
4068 }
4069 
4070 /******************************************************************/
4071 /* */
4072 /* */
4073 /******************************************************************/
4074 
4075 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_side ( float side, float side_col )
4076 {
4077  #ifdef STICKY_WALLRIDES
4078  // Prevous checks might have put us into a wall ride, so just ignore future checks
4079  if (GetState() == WALL)
4080  {
4081  return false;
4082  }
4083  #endif
4084 
4085  // - - - side collision detection - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4086 
4087  m_col_start = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xb45b39e2, "Skater_side_collide_height"));
4088 
4089  float col_len = side_col;
4090  #ifdef STICKY_WALLRIDES
4091  if (GetState() == AIR)
4092  {
4093  col_len += GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x1c58c8b4, "Skater_air_extra_side_col"));
4094  }
4095  #endif
4096  m_col_end = m_col_start + side * GetMatrix()[X] * col_len;
4097 
4098  if (!get_member_feeler_collision()) return false;
4099 
4100  Mth::Vector WallFloorNormal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4101 
4102  #ifdef STICKY_WALLRIDES
4103  if (GetState() == AIR)
4104  {
4105  if (check_for_wallride())
4106  {
4107  return true;
4108  }
4109  else
4110  {
4111  // push a bit away from the wall if in the air
4112  Mth::Vector to_wall = m_feeler.GetPoint();
4113  to_wall -= m_col_start; // vector towards the wall
4114  float push_dist = to_wall.Length(); // distance to wall
4115  push_dist -= col_len - side_col; // adjust by the extra push we gave
4116  if (push_dist > 0.0f) // if closer to wall than side_col
4117  {
4118  to_wall.Normalize(push_dist); // then get direction to wall, scaled by dist we want to move
4119  GetPos() -= to_wall / 10.0f; // move 1/10th of the way, for nice lerp
4120  DUMP_POSITION;
4121 
4122  float turn_angle;
4123  // Rotate away from wall only if not rotating myself
4124  // otherwise velocity can be continually rotated one way while
4125  // the orientation is rated the other way via the d-pad
4126 
4127  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
4128 
4129  // don't rotate at all if in the air, as it changes our direction, usually not what we want
4130  if (GetState() != AIR
4131  && !control_pad.m_R1.GetPressed()
4132  && !control_pad.m_L1.GetPressed()
4133  && !control_pad.m_left.GetPressed()
4134  && !control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
4135  {
4136  rotate_away_from_wall(WallFloorNormal, turn_angle, 0.2f); // and rotate away from the wall
4137  }
4138  }
4139  }
4140  }
4141  else
4142  #endif
4143  {
4144  float angle = Mth::DotProduct(WallFloorNormal, GetMatrix()[Y]);
4145  // Consider 90+-30 degrees as wall (_0_5)
4146  // Consider 90+-15 degrees as wall (_0_25)
4147  if (angle < 0.25f && angle > -0.25f)
4148  {
4149  // Undo movement
4150  GetPos() = m_safe_pos;
4151  DUMP_POSITION;
4152 
4153  float turn_angle;
4154  rotate_away_from_wall(WallFloorNormal, turn_angle, 0.2f);
4155 
4156  // Try moving him off the wall:
4157  CFeeler feeler(m_feeler.GetPoint() + WallFloorNormal, m_feeler.GetPoint() + WallFloorNormal * side_col);
4158  if (!feeler.GetCollision())
4159  {
4160  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_BONK, m_feeler);
4161  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return false;
4162 
4163  // Lower skater back down to the ground
4164  GetPos() = feeler.m_end - GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xb45b39e2,"Skater_side_collide_height"));
4165  DUMP_POSITION;
4166  return true;
4167  }
4168  }
4169  }
4170 
4171  return false;
4172 }
4173 
4174 /******************************************************************/
4175 /* */
4176 /* */
4177 /******************************************************************/
4178 
4179 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_for_wallpush ( )
4180 {
4181  // requires that m_feeler is a wall
4182 
4183  if (!mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_triangle.GetPressed()) return false;
4184 
4185  // last wallpush must not have been too recently
4186  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_last_wallpush_time_stamp) < Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x17d543, "Physics_Disallow_Rewallpush_Duration"))) return false;
4187 
4188  // wall normal must be opposite our forward direction; just under the maximum flail angle
4189  if (Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], m_feeler.GetNormal()) >= -sinf(Mth::DegToRad(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x1483fd01, "Wall_Bounce_Dont_Slow_Angle")) - 1.0f))) return false;
4190 
4191  // last wallplant must not have been too recently
4192  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_last_wallplant_time_stamp) < Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x17d543, "Physics_Disallow_Rewallpush_Duration"))) return false;
4193 
4194  // throw a wallpush event for the scripts
4195  GetObject()->SelfEvent(CRCD(0x4c03635b, "WallPush"));
4196 
4197  // check to see if the wallpush has been canceled during the event
4198  if (GetFlag(CANCEL_WALL_PUSH))
4199  {
4200  SetFlagFalse(CANCEL_WALL_PUSH);
4201  return false;
4202  }
4203 
4204  // reverse direction of velocity perpendicular to the wall
4205  Mth::Vector perp_vel = Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), m_feeler.GetNormal()) * m_feeler.GetNormal();
4206  GetVel() -= 2.0f * perp_vel;
4207 
4208  // damp horizontal velocity
4209  float speed = GetVel().Length();
4210  if (speed > 0.001f)
4211  {
4212  GetVel() *= Mth::Max(
4213  Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xb78542c2, "Physics_Wallpush_Min_Exit_Speed")),
4214  speed - Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x1112fb1c, "Physics_Wallpush_Speed_Loss"))
4215  ) / speed;
4216  }
4217  else
4218  {
4219  GetVel() = -Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xb78542c2, "Physics_Wallpush_Min_Exit_Speed")) * GetMatrix()[Z];
4220  }
4221 
4222  // project the resulting velocity into the ground's plane
4223  GetVel().RotateToPlane(m_current_normal);
4224 
4225  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4226 
4227  // set orientation along new velocity
4228  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
4229  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
4230  GetMatrix()[Y] = m_current_normal;
4231  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
4232  ResetLerpingMatrix();
4233 
4234  // time stamp the wallplant
4235  m_last_wallpush_time_stamp = Tmr::GetTime();
4236 
4237  return true;
4238 }
4239 
4240 /******************************************************************/
4241 /* */
4242 /* */
4243 /******************************************************************/
4244 
4245 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_for_wallplant ( )
4246 {
4247  // requires that m_feeler is a wall
4248 
4249  // we must be somewhat vertical
4250  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] < 0.1f) return false;
4251 
4252  // last wallplant must not have been too recently
4253  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_last_wallplant_time_stamp) < Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x82135dd7, "Physics_Disallow_Rewallplant_Duration"))) return false;
4254 
4255  // not when you're too near the ground
4256  if (mp_state_component->m_height < Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xd5349cc6, "Physics_Min_Wallplant_Height"))) return false;
4257 
4258  // wall must be substantially vertical
4259  if (!(m_feeler.GetFlags() & mFD_VERT) && Mth::Abs(m_feeler.GetNormal()[Y]) > 0.1f) return false;
4260 
4261  float speed = GetVel().Length();
4262  if (speed < 0.01f) return false;
4263  Mth::Vector forward = GetVel() / speed;
4264 
4265  // horizontal wall normal must be opposite our horizontal velocity
4266  Mth::Vector horizontal_forward = forward;
4267  horizontal_forward[Y] = 0.0f;
4268  horizontal_forward.Normalize();
4269  Mth::Vector horizontal_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4270  horizontal_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
4271  horizontal_normal.Normalize();
4272  if (Mth::DotProduct(horizontal_forward, horizontal_normal) > -sinf(Mth::DegToRad(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x8f79cc1c, "Physics_Wallplant_Min_Approach_Angle"))))) return false;
4273 
4274  // here we attempt to stop wallplant when in is more likely that the player is going for a grind
4275  if (GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f && mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_triangle.GetPressed())
4276  {
4277  Mth::Vector wall_point = m_feeler.GetPoint();
4278  Mth::Vector wall_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4279 
4280  Mth::Vector wall_up_vel(0.0f, GetVel()[Y] * 0.15f, 0.0f); // check 0.15 seconds ahead
4281  wall_up_vel.RotateToPlane(wall_normal);
4282 
4283  // check at what height will be in two frames
4284  wall_point += wall_up_vel;
4285 
4286  CFeeler feeler(wall_point + wall_normal * 6.0f, wall_point - wall_normal * 6.0f);
4287  if (!feeler.GetCollision())
4288  {
4289  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
4290  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3ae85eef, "skater_trails")))
4291  {
4292  feeler.DebugLine(255, 255, 0, 0);
4293  }
4294  #endif
4295  return false;
4296  }
4297  else
4298  {
4299  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
4300  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3ae85eef, "skater_trails")))
4301  {
4302  feeler.DebugLine(255, 0, 255, 0);
4303  }
4304  #endif
4305  }
4306  }
4307 
4308  // check for wallplant trick
4309  // K: Modified this to take an array of triggers, so that Kurt could check out using
4310  // Down,X DownLeft,X or DownRight,X as a trigger.
4311  bool triggered=false;
4312  Script::CArray *p_trick_query_array=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0x5d1f84a7, "Wallplant_Trick"));
4313  for (uint32 i=0; i<p_trick_query_array->GetSize(); ++i)
4314  {
4315  Script::CStruct *p_trick_query_struct=p_trick_query_array->GetStructure(i);
4316  if (mp_trick_component->QueryEvents(p_trick_query_struct))
4317  {
4318  triggered=true;
4319  break;
4320  }
4321  }
4322  if (!triggered)
4323  {
4324  return false;
4325  }
4326 
4327  // trip wallplant triggers
4328  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_JUMP_OFF, m_feeler);
4329  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return true;
4330 
4331  // zero vertical velocity
4332  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
4333 
4334  // reverse velocity in the direction of the wall's normal
4335  Mth::Vector perp_vel = Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), horizontal_normal) * horizontal_normal;
4336  GetVel() -= 2.0f * perp_vel;
4337 
4338  // damp horizontal velocity
4339  float horizontal_speed = sqrtf(GetVel()[X] * GetVel()[X] + GetVel()[Z] * GetVel()[Z]);
4340  if (horizontal_speed > 0.0001f)
4341  {
4342  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
4343  GetVel().Normalize(Mth::Max(
4344  Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x7cee396c, "Physics_Wallplant_Min_Exit_Speed")),
4345  horizontal_speed - Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x9b2d4a3, "Physics_Wallplant_Speed_Loss"))
4346  ));
4347  }
4348  else
4349  {
4350  GetVel() = -Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x7cee396c, "Physics_Wallplant_Min_Exit_Speed")) * horizontal_forward;
4351  }
4352 
4353  // replace vertical velocity with a wallplant boost
4354  GetVel()[Y] = Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x74957fa, "Physics_Wallplant_Vertical_Exit_Speed"));
4355 
4356  if (m_feeler.IsMovableCollision())
4357  {
4358  // if the wall is moving, we are now in contact with it
4359  if (!mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact() || m_feeler.GetMovingObject() != mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject())
4360  {
4361  mp_movable_contact_component->LoseAnyContact();
4362  mp_movable_contact_component->ObtainContact(m_feeler.GetMovingObject());
4363  }
4364  }
4365 
4366  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4367 
4368  // move to just outside the wall, insuring that there is no additional collision along the line to that point
4369  m_feeler.m_start = m_feeler.GetPoint();
4370  m_feeler.m_end = m_feeler.GetPoint() + Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x24be8f0, "Physics_Wallplant_Distance_From_Wall")) * m_feeler.GetNormal();
4371  if (m_feeler.GetCollision())
4372  {
4373  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() + 0.1f * m_feeler.GetNormal();
4374  }
4375  else
4376  {
4377  GetPos() = m_feeler.m_end;
4378  }
4379  DUMP_POSITION;
4380 
4381  // set orientation along new velocity
4382  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
4383  GetMatrix()[Z][Y] = 0.0f;
4384  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
4385  GetMatrix()[Y].Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
4386  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
4387  ResetLerpingMatrix();
4388 
4389  // time stamp the wallplant
4390  m_last_wallplant_time_stamp = Tmr::GetTime();
4391 
4392  // throw a wallplant event for the scripts
4393  GetObject()->SelfEvent(CRCD(0xcf74f6b7, "WallPlant"));
4394 
4395  // trick off the object
4396  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_feeler.GetNodeChecksum());
4397 
4398  // turn back on orientation control in case we just came out of walking
4399  SetFlagFalse(NO_ORIENTATION_CONTROL);
4400 
4401  // acid drops are always allowed after a wallplant
4402  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
4403 
4404  // let the camera know we're snapping our position slightly
4405  SetFlagTrue(SNAPPED);
4406 
4407  // enter wallplant state
4408  SetState(WALLPLANT);
4409 
4410  return true;
4411 }
4412 
4413 /******************************************************************/
4414 /* */
4415 /* */
4416 /******************************************************************/
4417 
4418 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_for_wallride ( )
4419 {
4420  // Requires that m_feeler is a valid wall
4421 
4422  if (!m_col_flag_wallable) return false;
4423 
4424  // Allow a wall-ride attempt if triangle being pressed & long enough after the last wall-ride.
4425  if ((mp_trick_component->GetButtonState(CRCD(0x20689278, "Triangle")) || mp_trick_component->TriggeredInLastNMilliseconds(
4426  CRCD(0x20689278, "Triangle"),
4427  1000 * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x5d241b00, "Wall_Ride_Triangle_Window"))
4428  )) && static_cast< int >(Tmr::ElapsedTime(mWallrideTime)) > 1000 * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xf0c74ec2, "Wall_Ride_Delay")))
4429  {
4431  // check to see if we are going upwards, and within 0.15 seconds from the top of the wall (based on current up speed)
4432  // and we are going upwards, then don't wallride, as we will probably snap into a rail soon after
4433  //
4434 
4435  if (GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f)
4436  {
4437  Mth::Vector wall_point = m_feeler.GetPoint();
4438  Mth::Vector wall_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4439 
4440  Mth::Vector wall_up_vel(0.0f, GetVel()[Y] * 0.15f, 0.0f); // check 0.15 seconds ahead
4441  wall_up_vel.RotateToPlane(wall_normal);
4442 
4443  // check at what height will be in two frames
4444  wall_point += wall_up_vel;
4445 
4446  CFeeler check_feeler(wall_point + wall_normal * 6.0f, wall_point - wall_normal * 6.0f);
4447  if (!check_feeler.GetCollision()) return false;
4448  }
4449 
4451  mWallNormal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4452 
4453  Mth::Vector SquashedWallNormal = mWallNormal; // wall normal in the XZ plane
4454  SquashedWallNormal[Y] = 0;
4455  SquashedWallNormal.Normalize();
4456 
4457  Mth::Vector SquashedVel = GetVel(); // velocity in the XZ plane
4458  SquashedVel[Y] = 0;
4459  SquashedVel.Normalize();
4460 
4461  // Calculate the speed "along" the wall (i.e., in the XZ plane) needed to have enough speed along the wall to make the wallride viable
4462  // (otherwise we just go up and down, and end up at odd angles)
4463  Mth::Vector vel_along_wall = GetVel();
4464  vel_along_wall[Y] = 0;
4465  vel_along_wall.ProjectToPlane(SquashedWallNormal);
4466  float speed_along_wall = vel_along_wall.Length();
4467
