4468  if (speed_along_wall < GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xf0636a67, "Wall_Ride_Min_Speed"))) return false;
4469 
4470  float dot = fabsf(Mth::DotProduct(SquashedVel, SquashedWallNormal));
4471 
4472  // If all angles OK then trigger a wall-ride.
4473  if (mWallNormal[Y] > -sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xae23e850, "Wall_Ride_Upside_Down_Angle")))) &&
4474  dot < sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x6ac9f64d, "Wall_Ride_Max_Incident_Angle")))) &&
4475  GetMatrix()[Y][Y] > cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbfcbb7e8, "Wall_Ride_Max_Tilt")))))
4476  {
4477  if (!mp_trick_component->GraffitiTrickStarted())
4478  {
4479  // clear the graffiti trick buffer if we're moving to a new
4480  // world sector, but haven't started our trick yet...
4481  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted(false);
4482  }
4483 
4484  // landed in a wall ride, check for triggers associated with this object
4485  // note we pass "TRIGGER_LAND_ON", perhaps not semanticaly correct but we use it for landing on rails,
4486  // so the meaning is the same across ground-rail-wallride
4487  set_last_ground_feeler(m_feeler);
4488  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_LAND_ON, m_last_ground_feeler);
4489  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return false;
4490 
4491  Mth::Vector point = m_feeler.GetPoint();
4492 
4493  // check to see if we are going into a corner
4494  // by checking the vector from out current pos along a line parallel to our movment rotated onto the wall.
4495  Mth::Vector forward_vel = GetPos() - GetOldPos();
4496  forward_vel.RotateToPlane(mWallNormal);
4497  m_col_start = GetPos();
4498  m_col_end = GetPos() + forward_vel * 3.0f;
4499  if (get_member_feeler_collision()) return false;
4500 
4501  // Record start time.
4502  mWallrideTime = static_cast< int >(Tmr::GetTime());
4503 
4504  // Snap position to wall.
4505  // we don't want to snap too close
4506  // previously we moved him an inch away from the wall after snapping him to the collision point.
4507  // However, this seemed to cause problems in corner so now I just move him back one inch along the collision line
4508  // which is hence guarenteed not to push him through walls.
4509 
4510  GetPos() = point; // move skater
4511  GetPos() += mWallNormal; // move away from surface
4512  DUMP_POSITION;
4513 
4514  // Rotate velocity to plane.
4515  GetVel().RotateToPlane(mWallNormal);
4516  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4517 
4518  // Mick: if we set the velocity as direction, skater will keep going up more
4519  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
4520 
4521  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
4522  GetMatrix()[Y] = mWallNormal;
4523  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
4524  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
4525  ResetLerpingMatrix();
4526 
4527  // Decide whether left or right wall-ride.
4528  #if 0 // old code
4529  // Mth::Vector Up(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
4530  // Mth::Vector Cross = Mth::CrossProduct(mWallNormal, Up);
4531  #else
4532  Mth::Vector Cross(-mWallNormal[Z], 0.0f, mWallNormal[X], 0.0f);
4533  #endif
4534 
4535  if (Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), Cross) < 0.0f)
4536  {
4537  // Let the script do any extra logic, like playing anims & stuff.
4538  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x5de19c83, "WallRideLeft"));
4539  }
4540  else
4541  {
4542  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x51372712, "WallRideRight"));
4543  }
4544 
4545  SetState(WALL);
4546 
4547  // Handle contact
4548  check_movable_contact();
4549 
4550  return true;
4551  }
4552  else
4553  {
4554  // Otherwise trigger the bail script.
4555  // FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x2ec3c7f5, "WallRideBail"));
4556  }
4557  }
4558  return false;
4559 }
4560 
4561 /******************************************************************/
4562 /* */
4563 /* */
4564 /******************************************************************/
4565 
4566 float CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::rotate_away_from_wall ( const Mth::Vector& normal, float &turn_angle, float lerp )
4567 {
4568  // given a wall normal, then calculate the "turn_angle" to rotate the skater by and rotate the matrix and display matrix by this
4569  // return the angle between the skater and the wall
4570  // note turn_angle is passed by reference, and is altered !!!!
4571 
4572  // given m_right(dot)normal, we should be able to get a nice angle
4573  float dot_right_normal = Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[X], normal);
4574 
4575  float angle = acosf(Mth::Clamp(dot_right_normal, -1.0f, 1.0f));
4576 
4577  if (angle > Mth::PI / 2.0f)
4578  {
4579  angle -= Mth::PI;
4580  }
4581 
4582  // angle away from the wall
4583  turn_angle = angle * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe07ee1a9, "Wall_Bounce_Angle_Multiplier")) * lerp;
4584 
4585  // Rotate the skater so he is at a slight angle to the wall, especially if we are in a right angled corner, where the skater will bounce out
4586 
4587  GetVel().RotateY(turn_angle);
4588  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4589  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(turn_angle);
4590  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(turn_angle);
4591 
4592  return angle;
4593 }
4594 
4595 /******************************************************************/
4596 /* */
4597 /* */
4598 /******************************************************************/
4599 
4600 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_leaning_into_wall ( )
4601 {
4602  // If we are leaning left or right, then do a collision check in that direction, and proportional to the amount of the lean.
4603  // If there is a collision, then push the skater away from the wall.
4604 
4605  // First determine if we actually need to be doing this
4606 
4607  // Need to be moving at a reasonable rate
4608  if (GetVel().Length() > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbc33d268, "Skate_min_wall_lean_push_speed"))) return;
4609 
4610  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
4611 
4612  float time;
4613  if (control_pad.m_left.GetPressed())
4614  {
4615  time = control_pad.m_left.GetPressedTime();
4616  }
4617  else if (control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
4618  {
4619  time = control_pad.m_right.GetPressedTime();
4620  }
4621  else
4622  {
4623  return;
4624  }
4625  time *= 1.0f / 1000.0f;
4626 
4627  // Calculate the length of the vector based on how long you have held down the left or right button.
4628  // (Ideally it would be tied to the animation, but this is simple, and it works)
4629  float min_time = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x435f0653, "Skate_wall_lean_push_time"));
4630  if (time > min_time)
4631  {
4632  time = min_time;
4633  }
4634 
4635  if (control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
4636  {
4637  time = -time;
4638  }
4639  float length = time / min_time * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x4b8bab12, "Skate_wall_lean_push_length"));
4640 
4641 
4642  // Now we've got the length, and in the right direction, check for a collision
4643 
4644  m_col_start = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbfbbd0af, "Skate_wall_lean_push_height"));
4645  m_col_end = m_col_start + GetMatrix()[X] * length;
4646  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
4647  {
4648 
4649  // see how much we are into the wall
4650  Mth::Vector push = m_feeler.GetPoint() - m_col_end;
4651 
4652  // Only push directly out from the wall (like the upwards collision, otherwise we get pushed back)
4653  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
4654  push.ProjectToNormal(normal);
4655 
4656  m_col_start = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y];
4657  m_col_end = m_col_start + push;
4658  if (!get_member_feeler_collision())
4659  {
4660  // just move him, might put him 1 inch above the ground, but regular physics should snap him down
4661  GetPos() = m_col_end - GetMatrix()[Y];
4662  DUMP_POSITION;
4663  }
4664  }
4665 }
4666 
4667 /******************************************************************/
4668 /* */
4669 /* */
4670 /******************************************************************/
4671 
4672 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::flip_if_skating_backwards ( )
4673 {
4674  // if sufficient speed, and facing backwards
4675  if (!GetFlag(IS_BAILING)
4676  && !GetFlag(SKITCHING) // if skitching, probably just car turning a slow sharp corner
4677  && !is_braking()
4678  && Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), GetMatrix()[Z]) < 0.0f
4679  && GetVel().LengthSqr() > Mth::Sqr(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x2bf71eeb, "Skater_Flip_Speed")))
4680  )
4681  {
4682  // flip Z and X, to rotate 180 degrees about y
4683  GetMatrix()[Z] = -GetMatrix()[Z];
4684  GetMatrix()[X] = -GetMatrix()[X];
4685  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z] = -m_lerping_display_matrix[Z];
4686  m_lerping_display_matrix[X] = -m_lerping_display_matrix[X];
4687 
4688  // Dan: we can no longer flip mid animation
4689  /*
4690  CSkaterFlipAndRotateComponent* p_flip_and_rotate_component = GetSkaterFlipAndRotateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
4691  Dbg_Assert(p_flip_and_rotate_component);
4692  p_flip_and_rotate_component->ToggleFlipState();
4693  */
4694  }
4695 }
4696 
4697 /******************************************************************/
4698 /* */
4699 /* */
4700 /******************************************************************/
4701 
4702 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_flag_ollie_exception ( )
4703 {
4704  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
4705  if (GetFlag(TENSE) && Script::GetInteger("TurboOllie"))
4706  {
4707  m_tense_time = GetFlagElapsedTime(TENSE);
4708  SetFlagFalse(TENSE);
4709  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x8ffefb28, "Ollied"));
4710  return true;
4711  }
4712  #endif
4713 
4714  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
4715 
4716  if (GetFlag(TENSE) && !control_pad.m_x.GetPressed())
4717  {
4718  // Remember the tense time, cause it will be needed when the Jump script command executes.
4719  m_tense_time = GetFlagElapsedTime(TENSE);
4720 
4721  SetFlagFalse(TENSE);
4722 
4723  control_pad.m_x.ClearRelease();
4724 
4725  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x8ffefb28, "Ollied"));
4726 
4727  return true;
4728  }
4729 
4730  return false;
4731 }
4732 
4733 /******************************************************************/
4734 /* */
4735 /* */
4736 /******************************************************************/
4737 
4738 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_skitch ( )
4739 {
4740  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
4741 
4742  if (GetFlag(SKITCHING) || !SKITCH_BUTTON || GetState() != GROUND) return;
4743 
4744  // Find the nearest skitch point.
4745  Mth::Vector closest_pos;
4746  float closest_dist = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x2928f080, "Skitch_Max_Distance"));
4747  CCompositeObject* p_closest = NULL;
4748 
4749  for (CSkitchComponent *p_skitch_comp = static_cast< CSkitchComponent* >(CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType(CRC_SKITCH));
4750  p_skitch_comp;
4751  p_skitch_comp = static_cast< CSkitchComponent* >(p_skitch_comp->GetNextSameType()))
4752  {
4753  if (!p_skitch_comp->CanSkitch()) continue;
4754 
4755  CCompositeObject* p_composite_object = p_skitch_comp->GetObject();
4756  if (p_composite_object == GetObject()) continue;
4757 
4758  Mth::Vector skitch_point(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
4759  int skitch_index = p_skitch_comp->GetNearestSkitchPoint(&skitch_point, GetPos());
4760  if (skitch_index == -1) continue;
4761 
4762  Mth::Vector line_to = skitch_point - GetPos();
4763  float dist_to = line_to.Length();
4764  if ( dist_to < closest_dist)
4765  {
4766  closest_dist = dist_to;
4767  p_closest = p_composite_object;
4768  closest_pos = skitch_point;
4769  m_skitch_index = skitch_index;
4770  }
4771  }
4772 
4773  if (p_closest)
4774  {
4775  // Clear any triggers, so old L1/R1 presses don't affect us.
4776  control_pad.m_L1.ClearTrigger();
4777  control_pad.m_R1.ClearTrigger();
4778  mp_skitch_object = p_closest;
4779 
4780  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x2f184eb1, "Skitched"));
4781  }
4782 }
4783 
4784 /******************************************************************/
4785 /* */
4786 /* */
4787 /******************************************************************/
4788 
4789 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_in_air_physics ( )
4790 {
4791  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
4792 
4793  // Acceleration is re-calculated every frame
4794  // here it is just set to the air gravity
4795  // there are generally no other forces that we would use in the air
4796 
4797  Mth::Vector acc(0.0f, get_air_gravity(), 0.0f);
4798 
4799  SetFlagFalse(LAST_POLY_WAS_VERT);
4800 
4801  // disallow acid drops before this frame's breaking of vert air
4802  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) || GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS) || GetFlag(IN_ACID_DROP) || GetFlag(IS_BAILING))
4803  {
4804  SetFlagTrue(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
4805  }
4806 
4808  // Adjust orientation before we do any movement
4809  // in the air the orientation is independent of the velocity but it will affect the collision checks we do (left/right/forwards/up)
4810 
4811  handle_air_rotation(); // rotate left/right (spinning by holding left/right or L1/R1)
4812 
4813  handle_air_lean(); // lean forwards backwards (by hold up/down) also handles spine leans
4814 
4815  handle_transfer_slerping(); // during acid drops, we slerp to our required orientation
4816 
4817  if (GetFlag(IN_RECOVERY) || VERT_RECOVERY_BUTTONS)
4818  {
4819  // no control here, except for the VERT_RECOVERY_BUTTONS, above
4820  handle_air_vert_recovery(); // recovering from going off the end of a vert polygon
4821  }
4822 
4823  // Upright if not vert, and not doing a spine transfer
4824  if (!GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS) && !mp_rotate_component->IsApplyingRotation(X) && !mp_rotate_component->IsApplyingRotation(Z))
4825  {
4826  rotate_upright();
4827  }
4828 
4829  // end of adjusting orientation in air
4831 
4833  // Apply special friction even in the air
4834 
4835  if (m_special_friction_duration != 0.0f)
4836  {
4837  apply_rolling_friction();
4838  }
4839 
4840  // end of friction
4842 
4844  // Calculate what velocity to use
4845  // generally this is just the stored m_vel, but if we are doing
4846  // a spine transfer we a dd in m_spine_vel
4847  // (note, we also update the state of the spine transfer here,
4848  // perhaps that would be better done elsewhere)
4849 
4850  Mth::Vector vel = GetVel();
4851 
4853 
4854  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
4855  {
4856  // this check is only valid if we are not in contact with a moving object
4857  if (vel[Y] < 0.0f && GetPos()[Y] < m_transfer_target_height) // just check if we have dropped below the target height
4858  {
4859  // if (Mth::Abs(mp_state_component->m_spine_vel.Length() - 0.1f) > 1.0f)
4860  // {
4861  // Gfx::AddDebugStar(GetPos(), 24, GREEN, 0);
4862  // }
4863  mp_state_component->m_spine_vel.Normalize(0.1f); // make spine velocity very small, but still there, so camera works
4864  }
4865  else
4866  {
4867  vel += mp_state_component->m_spine_vel;
4868  }
4869  }
4870 
4872  // calculate contact movement
4873  // If the skater is in contact with an object, then his velocity (m_vel) is considered to be local to that object, so here we have to add in the
4874  // movement of the object from the last frame; we also account for rotation here, in the call to mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact
4875 
4876  Mth::Vector contact_movement;
4877  contact_movement.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
4878 
4879  // if we are in contact with something, then factor in that "movement"
4880  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos()))
4881  {
4882  contact_movement = mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
4883  }
4884 
4885  // end of calculating contact movment
4887 
4889  // Update position
4890 
4891  // Update position using correct equations of motion (S = ut + 0.5at^2)
4892  GetPos() += vel * m_frame_length + acc * (0.5f * m_frame_length * m_frame_length);
4893  DUMP_POSITION;
4894 
4895  // add in movement due to contact
4896  GetPos() += contact_movement;
4897  DUMP_POSITION;
4898 
4899  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
4900  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3ae85eef, "skater_trails")))
4901  {
4902  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
4903  {
4904  Gfx::AddDebugLine(GetPos(), GetOldPos(), RED, 0, 0);
4905  }
4906  else if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
4907  {
4908  Gfx::AddDebugLine(GetPos(), GetOldPos(), YELLOW, 0, 0);
4909  }
4910  else
4911  {
4912  Gfx::AddDebugLine(GetPos(), GetOldPos(), BLUE, 0, 0);
4913  }
4914  }
4915  #endif
4916 
4917  //
4918  // end updating position
4920 
4921 
4923  // update velocity
4924  //
4925 
4926  // Update Velocity in air
4927  GetVel() += acc * m_frame_length;
4928  DUMP_VELOCITY;
4929 
4930  //
4931  // end updating velocity
4933 
4935  // Handle trying to break VERT
4936  //
4937 
4938  if (GetFlag(CAN_BREAK_VERT))
4939  {
4940  if (GetFlag(TRACKING_VERT) && GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
4941  {
4942  // might want to check how long we've been in the air before allowing this
4943  // also don't want to do it if we've been doing tricks and stuff
4944 
4945  // first of all, check if there is a collision beneath my feet
4946  m_col_start = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y] * 1.0f; // bit above the feet
4947  m_col_end = GetPos() + GetMatrix()[Y] * -23.0f;
4948  if (!get_member_feeler_collision())
4949  {
4950  maybe_break_vert();
4951 
4952  // if we did not break vert now, then only allow us to break vert later if we've been tapping the "up" button
4953  // this is indicated by us having RELEASED or Pressed in the last few ticks
4954  if (static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetReleasedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x6bb5b751, "Skater_vert_active_up_time"))
4955  && static_cast< int >(control_pad.m_up.GetPressedTime()) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x6bb5b751, "Skater_vert_active_up_time")))
4956  {
4957  // "UP" was not pressed any time recently, so don't let us break late
4958  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
4959  }
4960  }
4961  }
4962 
4963  // Allow us to break vert polys for a while after we ge onto them
4964  // to make it more robust
4965  // Essentially lets CAN_BREAK_VERT flag expire....
4966  if (static_cast< int >(Tmr::ElapsedTime(GetFlagTime(CAN_BREAK_VERT))) > GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0x26495947, "Skater_Vert_Allow_break_Time")))
4967  {
4968  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
4969  }
4970  }
4971  else
4972  {
4973  // We are flagged as not being able to break vert
4974  // however, we still want to be able to do this at any time on the up journey
4975  // if we try break the spine
4976  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS) && GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f)
4977  {
4978  maybe_break_vert();
4979  }
4980 
4981  }
4982 
4983  //
4984  // End of Handling breaking Vert
4986 
4987  if (!mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact())
4988  {
4989 
4991  // Now update the tracking position before we do a collision check
4992  // "Tracking" is used when we are "vert" (moving in a vertical plane through the air above a quarterpipe), to track the ground directly
4993  // benath us, and if the QP bends, to move the skater appropiately so he can catch vert air along bent QPs, and round corners.
4994 
4995  if (GetFlag(TRACKING_VERT) && GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
4996  {
4997  m_col_start[X] = GetPos()[X];
4998  m_col_start[Y] = m_vert_pos[Y];
4999  m_col_start[Z] = GetPos()[Z];
5000 
5001  m_col_end = m_col_start;
5002 
5003  m_col_start += m_vert_normal * 30; // Away from face
5004  m_col_end -= m_vert_normal * 30; // into face
5005 
5006  // Now see if there is a collision, and track it if so
5007 
5008  // First we try an above this position
5009  // raising us up by m_vert_upstep
5010  // which starts at 6 inches, and is halved down until
5011  // less than half an inch, at which point we stop trying to move up
5012 
5013  bool collision;
5014 
5015  if (m_vert_upstep > 0.5f)
5016  {
5017  m_col_start[Y] += m_vert_upstep;
5018  m_col_end[Y] += m_vert_upstep;
5019  // Only check for vert polys, ignore collision info
5020  collision = get_member_feeler_collision(0, mFD_VERT);
5021 
5022  // If we did not find a collision six inches above, then check back at the old height
5023  if (!collision)
5024  {
5025  m_col_start[Y] -= m_vert_upstep;
5026  m_col_end[Y] -= m_vert_upstep;
5027  m_vert_upstep *= 1.0f / 2.0f; // binary search will zoom in on the edge
5028  collision = get_member_feeler_collision(0, mFD_VERT);
5029  }
5030  }
5031  else
5032  {
5033  collision = get_member_feeler_collision(0, mFD_VERT);
5034  }
5035 
5036 
5037  if (!collision)
5038  {
5039  // there is no collision, which usually mean we have gone off the end of a qp but might mean the tracking point has drifted off the top
5040  // of the very polygon (it might not be exactly horizontal), so try tracking down up to 30 inches to see if we can find it again
5041  for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
5042  {
5043  m_col_start[Y] -= 3.0f;
5044  m_col_end[Y] -= 3.0f;
5045  collision = get_member_feeler_collision(0, mFD_VERT);
5046  if (collision)
5047  {
5048  // need to store new m_vert_pos
5049  // as code below does not generally allow us to go below it
5050  m_vert_pos[Y] = m_feeler.GetPoint()[Y];
5051  break;
5052  }
5053  }
5054 
5055  }
5056 
5057 
5058  // Dot product in the XZ plane is the angle between them
5059  float change_dot = sqrtf(
5060  m_vert_normal[X] * m_feeler.GetNormal()[X] + m_vert_normal[Z] * m_feeler.GetNormal()[Z]
5061  );
5062 
5063  // the dot check is a fix for sharp corners, nearly are right angles, TT#438
5064  if (collision && change_dot > 0.02f)
5065  {
5066  // let's just track it simple for now
5067  Mth::Vector track_point = m_feeler.GetPoint();
5068 
5069  // This is a bit of a patch
5070  // basically clamp the tracking point at the hihgest level it has reached, that way we can never "slip" down a slope
5071  // which the rest of the physics makes you do, for reasons best explained with a diagram
5072  if (m_vert_pos[Y] > track_point[Y])
5073  {
5074  track_point[Y] = m_vert_pos[Y];
5075  }
5076 
5077  // keep vert pos updated (only used for height)
5078  m_vert_pos = track_point;
5079 
5080  GetPos()[X] = track_point[X];
5081  GetPos()[Z] = track_point[Z];
5082  m_vert_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
5083 
5084  // offset the jumper away from the plane
5085  GetPos() += m_vert_normal * (GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x78384871, "Physics_Vert_Push_Out")));
5086  DUMP_POSITION;
5087 
5088  // The normal we might be tracking might not be vert, so need to adjust it so it is fully horizontal
5089  // it should never be fully horizontal (which would cause it to implode
5090  Mth::Vector flat_normal = m_vert_normal;
5091  flat_normal[Y] = 0.0f;
5092  flat_normal.Normalize();
5093 
5094  // adjust the orientation to match the plane
5095  new_normal(flat_normal);
5096 
5097  // now velocity
5098  GetVel().RotateToPlane(flat_normal);
5099  }
5100  else
5101  {
5102  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
5103  }
5104  }
5105  }
5106 
5107  //
5108  // End of updating tracking
5110 
5112  // Adjust the normal while in the air
5113  //
5114 
5115  // When on an air poly, we have the usual drifting of the UP vector to smooth out changes in the normal
5116  // (note, we can be in VERT_AIR, but also SPINE_PHYSICS, in whcih case the orientation is controled by the "lean" routine
5117  // which is leaning the skater forward, so he comes down on the opposing face)
5118  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS)
5119  && !mp_rotate_component->IsApplyingRotation(X) && !mp_rotate_component->IsApplyingRotation(Z))
5120  {
5121  adjust_normal();
5122  }
5123  else
5124  {
5125  // otherwise, the matrix is same for display and physics
5126  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5127  }
5128 
5129  //
5130  // End of adjusting normal
5132 
5133 
5135  // Handle any collisions resultant from our movement
5136  // remember at this point m_pos is the new position
5137  // and we might have gone through a wall
5138 
5139  // here again, we are factoring in the contact_movement to the start position
5140  // We check if there is anything in font of us
5141  bool snapped_up = handle_forward_collision_in_air(GetOldPos() + contact_movement);
5142 
5143  // If we are now in the WALL (Wallride) state, then just return
5144  if (GetState() == WALL || GetState() == WALLPLANT)
5145  {
5146  // Maybe call DoWallPhysics() to avoid a glitch? Maybe not, cos GetOldPos() will be wrong ?
5147  return;
5148  }
5149 
5150  // check for actual movement collision (along the full line of travel)
5151  // note we factor in the contact_movement here which effectivly ignores it
5152  // so contact movement could possibly drag us through a solid object
5153  // if this is a problem, then we need to add another collision check, just for the contact movement
5154  m_col_start = GetOldPos() + contact_movement;
5155  m_col_end = GetPos();
5156 
5157  if (!snapped_up && get_member_feeler_collision())
5158  {
5159  bool hit_vertical = m_feeler.GetNormal()[Y] < 0.1f;
5160 
5161  if (check_for_air_snap_up(GetOldPos() + contact_movement) && (GetVel()[Y] > 10.0f || hit_vertical) && mp_movable_contact_component->GetTimeSinceLastLostContact() > 500)
5162  {
5163  }
5164  else
5165  {
5166  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
5167 
5168  // set our position (the point of contact) to be that point we just found
5169  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint();
5170 
5171  // Move point up one inch to avoid dropping through geometry with something below it (like canada blades, and park editor stuff)
5172  GetPos() += normal;
5173  DUMP_POSITION;
5174 
5175  if (m_col_flag_skatable)
5176  {
5178  // handle landing on the ground
5179  // Collided with a skatable face!! yay, let's stick to it!
5180 
5181  SetState(GROUND);
5182  check_movable_contact();
5183 
5184  // Used by the LandedFromVert script command.
5185  // landing from a spine transfer is considered to be the same as landing from vert
5186  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) || GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5187  {
5188  // Note: Not setting it to false if the VERT_AIR flag is not set.
5189  // This is because sometimes Scott wants to force the mLandedFromVert to be on from in script. Don't want landing to override that.
5190  // mLandedFromVert never gets reset by the C-code, only by the ResetLandedFromVert script command.
5191  mLandedFromVert = true;
5192 
5193  // This flag however cannot be cleared by script
5194  // Added this flag for use by ClearPanel_Landed, because mLandedFromVert is false at that point even if landing from vert,
5195  // due to being cleared by script.
5196  m_true_landed_from_vert = true;
5197  }
5198  else
5199  {
5200  m_true_landed_from_vert = false;
5201  }
5202 
5203  mLandedFromSpine = GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS);
5204 
5205  set_terrain(m_feeler.GetTerrain());
5206 
5207  mp_sound_component->PlayLandSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), mp_state_component->m_terrain);
5208 
5209  if (!mp_trick_component->GraffitiTrickStarted())
5210  {
5211  // clear the graffiti trick buffer if we're moving to a new world sector, but haven't started our trick yet...
5212  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted(false);
5213  }
5214 
5215  set_last_ground_feeler(m_feeler);
5216  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_LAND_ON, m_last_ground_feeler);
5217 
5218  // Now, we landed, and triggered an event, which might have reset us, so we should possibly abort here if we were restarted
5219  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset())
5220  {
5221  // K: I added this here to be consistent with the above change on 7 Mar (see above comment)
5222  // Need it though?
5223  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x532b16ef, "Landed"));
5224  return;
5225  }
5226 
5227 
5228  if (!m_true_landed_from_vert // not if coming down off vert
5229  && !mLandedFromVert // and not pretending to (like jumping out of a lip trick)
5230  && GetVel()[X] == 0.0f
5231  && GetVel()[Z] == 0.0f
5232  && control_pad.m_down.GetPressed())
5233  {
5234  // we had just jumped straight up, and are braking, and not on vert
5235  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
5236  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5237  }
5238  else
5239  {
5240  if (!GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5241  {
5242  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal()); // kill vel that is perpendicular to normal
5243  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5244  }
5245  else
5246  {
5247  // special landing from transfers to prevent speed loss
5248 
5249  Mth::Vector landing_vel = GetVel();
5250 
5251  // rotate all velocity to the facing direction
5252  GetVel().RotateToNormal(m_transfer_goal_facing);
5253  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5254 
5255  // now, rotate into the plane instead of projecting (actually, m_transfer_goal_facing should already be in the plane)
5256  GetVel().RotateToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal());
5257  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5258 
5259  // test what velocity we will have once the ground physics removes sideways velocity
5260  Mth::Vector test_vel = GetVel();
5261  remove_sideways_velocity(test_vel);
5262 
5263  // if we'd be moving upwards (this can occur because sometimes an acid drop's goal facing is along a vert, not down it; and thus,
5264  // a slight upwards rotation means that the skater will land pointing up and immediately hop off the vert; this looks very
5265  // bizzare, so we prevent it here)
5266  if (test_vel[Y] > 0.0f)
5267  {
5268  // use a standard landing instead
5269  GetVel() = landing_vel;
5270  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal());
5271  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5272  }
5273 
5274  if (GetVel().LengthSqr() < Mth::Sqr(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x59484878, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Min_Land_Speed"))))
5275  {
5276  GetVel().Normalize(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0x59484878, "Physics_Acid_Drop_Min_Land_Speed")));
5277  }
5278  }
5279  GetVel().ZeroIfShorterThan(10.0f);
5280  }
5281 
5282  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
5283 
5284  m_display_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
5285  m_current_normal = m_display_normal;
5286  m_last_display_normal = m_display_normal;
5287 
5288  GetMatrix()[Y] = m_display_normal;
5289  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Y);
5290  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5291 
5292  // Flagging the exceptions needs to be the last thing done, as the script for the
5293  // excpetion is executed immediately, and might need some of the above values
5294  // Like, PitchGreaterThan requires m_last_display_matrix to be correct (as calculated above)
5295 
5296  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x532b16ef, "Landed"));
5297 
5298  return;
5299 
5300  //
5301  // end of handling landing
5303  }
5304  else
5305  {
5306  // it's a wall, bounce off it
5307  GetVel().RotateToPlane(normal);
5308  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5309  GetMatrix()[Z].RotateToPlane(normal);
5310  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Z);
5311  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5312 
5313  // Bit of a patach here to move the skater away from the wall
5314  GetPos() += normal * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x23410c14, "Skater_Min_Distance_To_Wall"));
5315  DUMP_POSITION;
5316 
5317  // no acid drops after an in-air collision
5318  SetFlagTrue(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
5319 
5320  }
5321  }
5322  }
5323  else
5324  {
5325  // No forward collision was found, so nothing to do
5326 
5327  // so do another check to push me away from walls, will also need a wallride check here
5328  #ifdef STICKY_WALLRIDES
5329  if (!GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
5330  {
5331  // check if we are too close to a wall, and pop us out and away
5332  check_side_collisions();
5333  }
5334  #endif
5335  }
5336 
5337  // Push skater down from any roof he might now be under
5338  if (handle_upward_collision_in_air())
5339  {
5340  // no acid drops after an in-air collision
5341  SetFlagTrue(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
5342  }
5343 
5344  //
5345  // End of handling collisions
5347 
5348  // If we've triggered a jump, then do the jump (note, same as jump from ground for now, might want to make it different)
5349  maybe_flag_ollie_exception();
5350 
5351  // if in standard vanilla air, check for acid drop
5352  if (!GetFlag(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED) && BREAK_SPINE_BUTTONS)
5353  {
5354  bool count_as_skate_off_edge = m_went_airborne_time > m_last_jump_time_stamp
5355  && Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_went_airborne_time) < 250;
5356 
5357  SAcidDropData acid_drop_data;
5358  if (maybe_acid_drop(count_as_skate_off_edge, GetPos(), GetOldPos(), GetVel(), acid_drop_data))
5359  {
5360  enter_acid_drop(acid_drop_data);
5361  }
5362  }
5363 }
5364 
5365 /******************************************************************/
5366 /* */
5367 /* */
5368 /******************************************************************/
5369 
5370 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_air_rotation ( )
5371 {
5372  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
5373 
5375  // Part 1 - Decide on what spin to do, based on the controls
5376 
5377  if (mNoSpin) return;
5378 
5379  // IF doing a spine transfer, then no auto turning....
5380  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5381  {
5382  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5383  }
5384 
5385  int time = 0;
5386  float rot = 0.0f;
5387  float no_time = 0.0f;
5388  float ramp_time = 0.0f;
5389 
5390  // if (!USE_BIKE_PHYSICS)
5391  // {
5392  if (m_spin_taps)
5393  {
5394  if (control_pad.m_L1.GetTriggered())
5395  {
5396  control_pad.m_L1.ClearTrigger();
5397  if (!control_pad.m_R1.GetPressed()) // ignore it if R1 is pressed
5398  {
5399  m_tap_turns += Mth::PI;
5400  }
5401  }
5402  if (control_pad.m_R1.GetTriggered())
5403  {
5404  control_pad.m_R1.ClearTrigger();
5405  if (!control_pad.m_L1.GetPressed()) // ignore it if L1 is pressed
5406  {
5407  m_tap_turns -= Mth::PI;
5408  }
5409  }
5410 
5411  if (m_tap_turns != 0.0f)
5412  {
5413  time = 1;
5414  float turn_amount = Mth::Sgn(m_tap_turns) * GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xf7a2acc1, "Physics_air_tap_turn_speed_stat"));
5415  if (Mth::Abs(turn_amount * m_frame_length) > Mth::Abs(m_tap_turns))
5416  {
5417  m_tap_turns = 0.0f;
5418  }
5419  else
5420  {
5421  m_tap_turns -= turn_amount * m_frame_length;
5422  }
5423  rot = turn_amount;
5424  }
5425  }
5426  else
5427  {
5428  if (control_pad.m_L1.GetPressed() && !control_pad.m_R1.GetPressed())
5429  {
5430  rot = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4957db43, "Physics_air_rotation_stat"));
5431  time = 1;
5432  if (control_pad.m_L1.GetPressedTime() > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xabdd3395, "skater_autoturn_cancel_time")))
5433  {
5434  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5435  }
5436  }
5437 
5438  if (control_pad.m_R1.GetPressed() && !control_pad.m_L1.GetPressed())
5439  {
5440  rot = -GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4957db43, "Physics_air_rotation_stat"));
5441  time = 1;
5442  if (control_pad.m_R1.GetPressedTime() > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xabdd3395, "skater_autoturn_cancel_time")))
5443  {
5444  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5445  }
5446  }
5447  }
5448  // }
5449 
5450  // if just transitioned from walking, ignore Left/Right for rotation purposes
5451  if (!GetFlag(NO_ORIENTATION_CONTROL))
5452  {
5453  // if time is set, then we just ignore the Left/Right button and take no account of the spinning ramp
5454  if (!time)
5455  {
5456  if (control_pad.m_left.GetPressed())
5457  {
5458  rot = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4957db43, "Physics_air_rotation_stat"));
5459  time = control_pad.m_left.GetPressedTime();
5460  if (time > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xabdd3395, "skater_autoturn_cancel_time")))
5461  {
5462  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5463  }
5464  }
5465 
5466  if (control_pad.m_right.GetPressed())
5467  {
5468  rot = -GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4957db43, "Physics_air_rotation_stat"));
5469  time = control_pad.m_right.GetPressedTime();
5470  if (time > GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xabdd3395, "skater_autoturn_cancel_time")))
5471  {
5472  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5473  }
5474  }
5475 
5476  no_time = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xa092b2be, "Physics_Air_No_Rotate_Time"));
5477  ramp_time = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x5d756349, "Physics_Air_Ramp_Rotate_Time"));
5478 
5479  // if just tapped, then no leaning for a while
5480  if (time <= no_time)
5481  {
5482  rot = 0;
5483  }
5484 
5485  // if tapped enough, then ramp up to full speed over a small amount of time
5486  if (time < ramp_time)
5487  {
5488  rot = rot * (time - no_time) / (ramp_time - no_time);
5489  }
5490  }
5491  }
5492 
5493  // if we are not rotating by hand, then might want to auto-turn
5494  if (!rot && GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && GetFlag(AUTOTURN))
5495  {
5496  float angle_from_vert = acosf(Mth::Clamp(GetMatrix()[Z][Y], -1.0f, 1.0f));
5497 
5498  if (angle_from_vert < Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x61224f2e, "skater_autoturn_vert_angle"))))
5499  {
5500  // If pointing more or less straight up, then don't auto-turn
5501  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5502  }
5503  else
5504  {
5505  float angle = Mth::GetAngleAbout(GetMatrix()[Z], m_fall_line, GetMatrix()[Y]);
5506 
5507  rot = Mth::Sgn(angle) * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x9db33213, "Skater_autoturn_speed"));
5508  if (Mth::Abs(rot * m_frame_length) > Mth::Abs(angle))
5509  {
5510  // just about done, so just turn the last bit of angle left
5511  rot = angle / m_frame_length;
5512  SetFlagFalse(AUTOTURN);
5513  }
5514  #if 0 // Dan: removed as this code has no effect
5515  time = 1; // frig, we really don't want to start auto turn immediately
5516  ramp_time = 0;
5517  #endif
5518  }
5519  }
5520 
5521  // End of Part 1
5523 
5524  if (rot == 0.0f) return;
5525 
5527  // Part 2 - Do the actual rotation
5528 
5529  mYAngleIncreased = rot > 0.0f;
5530 
5531  rot *= m_frame_length;
5532  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(rot);
5533  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(rot);
5534 
5535  // End of Part 2
5537 
5538 
5540  // Part 3 - tracking rotation for the purposes of score (Spin multipliers)
5541  // Keep track of the total angle spun through.
5542 
5543  mp_trick_component->mTallyAngles += Mth::RadToDeg(rot);
5544 
5545  // Set the spin.
5546  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && !GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5547  {
5548  // If in vert air, only count the spin if it is at least 360, because getting 180 is too easy.
5549  if (Mth::Abs(mp_trick_component->mTallyAngles) >= 360.0f - GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x50c5cc2f, "spin_count_slop")) + 0.1f)
5550  {
5551  mp_score_component->GetScore()->UpdateSpin(mp_trick_component->mTallyAngles);
5552  }
5553  }
5554  else
5555  {
5556  mp_score_component->GetScore()->UpdateSpin(mp_trick_component->mTallyAngles);
5557  }
5558 
5559  // End of Part 3
5561 }
5562 
5563 /******************************************************************/
5564 /* */
5565 /* */
5566 /******************************************************************/
5567 
5568 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_air_lean ( )
5569 {
5570  // Handle leaning formward and backwards in the air
5571 
5573  // Spine specific lean, should be seperated out for spine physics
5574  // we automatically rotate forward but don't let skaters's up vector to go past horizontal
5575 
5576  // no leaning during transfers; we slerp instead
5577  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS) || GetFlag(NO_ORIENTATION_CONTROL)) return;
5578 
5579  #if 0 // old transfer code
5580  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5581  {
5582  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] > -0.05f) // if y component of up vector (the Y vector) is +ve, then we are heads up
5583  {
5584  float rot = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x110a1742, "Physics_spine_lean_stat"));
5585 
5586  GetMatrix().Rotate(m_spine_rotate_axis, -rot*m_frame_length);
5587  }
5588  return;
5589  }
5590  #endif
5591 
5592  //
5594 
5596  // 1 - Control Logic
5597  //
5598 
5599  // don't even try to lean if in VERT_AIR
5600  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR)) return;
5601 
5602  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
5603 
5604  // Don't want to lean if "grab" or "kick" pressed, as we could be doing some kind of grab trick
5605  if (control_pad.m_circle.GetPressed() || control_pad.m_square.GetPressed()) return;
5606 
5607  float rot = 0.0f;
5608  int time = 0;
5609 
5610  if (control_pad.m_up.GetPressed())
5611  {
5612  rot = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcbfdd841, "Physics_air_lean_stat"));
5613  time = control_pad.m_up.GetPressedTime();
5614  }
5615 
5616  if (control_pad.m_down.GetPressed())
5617  {
5618  rot = -GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcbfdd841, "Physics_air_lean_stat"));
5619  time = control_pad.m_down.GetPressedTime();
5620  }
5621 
5622  float no_time = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x5f70ef46, "Physics_Air_No_Lean_Time"));
5623  float ramp_time = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x12cd2d14, "Physics_Air_Ramp_Lean_Time"));
5624 
5625  // if just tapped, then no rotation for a while
5626  if (time <= no_time) return;
5627 
5628  // if tapped enough, then ramp up to full speed over a small amount of time
5629  if (time < ramp_time)
5630  {
5631  rot = rot * (time - no_time) / (ramp_time - no_time);
5632  }
5633 
5634  // end of control logic
5636 
5637 
5639  // air lean physics
5640 
5641  if (rot == 0.0f) return;
5642 
5643  GetMatrix().RotateXLocal(rot*m_frame_length);
5644  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateXLocal(rot*m_frame_length);
5645 
5646  // end of air lean physics
5648 }
5649 
5650 /******************************************************************/
5651 /* */
5652 /* */
5653 /******************************************************************/
5654 
5655 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_transfer_slerping ( )
5656 {
5657  // during transfers, we slerp to our required orientation
5658  if (!GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS)) return;
5659 
5660  // we can't simply use the slerp's result vector at the skater's vector, because we need to allow the skater to rotate; instead, we apply
5661  // the change in the result vector each frame
5662 
5663  // increment the timer
5664  m_transfer_slerp_timer += m_frame_length;
5665 
5666  // calculate this frame's slerp result
5667  Mth::Matrix transfer_slerp_current_matrix;
5668  m_transfer_slerper.getMatrix(
5669  &transfer_slerp_current_matrix,
5670  Mth::SmoothStep(Mth::ClampMax(m_transfer_slerp_timer / m_transfer_slerp_duration, 1.0f))
5671  );
5672 
5673  // invert the slerp result vector from last frame
5674  Mth::Matrix inverse_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix = m_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix;
5675  inverse_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix.InvertUniform();
5676 
5677  // calculate the change between the frames
5678  Mth::Matrix transfer_slerp_delta_matrix = inverse_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix * transfer_slerp_current_matrix;
5679 
5680  // apply the change to the skater's matrix
5681  GetMatrix() *= transfer_slerp_delta_matrix;
5682  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5683 
5684  // store this frame's matrix
5685  m_transfer_slerp_previous_matrix = transfer_slerp_current_matrix;
5686 }
5687 
5688 /******************************************************************/
5689 /* */
5690 /* */
5691 /******************************************************************/
5692 
5693 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_air_vert_recovery ( )
5694 {
5695  // recovering from going off the end of a vert polygon
5696 
5697  // don't want to recover during a transfer
5698  if (GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS)) return;
5699 
5700  if (GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f && mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()) return;
5701 
5702  // right, we are in vert, but no longer tracking, so perhaps we are over flat ground?
5703  CFeeler feeler;
5704  feeler.m_start = GetPos();
5705  feeler.m_end = GetPos();
5706  feeler.m_end[Y] -= 500.0f;
5707 
5708  // can't find ground
5709  if (!feeler.GetCollision()) return;
5710 
5711  // still over vert poly
5712  if (feeler.GetFlags() & mFD_VERT) return;
5713 
5714  // still over steep ground
5715  if (feeler.GetNormal()[Y] < 0.2f) return;
5716 
5717  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
5718  {
5719  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
5720  }
5721 
5722  SetFlagTrue(IN_RECOVERY);
5723 
5724  // we want to smoothly rotate the skater in the plane formed by the up vector, and the skater's up vector
5725 
5726  // got sufficently far up
5727  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] > 0.9f) return;
5728 
5729  float rot = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xe7116a96,"Physics_recover_rate_stat"));
5730 
5731  // need to rotate the Y vector in the plane formed by the XZ velocity and the (0,1,0) up vector
5732  // (or rather, rotate it about the vector prependicular to this
5733 
5734  // get a vector perpendicular to the plane containing m_matrix[Z] and the world up
5735  Mth::Vector forward = GetMatrix()[Y];
5736  forward[Y] = 0.0f;
5737  forward.Normalize();
5738  #if 0 // old code
5739  // Mth::Vector world_up(0.0f,1.0f,0.0f);
5740  // Mth::Vector side = Mth::CrossProduct(forward,world_up);
5741  #else
5742  Mth::Vector side(-forward[Z], 0.0f, forward[X], 0.0f);
5743  #endif
5744 
5745  GetMatrix().Rotate(side, rot * m_frame_length);
5746 
5747  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5748 }
5749 
5750 /******************************************************************/
5751 /* */
5752 /* */
5753 /******************************************************************/
5754 
5755 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::rotate_upright ( )
5756 {
5757  // Attempt to upright player (sideways) while going through air
5758  //
5759  // Cannot just check angle between mUp and world_up as that would include
5760  // tilting forward/backward when character is already uprighted sideways
5761  // (and tilting forward/backward should solely be under player control).
5762  // Thus, should rotate about mFront only.
5763  //
5764  // Then, basically what we want to do is:
5765  // 1) Rotate about mFront so that mUp is in the plane of world_up and mUp.
5766  // 2) Pick one of CW/CCW to rotate by, such that angle between mUp and
5767  // world_up is <= 90 degrees.
5768  //
5769  // As we can be off by at most 180 degrees, rotating by 5 degrees would
5770  // upright us in 180/5=36 frames. For 45 degrees off (more likely), we
5771  // would be uprighted in 45/5=9 frames.
5772  //
5773  // Your average jump is probably around 30 frames long, so try 1 degree?
5774 
5775  // If the skater's Z vector is nearly straight up or down, then
5776  // uprighting sideways will not look good
5777  // (On XBox, some innacuracy in Z causes the skater to rotate oddly during "drop-in" situations)
5778  // so, here we test for this case, and just return if so
5779  if (Mth::Abs(GetMatrix()[Z][Y]) > 0.95f) return;
5780 
5781  // get a vector perpendicular to the plane containing m_matrix[Z] and the world up
5782  #if 0 // old code
5783  // Mth::Vector v;
5784  // Mth::Vector world_up;
5785  // world_up.Set(0.0f,1.0f,0.0f);
5786  // v = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Z],world_up);
5787  #else
5788  Mth::Vector v(-GetMatrix()[Z][Z], 0.0f, GetMatrix()[Z][X], 0.0f);
5789  #endif
5790 
5791  // Then get the dot product of the up vector with this
5792  // if up vector is in the same plane, then this will be zero
5793  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], v);
5794  if (dot > 0.02f * m_frame_length * 60.0f) // prevent wobbling
5795  {
5796  float rot = Mth::DegToRad(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xabd57877, "skater_upright_sideways_speed")));
5797  GetMatrix().RotateZLocal(rot * m_frame_length);
5798  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5799  }
5800  else if (dot < -0.02f * m_frame_length * 60.0f)
5801  {
5802  float rot = Mth::DegToRad(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xabd57877, "skater_upright_sideways_speed")));
5803  GetMatrix().RotateZLocal(-rot * m_frame_length);
5804  ResetLerpingMatrix();
5805  }
5806 }
5807 
5808 /******************************************************************/
5809 /* */
5810 /* */
5811 /******************************************************************/
5812 
5813 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_forward_collision_in_air ( const Mth::Vector &start_pos )
5814 {
5815  // return true if there was a collision, but we snapped up over it
5816 
5817  Mth::Vector forward = GetPos() - start_pos;
5818  forward.Normalize();
5819 
5820  Mth::Vector up_offset = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd4205c9b, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Height"));
5821 
5822  m_col_start = start_pos + up_offset;
5823  m_col_end = GetPos() + up_offset + forward * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x20102726, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Length"));
5824 
5825  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
5826  {
5827  // we have hit something going forward
5828  // either it is a wall, and we need to bounce off it
5829  // or it is a floor, and we need to stick to it.
5830 
5831  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
5832 
5833  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(normal, m_current_normal);
5834  if (!m_col_flag_skatable || (dot < 0.8f && normal[Y] < 0.5f))
5835  {
5836 
5837  // at this point we have hit something that is not skatable and is fairly vertical
5838  // so we are considering if we want to bounce off it
5839  // one possibility is that it is a low ledge
5840  //
5841  // so, we check for snapping up, and if we do snap up, and hit_vertical is true, then we don't bounce off the wall
5842 
5843  /*
5844  // View from side
5845  /
5846  / <---------- Movement of skater
5847  /
5848  /
5849  ---------------+ /
5850  | /
5851  | /
5852  |/
5853  / <------------- point of collision
5854  /|
5855  / |
5856  / |
5857  / |
5858  / +--------------- <-------------- The ground
5859  /
5860  /
5861  /
5862  /
5863  / <------------ where we end up
5864  */
5865 
5866  // Need to store m_feeler, as it is corrupted by CheckForAirSnapUp
5867  CFeeler tmp_feeler = m_feeler;
5868 
5869  bool hit_vertical = m_feeler.GetNormal()[Y] < 0.1f;
5870 
5871  // Since this collision had the forward vector added into it, we need to temporarily add in the forward vector again
5872  // so we can check for snapping up; note this will result in the skater snapping forward by the length of the forward vector (currently 10")
5873  // whenever we snap up in this particular check
5874  Mth::Vector tmp = GetPos();
5875  GetPos() = m_col_end - up_offset;
5876  if (check_for_air_snap_up(start_pos))
5877  {
5878  // we snapped up, so if we are either moving upward or the first collision was near vertical, then we return true, allowing us to continue
5879  // if we were moving upwards, then we would continue into the air
5880  // if we were moving down, but the collision was near vert, then we do not want to bonk off the surface, and instead we let
5881  // the landing happen in the next frame
5882  if (GetVel()[Y] > 10.0f || hit_vertical) return true;
5883  }
5884 
5885  GetPos() = tmp;
5886  DUMP_POSITION;
5887  m_feeler = tmp_feeler;
5888 
5889  #ifdef SNAP_OVER_THIN_WALLS
5890  // we have hit a wall, and we can't snap up over i; see if we can just move up and go over it....
5891 
5892  // only do this if we are roughly vertical and going up and the wall is very verticle
5893  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] > 0.5f // skater is upright
5894  && GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f // skater travelling upwards
5895  && normal[Y] < 0.01f) // thing we hit is not far off vert
5896  {
5897 
5898  float snap_Y = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x786b3272, "Physics_Air_Snap_Up"));
5899  tmp_feeler.m_start[Y] += snap_Y;
5900  tmp_feeler.m_end[Y] += snap_Y;
5901 
5902  if (!tmp_feeler.GetCollision())
5903  {
5904  while (snap_Y > 4.0f)
5905  {
5906  // move down until we get a collision
5907  // so as to minimize the amount we snap up
5908  tmp_feeler.m_start[Y] -= 2.0f;
5909  tmp_feeler.m_end[Y] -= 2.0f;
5910  if (tmp_feeler.GetCollision()) break;
5911  snap_Y -= 2.0f;
5912  }
5913  GetPos()[Y] += snap_Y;
5914  DUMP_POSITION;
5915  return true;
5916  }
5917  }
5918  #endif
5919 
5920  // If we are on a vert poly, then just slide off the wall
5921  // just kill velocity perpendicular to the wall
5922  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR))
5923  {
5924  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() - up_offset;
5925  GetPos() += normal * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x23410c14, "Skater_Min_Distance_To_Wall"));
5926  DUMP_POSITION;
5927 
5928  if (!GetFlag(SPINE_PHYSICS))
5929  {
5930  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(normal);
5931  }
5932  else
5933  {
5934  GetVel().RotateToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal());
5935  }
5936  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5937  return false;
5938  }
5939 
5940  // maybe wall plant
5941  if (check_for_wallplant()) return false;
5942 
5943  // maybe wall ride
5944  if (check_for_wallride()) return false;
5945 
5946  // no acid drops after a in-air collision
5947  SetFlagTrue(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
5948 
5949  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_BONK, m_feeler);
5950  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return false;
5951 
5952  // only play bonk sound for things that are near vert
5953  if (m_feeler.GetNormal().GetY() < 0.05f)
5954  {
5955  mp_sound_component->PlayBonkSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), m_feeler.GetTerrain());
5956  }
5957 
5958  // it's a wall, bounce off it
5959 
5960  float vel_y = 0.0f;
5961 
5962  // ignore y vel if the polygon is not too much upside down
5963  if (normal[Y] > -0.1f)
5964  {
5965  vel_y = GetVel()[Y]; // remember old Y vel
5966  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f; // kill Y vel
5967  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5968  }
5969 
5970  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(normal); // project X and Z to plane of collision poly
5971  GetVel() += normal * (GetVel().Length() * (1.0f / 10.0f)); // 10% tiny push away.....
5972  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5973 
5974  if (normal[Y] > -0.1f)
5975  {
5976  GetVel()[Y] = vel_y; // restore old Y vel, so it's impossible to jump higher by jumping against a wall
5977  DUMP_VELOCITY;
5978  }
5979 
5980  float Z_Y = GetMatrix()[Z][Y];
5981  GetMatrix()[Z][Y] = 0.0f;
5982  GetMatrix()[Z].RotateToPlane(normal);
5983  GetMatrix()[Z][Y] = Z_Y;
5984  GetMatrix()[Z] += (1.0f / 20.0f) * normal;
5985  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
5986  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
5987  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
5988  GetMatrix()[Y] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], GetMatrix()[X]);
5989  GetMatrix()[Y].Normalize();
5990 
5991  // Bit of a patach here to move the skater away from the wall
5992  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() - up_offset;
5993  GetPos() += normal * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x23410c14, "Skater_Min_Distance_To_Wall"));
5994  DUMP_POSITION;
5995 
5996  // if the thing we have collided with is a movable object, then add in the last movement to move us away
5997  if (m_feeler.IsMovableCollision())
5998  {
5999  Mth::Vector obj_vel = m_feeler.GetMovingObject()->GetVel();
6000 
6001  // if object is moving in same direction as face normal
6002  if (Mth::DotProduct(obj_vel, m_feeler.GetNormal()) > 0.0f)
6003  {
6004  // then add in the velocity, just to be on the safe side
6005  GetPos() += obj_vel * m_frame_length * 2.0f; // 2.0f is a safety factor
6006  DUMP_POSITION;
6007  // and move with the thing we just hit
6008  GetVel() += obj_vel;
6009  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6010  }
6011  }
6012  }
6013  }
6014  return false;
6015 }
6016 
6017 /******************************************************************/
6018 /* */
6019 /* */
6020 /******************************************************************/
6021 
6022 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::check_for_air_snap_up ( const Mth::Vector& start_pos )
6023 {
6025  // We moved from GetOldPos() to m_pos
6026  // and some collision was detected
6027  // either along this line, or along the "forward" line, which is 8 inches above
6028  // regardless, we want to see if the new m_pos (considered bad)
6029  // can be snapped upwards to a surface, where the normal is in the same direction as
6030  // the current movement
6031  // and check to see if there is a clear line to this position
6032  // currently in physics.q: Physics_Air_Snap_Up = 15
6033  //
6034  // Note, we ignore if the skater is going up or down, the calling code has to
6035  // handle that (for the spcial case of hitting a wall coming down, when we can snap over it)
6036 
6037  // don't do it if bailing, to avoid snapping through loops
6038  if (GetFlag(IS_BAILING)) return false;
6039 
6040  CFeeler feeler;
6041 
6042  float up_len = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x786b3272,"Physics_Air_Snap_Up"));
6043 
6044  feeler.m_start = GetPos();
6045  feeler.m_start[Y] += up_len;
6046  feeler.m_end = GetPos();
6047 
6048  // Since the new pos might actually be ABOVE the ledge (i.e., we might have just clipped though the corner, and not be inside it)
6049  // then we need to check all the way down to the previous height, but only if moving upwards
6050  if (start_pos[Y] < GetPos()[Y])
6051  {
6052  feeler.m_end[Y] = start_pos[Y];
6053  }
6054 
6055  // if the start pos, plus the snap up distance was above the top of the collision line, then extend the collision line up to that
6056  if (start_pos[Y] + up_len > feeler.m_start[Y])
6057  {
6058  feeler.m_start[Y] = start_pos[Y] + up_len;
6059  }
6060 
6061  // set up the feeler, now check for collision
6062  if (feeler.GetCollision())
6063  {
6064  // Collision, possibly something we can snap up to
6065 
6066  // movement vector is in same direction as face normal, so we are moving away from it
6067  // usually this implies we are moving up, away from the horizontal face at the top of a wall, or a curb
6068  if (feeler.GetNormal().GetY() > 0.5f) // not if too vertical
6069  {
6070  // Okay, we can snap up, so all we have to do is see if the line is clear
6071  Mth::Vector snap_point = feeler.GetPoint() + feeler.GetNormal();
6072 
6073  feeler.m_start = start_pos;
6074  feeler.m_start[Y] += up_len;
6075  feeler.m_end = snap_point;
6076  feeler.m_end[Y] += up_len;
6077 
6078  if (!feeler.GetCollision())
6079  {
6080  // No collision along upper line,so we consider it safe to move
6081  // note, this will generally result in passing through the corner of some geometry (generally like the top of a wall, or a curb)
6082  GetPos() = snap_point; // set to snap point
6083  GetPos()[Y] += 0.1f; // offset up a little, so we are outside the plane
6084  DUMP_POSITION;
6085  return true; // return true, indicating we snapped up, so carry on in air
6086  }
6087  else
6088  {
6089  // was a collision when trying to move to new position, so don't move
6090  }
6091  }
6092  else
6093  {
6094  // too vert, so don't allow snap (probably on a QP)
6095  }
6096 
6097  return false;
6098  }
6099  else
6100  {
6101  // No collision, so don't do anything, probably deep within a wall, or off the level.
6102  }
6103 
6104  return false;
6105 }
6106 
6107 /******************************************************************/
6108 /* */
6109 /* */
6110 /******************************************************************/
6111 
6112 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_upward_collision_in_air ( )
6113 {
6114  // return true if there was a collision, but we snapped up over it
6115 
6116  // if we are upside down, then return false
6117  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] < 0.0f) return false;
6118 
6119  float head_height = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x542cf0c7, "Skater_default_head_height"));
6120 
6121  // ignore head collisions for a duration after wallplants
6122  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_last_wallplant_time_stamp) <= static_cast< Tmr::Time >(Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x2757ed2c, "Physics_Ignore_Ceilings_After_Wallplant_Duration"))))
6123  {
6124  head_height = 6.0f;
6125  }
6126 
6127  Mth::Vector up_offset = GetMatrix()[Y] * head_height;
6128 
6129  m_col_start = GetPos();
6130 
6131  m_col_end = GetPos();
6132  m_col_end += up_offset;
6133 
6134  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6135  {
6136  Mth::Vector ceiling_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
6137 
6138  // if it's not at least tilted a bit downwards, then ignore it and return false
6139  if (ceiling_normal[Y] > -0.1f) return false;
6140 
6141  // get the vector we need to push down
6142  Mth::Vector push_down = m_feeler.GetPoint() - m_col_end;
6143 
6144  // only push down away from the ceiling (otherwise we would push back along the line of travel, jerky)
6145  push_down.ProjectToNormal(ceiling_normal);
6146 
6147  // push down as far as we can go, so check for collisions
6148  m_col_start = GetPos();
6149  m_col_end = GetPos() + push_down;
6150  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6151  {
6152  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() + 0.001f * m_feeler.GetNormal();
6153  DUMP_POSITION;
6154  }
6155  else
6156  {
6157  GetPos() = m_col_end;
6158  DUMP_POSITION;
6159  }
6160 
6161  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(ceiling_normal);
6162  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6163 
6164  return true; // we have had a collision, so return true
6165  }
6166 
6167  return false; // no collision found, return false
6168 }
6169 
6170 /******************************************************************/
6171 /* */
6172 /* */
6173 /******************************************************************/
6174 
6175 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_upward_collision_in_wallride ( )
6176 {
6177  m_col_start = GetPos() + 18.0f * mWallNormal;
6178 
6179  m_col_end = m_col_start;
6180  m_col_end[Y] += GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x542cf0c7, "Skater_default_head_height"));
6181 
6182  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6183  {
6184  Mth::Vector ceiling_normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
6185 
6186  // if it's not at least tilted a bit downwards, then ignore it and return false
6187  if (ceiling_normal[Y] > -0.1f) return false;
6188 
6189  // get the vector we need to push down
6190  Mth::Vector push_down = m_feeler.GetPoint() - m_col_end;
6191 
6192  // only push down away from the ceiling (otherwise we would push back along the line of travel, jerky)
6193  push_down.ProjectToNormal(ceiling_normal);
6194 
6195  // push down as far as we can go, so check for collisions
6196  m_col_start = GetPos();
6197  m_col_end = GetPos() + push_down;
6198  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6199  {
6200  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() + m_feeler.GetNormal();
6201  DUMP_POSITION;
6202  }
6203  else
6204  {
6205  GetPos() = m_col_end;
6206  DUMP_POSITION;
6207  }
6208 
6209  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(ceiling_normal);
6210  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6211 
6212  return true; // we have had a collision, so return true
6213  }
6214 
6215  return false; // no collision found, return false
6216 }
6217 
6218 /******************************************************************/
6219 /* */
6220 /* */
6221 /******************************************************************/
6222 
6223 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_wallride_physics ( )
6224 {
6225  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
6226  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
6227  SetFlagFalse(IN_RECOVERY);
6228  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
6229 
6230  // Wallriding will cancel any memory of what rail we were on, so the next one seems fresh
6231  mp_rail_node = NULL;
6232  m_last_rail_trigger_node_name = 0;
6233 
6234 
6235 
6236  // Keep updating the time, cos it needs to be the time that the last wall ride finished.
6237  mWallrideTime = Tmr::GetTime();
6238 
6239  // set wallride movement to nothing
6240  Mth::Vector m_movement(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
6241 
6242  // if we are in contact with something, then factor in that "movement"
6243  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos()))
6244  {
6245  m_movement = mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
6246  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->IsRotated())
6247  {
6248  GetMatrix() *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
6249  m_lerping_display_matrix *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
6250  }
6251  }
6252 
6253  // Mick: changed to include gravity
6254  // note this is the way THPS2 worked
6255  // the physics might not be intuitive, but it works
6256  // also note we are intentionally not removing sideways components of velocity, so we get to drift up a bit
6257  // after we hit the wall, allowing us to to the "claw" trick (Jump-WallRide-Jump-Grind)
6258 
6259  Mth::Vector acc(0.0f, GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xc617caf, "Wall_Ride_Gravity")), 0.0f);
6260  GetPos() += GetVel() * m_frame_length + acc * (0.5f * m_frame_length * m_frame_length);
6261  GetPos() += m_movement;
6262  DUMP_POSITION;
6263  GetVel() += acc * m_frame_length;
6264  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6265 
6266  #if 0 // old code
6267  // Mth::Vector Down(0.0f,-1.0f,0.0f);
6268  // Mth::Vector Horiz=Mth::CrossProduct(mWallNormal,Down);
6269  #else
6270  Mth::Vector Horiz(mWallNormal[Z], 0.0f, -mWallNormal[X], 0.0f);
6271  #endif
6272  Horiz.Normalize();
6273 
6274  // Down is a unit vector pointing down along the plane of the wall.
6275  Mth::Vector Down = Mth::CrossProduct(Horiz, mWallNormal);
6276 
6277  float Theta = GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x64a48a64, "Wall_Ride_Turn_Speed"));
6278 
6279  // Check if Theta is bigger than the angle the skater's z is already making with the Down vector.
6280  // If Theta is bigger, don't rotate by it, otherwise the skater will turn beyond the vertical.
6281  float zdot = Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], Down);
6282  if (zdot > 0.68f || (zdot > 0.0f && zdot > cosf(Theta)))
6283  {
6284  // Pointing pretty much straight down, so don't turn.
6285  }
6286  else
6287  {
6288  // Choose which way to turn.
6289  // Need to turn one way or the other depending on whether the skater's z axis is on the left or right side of the down vector.
6290  // This is the same as whether the skater's x axis is pointing up or down, so just check the sign of the dot product of x with down.
6291  float xdot = Mth::DotProduct(GetMatrix()[X], Down);
6292  if (xdot <= 0.0f)
6293  {
6294  Theta = -Theta;
6295  }
6296 
6297  // Not strictly required for NGPS, fixes a problem on NGC. However, given m_vel is used only
6298  // as a three-element vector, not a bad idea to set this for all platforms.
6299  GetVel()[W] = 1.0f;
6300 
6301  // Rotate both the skater and the skater's velocity by Theta about the wall normal axis.
6302  GetVel().Rotate(mWallNormal, Theta);
6303  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6304 
6305  // set skater to face in the same direction as velocity
6306  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
6307 
6308  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
6309  GetMatrix()[Y] = mWallNormal;
6310  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y], GetMatrix()[Z]);
6311  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
6312  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6313  }
6314 
6315  // Forward collision check
6316  Mth::Vector forward = GetPos() - GetOldPos();
6317  forward.Normalize();
6318 
6319  m_col_start = GetOldPos();
6320 
6321  m_col_end = GetPos();
6322  m_col_end += forward * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x20102726, "Skater_First_Forward_Collision_Length"));
6323 
6324  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6325  {
6326  // we have hit something going forward
6327  // either it is a wall, and we need to bounce off it or it is a steep QP, and we need to stick to it.
6328  // (note, with the slow normal changing, then it is possible that we might even collide with the poly that we are on)
6329 
6330  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
6331 
6332  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(normal, mWallNormal);
6333 
6334  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint() + normal;
6335  DUMP_POSITION;
6336 
6337  // For fairly shallow curves, the dot between two normals will be pretty large
6338  // it's very important here to distinguish between a tight curve (like in a narrow QP) and a direct hit with a wall.
6339 
6340  if (!m_col_flag_wallable || Mth::Abs(dot) < 0.01f)
6341  {
6342  if (normal[Y] > 0.9f)
6343  {
6344  // If the new poly is the ground, pop upright and set the landed exception.
6345  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint();
6346  DUMP_POSITION;
6347 
6348  // Set every orientation type thing I can think of so as to
6349  // pop his orientation to that of the ground.
6350  GetMatrix()[Z] = GetVel();
6351  GetMatrix()[Z].ProjectToPlane(normal); // Mick: project forward vel to ground
6352  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
6353  GetMatrix()[Y] = normal;
6354  GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y],GetMatrix()[Z]);
6355  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
6356 
6357  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6358 
6359  GetSkaterMatrixQueriesComponentFromObject(GetObject())->ResetLatestMatrix();
6360 
6361  m_last_display_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
6362  m_display_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
6363  m_current_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
6364 
6365  // check for sticking to rail first; use the "override_air" to stick to rail)
6366  maybe_stick_to_rail(true);
6367  if (GetState() != RAIL)
6368  {
6369  SetState(GROUND);
6370  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x532b16ef, "Landed"));
6371  }
6372  return;
6373  }
6374  else
6375  {
6376  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6377 
6378  GetPos() += 18.0f * mWallNormal;
6379  DUMP_POSITION;
6380 
6381  SetState(AIR);
6382  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0xd96f01f1, "SkaterOffEdge"));
6383  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x3b1001b6, "GroundGone"));
6384 
6385 
6386  }
6387  }
6388  else
6389  {
6390  mWallNormal = normal; // update the normal to the new one...
6391  new_normal(mWallNormal);
6392  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6393  GetVel().RotateToPlane(mWallNormal); // make velocity go along it
6394  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6395  }
6396  }
6397 
6398  if (handle_upward_collision_in_wallride())
6399  {
6400  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6401 
6402  GetPos() += 18.0f * mWallNormal;
6403  DUMP_POSITION;
6404 
6405  SetState(AIR);
6406  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0xd96f01f1, "SkaterOffEdge"));
6407  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x3b1001b6, "GroundGone"));
6408  }
6409 
6410  // Downwards collision check (down in direction of skater's y)
6411 
6412  m_col_start = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe4d79235, "Physics_Ground_Snap_Up"));
6413  m_col_start += GetPos();
6414 
6415  m_col_end = GetMatrix()[Y] * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x438ba168, "Wall_Ride_Down_Collision_Check_Length"));
6416  m_col_end += GetPos();
6417 
6418  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6419  {
6420  mWallNormal=m_feeler.GetNormal();
6421 
6422  // Snap position to wall.
6423  GetPos() = m_feeler.GetPoint();
6424  // but one inch out from it
6425  GetPos() += mWallNormal;
6426  DUMP_POSITION;
6427 
6428  // Rotate velocity to plane.
6429  GetVel().RotateToPlane(mWallNormal);
6430  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6431 
6432  // Snap skater's orientation to the plane.
6433  new_normal(mWallNormal);
6434  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6435 
6436  if (!m_col_flag_wallable)
6437  {
6438  GetVel() += mWallNormal * 100.0f; // boost away from the wall
6439  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6440 
6441  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6442  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6443  SetState(AIR);
6444 
6445  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0xd96f01f1, "SkaterOffEdge"));
6446  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x3b1001b6, "GroundGone"));
6447  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF_EDGE, m_last_ground_feeler);
6448 
6449  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
6450  }
6451  else
6452  {
6453  // handle wallride transition from one object to the next
6454  if (m_feeler.GetSector() != m_last_ground_feeler.GetSector())
6455  {
6456  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF_EDGE, m_last_ground_feeler);
6457  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
6458  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO, m_last_ground_feeler);
6459  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
6460  }
6461  if (!mp_trick_component->GraffitiTrickStarted())
6462  {
6463  // clear the graffiti trick buffer if we're moving to a new world sector, but haven't started our trick yet...
6464  mp_trick_component->SetGraffitiTrickStarted(false);
6465  }
6466 
6467  set_last_ground_feeler(m_feeler);
6468  }
6469  }
6470  else
6471  {
6472  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6473  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6474  GetPos() += 18.0f * mWallNormal;
6475  DUMP_POSITION;
6476  SetState(AIR);
6477  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0xd96f01f1, "SkaterOffEdge"));
6478  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0x3b1001b6, "GroundGone"));
6479  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF_EDGE, m_last_ground_feeler);
6480  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
6481  }
6482 
6483  // look for head collisions
6484 
6485 
6486  // This was cut-and-past'd from DoOnGroundPhysics
6487  handle_tensing();
6488 
6489  if (maybe_flag_ollie_exception())
6490  {
6491  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_JUMP_OFF, m_last_ground_feeler);
6492  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
6493 
6494  GetVel() += GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x349d02d4, "Wall_Ride_Jump_Out_Speed")) * mWallNormal;
6495  GetVel()[Y] += GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x5a9de35a, "Wall_Ride_Jump_Up_Speed"));
6496  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6497 
6498  // Pop the skater upright again immediately.
6499  GetMatrix()[Y].Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0);
6500  GetMatrix().OrthoNormalizeAbout(Y);
6501  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6502 
6503  // and immediately adjust the normal, to prevent single frame snaps when walliing and the 90 degree swoop when wallride to grind
6504  m_normal_lerp = 0.0f;
6505  m_display_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
6506  m_current_normal = m_display_normal;
6507  m_last_display_normal = m_display_normal;
6508  }
6509 
6510  // if we've already started doing a trick, then start remembering our trick chain
6511  // GJ: It's possible to do a wallride while mNumTricksInCombo == 0, for some reason
6512  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_last_ground_feeler.GetNodeChecksum());
6513 
6514  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
6515  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3ae85eef, "skater_trails")))
6516  {
6517  Gfx::AddDebugLine(GetPos() + m_current_normal, GetOldPos() + m_current_normal, PURPLE, 0, 0);
6518  }
6519  #endif
6520 }
6521 
6522 /******************************************************************/
6523 /* */
6524 /* */
6525 /******************************************************************/
6526 
6527 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_wallplant_physics ( )
6528 {
6529  // check if the wallplant duration is up
6530  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_state_change_timestamp) > Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xa06e446b, "Physics_Wallplant_Duration")))
6531  {
6532  SetState(AIR);
6533  return;
6534  }
6535 
6536  // Wallplanting will cancel any memory of what rail we were on, so the next one seems fresh
6537  mp_rail_node = NULL;
6538  m_last_rail_trigger_node_name = 0;
6539 
6540 
6541  // during a wallplant, our velocity is set to the exit velocity, but we simply ignore it
6542 
6543  // the only movement comes from our moving contact; we assume that this movement does not lead to collisions
6544  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos()))
6545  {
6546  GetPos() += mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
6547  DUMP_POSITION;
6548  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->IsRotated())
6549  {
6550  GetMatrix() *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
6551  m_lerping_display_matrix *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
6552  }
6553  }
6554 }
6555 
6556 /******************************************************************/
6557 /* */
6558 /* */
6559 /******************************************************************/
6560 
6561 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_stick_to_rail ( bool override_air )
6562 {
6563  // Only alow them to grind if we are in the air, that way we will avoid nasty problem with snapping through geometry onto rails
6564  if (GetState() != AIR && !override_air) return;
6565 
6566  // K: Don't allow a grind trick if bailing, otherwise you can late-trick into a liptrick, bail, get snapped into a grind, & hence bail again.
6567  if (GetFlag(IS_BAILING)) return;
6568 
6569  // K: No grinds or lip tricks are allowed if this flag is set. This is switched on and off by the NoGrind and AllowGrind script commands.
6570  // These are used when jumping out of a lip trick to disallow going straight into a grind.
6571  if (mNoRailTricks) return;
6572 
6573  if (!mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_triangle.GetPressed())
6574  {
6575  // Mick: not sure why this was removed
6576  // SetFlagTrue(CAN_RERAIL);
6577  return;
6578  }
6579 
6580  // don't grind for a short duration after a wallplant
6581  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_last_wallplant_time_stamp) < static_cast< Tmr::Time >(Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x96dca7dc,"Physics_Wallplant_Disallow_Grind_Duration")))) return;
6582 
6583  Mth::Vector a = GetOldPos();
6584  Mth::Vector b = GetPos();
6585 
6586  // if we were on a rail recently, and in the park editor, then don't let us snap to rails that are very perpendicular to us for a while
6587  float min_dot;
6588  if (Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark() && Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_rail_time) < m_rerail_time)
6589  {
6590  // Should only do this if we've recently been on a rail
6591  min_dot = cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x76c1da15, "Rail_Corner_Leave_Angle"))));
6592  }
6593  else
6594  {
6595  min_dot = 1.0f;
6596  }
6597 
6598  // eventually we should get the rail manager base on whatever rail we are on
6599  CRailManager* p_rail_man = Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetRailManager();
6600 
6601  // first check the world rail manager (rails that do not move)
6602  CRailNode* pNode;
6603  Mth::Vector rail_pos;
6604  if (p_rail_man->StickToRail(a, b, &rail_pos, &pNode, NULL, min_dot))
6605  {
6606  TrackingLine(2,GetOldPos(), GetPos()); // 2 = stick to rail
6607 
6608  mp_movable_contact_component->LoseAnyContact();
6609  if (will_take_rail(pNode, p_rail_man))
6610  {
6611  got_rail(rail_pos, pNode, p_rail_man);
6612  }
6613  return;
6614  }
6615 
6616  // iterate through all rail manager components, starting with the first one
6617  for (CRailManagerComponent* p_railmanager_component = static_cast< CRailManagerComponent* >(CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType(CRC_RAILMANAGER));
6618  p_railmanager_component;
6619  p_railmanager_component = static_cast< CRailManagerComponent* >(p_railmanager_component->GetNextSameType()))
6620  {
6621  CRailManager* p_rail_man = p_railmanager_component->GetRailManager();
6622 
6623  Mth::Matrix total_mat = p_railmanager_component->UpdateRailManager();
6624  Mth::Matrix inv = total_mat;
6625  inv.Invert();
6626 
6627  a[W] = 1.0f;
6628  b[W] = 1.0f;
6629 
6630  // Transform a,b into the space of the object
6631  Mth::Vector local_a = inv.Transform(a);
6632  Mth::Vector local_b = inv.Transform(b);
6633 
6634  if (p_rail_man->StickToRail(local_a, local_b, &rail_pos, &pNode, NULL, min_dot))
6635  {
6636  // transform from object space to world space
6637  rail_pos[W] = 1.0f;
6638  rail_pos = total_mat.Transform(rail_pos);
6639  if (will_take_rail(pNode, p_rail_man))
6640  {
6641  got_rail(rail_pos, pNode, p_rail_man);
6642  mp_movable_contact_component->ObtainContact(p_railmanager_component->GetObject());
6643 
6644  GetVel() -= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject()->GetVel();
6645  }
6646  return;
6647  }
6648  }
6649 }
6650 
6651 /******************************************************************/
6652 /* */
6653 /* */
6654 /******************************************************************/
6655 
6656 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::will_take_rail ( const CRailNode* pNode, CRailManager* p_rail_man, bool from_walk )
6657 {
6658  // no grinding if we're in an acid drop which was generated from an ollie out of a grind; prevents acid-grind-acid-grind repetition
6659  if (GetState() == AIR && GetFlag(IN_ACID_DROP) && GetFlag(OLLIED_FROM_RAIL)
6660  && (mp_rail_node == pNode || mp_rail_node == pNode->GetNextLink() || mp_rail_node == pNode->GetPrevLink()))
6661  {
6662  return false;
6663  }
6664 
6665  // if it's a different rail, then allow rerailing
6666  if (!mp_rail_node // if there was no last rail
6667 
6668  // Dan: removed this line to prevent occasional rerailing when you grind off the end of a car; why was it here in the first place?
6669  // || (mp_rail_man && mp_rail_man->IsMoving() && !mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact()) // or last rail was movable, and we've lost contact
6670 
6671  || mp_rail_node != pNode // or not same segment
6672  && mp_rail_node != pNode->GetNextLink() // or the one before
6673  && mp_rail_node != pNode->GetPrevLink()) // of the one after
6674  {
6675  if (mp_rail_node && Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark())
6676  {
6677  Dbg_Assert(mp_rail_man);
6678 
6679  // in park editor rail must also not share end points to be considered different
6680  Mth::Vector a = mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNode);
6681  Mth::Vector b = mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNode->GetNextLink());
6682  Mth::Vector c = mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNode);
6683  Mth::Vector d = mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNode->GetNextLink());
6684 
6685  if (Mth::Abs(a.Length()) > 6.0f
6686  && Mth::Abs(b.Length()) > 6.0f
6687  && Mth::Abs(c.Length()) > 6.0f
6688  && Mth::Abs(d.Length()) > 6.0f)
6689  {
6690  SetFlagTrue(CAN_RERAIL);
6691  }
6692  }
6693  else
6694  {
