6695  SetFlagTrue(CAN_RERAIL);
6696  }
6697  }
6698 
6699  return (GetFlag(CAN_RERAIL) || Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_rail_time) > m_rerail_time)
6700  && (from_walk
6701  || (GetState() != RAIL // not already on a rail
6702  && (!GetFlag(TRACKING_VERT) || GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f))); // must be not vert, or going up
6703 }
6704 
6705 /******************************************************************/
6706 /* */
6707 /* */
6708 /******************************************************************/
6709 
6710 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::got_rail ( const Mth::Vector& rail_pos, const CRailNode* pNode, CRailManager* p_rail_man, bool no_lip_tricks, bool from_walk )
6711 {
6712  // got a point on rail, with start node number from a particular rail manager
6713  // use this info to start grinding or lipping on the rail
6714 
6715  CControlPad& control_pad = mp_input_component->GetControlPad();
6716 
6717  CSkaterFlipAndRotateComponent* p_flip_and_rotate_component = GetSkaterFlipAndRotateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
6718  Dbg_Assert(p_flip_and_rotate_component);
6719  p_flip_and_rotate_component->DoAnyFlipRotateOrBoardRotateAfters();
6720 
6721 
6722  // Mick - landed on a rail
6723  // if it's a "new" rail, then tell the robot detector about it
6724  if (mp_rail_node != pNode)
6725  {
6726  int rail_index = p_rail_man->GetNodeIndex(pNode);
6727  mp_score_component->GetScore()->UpdateRobotDetection(rail_index);
6728  }
6729 
6730  mp_rail_node = pNode;
6731  mp_rail_man = p_rail_man;
6732 
6733  // handle single node rails
6734  if (!pNode->GetPrevLink() && !pNode->GetNextLink())
6735  {
6736  // for a single node rail, we apply in a single frame all the effects of entering and exiting the rail state;
6737 
6739  // Emulate entering the rail state (with horizontal dir direction)
6740 
6741  // check for collision in moving from m_pos to rail_pos
6742 
6743  m_col_start = GetPos();
6744  m_col_end = rail_pos;
6745  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6746  {
6747  // check distance from the rail to the collision point
6748  if ((rail_pos - m_feeler.GetPoint()).LengthSqr() > 6.0f * 6.0f)
6749  {
6750  return;
6751  }
6752  }
6753 
6754  // check first if we are not moving much in the XY and if not, then se the XZ velocity to the matrix[Z], so we always go forward
6755  if (Mth::Abs(GetVel()[X]) < 0.01f && Mth::Abs(GetVel()[Z]) < 0.01f)
6756  {
6757  GetVel()[X] = GetMatrix()[Z][X];
6758  GetVel()[Z] = GetMatrix()[Z][Z];
6759  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6760  }
6761 
6762  if (!from_walk && GetVel()[X] * GetVel()[X] + GetVel()[Z] * GetVel()[Z] > 10.0f * 10.0f)
6763  {
6764  GetVel().RotateToPlane(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6765  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6766  }
6767 
6768  // rail direction is taken to always simply be along our horizontal velocity, rotated up
6769  Mth::Vector dir = GetVel();
6770  dir[Y] = 0.0f;
6771  dir.Normalize();
6772  float angle = Mth::DegToRad(Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xbb357ecb,"Physics_Point_Rail_Kick_Upward_Angle")));
6773  float c = cosf(angle);
6774  float s = sinf(angle);
6775  Mth::Vector boost_dir(c * dir[X], s, c * dir[Z]);
6776 
6777  // get the rail node name
6778  Script::CArray* pNodeArray = mp_rail_man->GetNodeArray();
6779  Script::CStruct* pNode = pNodeArray->GetStructure(mp_rail_node->GetNode());
6780  pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9, "Name"), &m_last_rail_node_name, Script::ASSERT);
6781 
6782  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_last_rail_node_name);
6783 
6784  // Now we want to see if the rail has a trigger, and if it does, trigger it....
6785 
6786  uint32 trigger_script = 0;
6787 
6788  // no need to call maybe_trip_rail_trigger for a single node rail
6789  if (pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x2ca8a299, "TriggerScript"), &trigger_script))
6790  {
6791  mp_trigger_component->TripTrigger(
6792  TRIGGER_LAND_ON,
6793  m_last_rail_node_name,
6794  pNodeArray == Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5, "NodeArray")) ? NULL : pNodeArray,
6795  mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact() ? mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject() : NULL
6796  );
6797  }
6798 
6799  GetPos() = rail_pos;
6800  DUMP_POSITION;
6801 
6802  // Now we'v got onto the rail, we need to:
6803  // 1) kill velocity perpendicular to the rail
6804  // 2) add a speed boost in the direction we are going.
6805 
6806  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
6807  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
6808 
6809  // if we are transitioning from wall to rail, then snap him upright
6810  if (GetState() == WALL)
6811  {
6812  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
6813  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6814  }
6815 
6816  SetState(RAIL);
6817 
6818  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
6819  mp_sound_component->PlayLandSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), mp_state_component->m_terrain);
6820 
6821  float old_y = GetVel()[Y];
6822  GetVel().ProjectToNormal(dir); // kill perp velocity
6823  if (from_walk && Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), GetMatrix()[Z]) < 0.0f)
6824  {
6825  if (GetVel().LengthSqr() < Mth::Sqr(1.1f * mp_walk_component->s_get_param(CRCD(0x896c8888, "jump_adjust_speed"))))
6826  {
6827  GetVel().Set();
6828  dir = GetMatrix()[Z];
6829  dir[Y] = 0.0f;
6830  dir.Normalize();
6831  }
6832 
6833  }
6834  GetVel()[Y] = old_y; // except for Y
6835 
6836  GetVel() += dir * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xa3ef4833, "Point_Rail_Speed_Boost")); // add speed boost
6837  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6838 
6839 
6840  // (Mick) Set m_rail_time, otherwise there is a single frame where it is invalid
6841  // and this allows us to immediately re-rail and hence do the "insta-bail", since the triangle button will be held down
6842  m_rail_time = Tmr::GetTime();
6843 
6845  // Emulate effects of rail state (with boost_dir direction)
6846 
6847  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
6848  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
6849  SetFlagFalse(IN_RECOVERY);
6850  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
6851 
6852  // set default rerail time
6853  m_rerail_time = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x2b4645ad, "Rail_Minimum_Rerail_Time")));
6854  // and dissalow any overriding of this
6855  SetFlagFalse(CAN_RERAIL); // dont allow rerailing after coming off a segment
6856 
6857  GetVel().RotateToNormal(boost_dir);
6858  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6859 
6861  // Emulate exiting the rail state
6862 
6863  // no need to call maybe_trip_rail_trigger for a single node rail
6864  if (trigger_script)
6865  {
6866  mp_trigger_component->TripTrigger(
6867  TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF,
6868  m_last_rail_node_name,
6869  pNodeArray == Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5, "NodeArray")) ? NULL : pNodeArray,
6870  mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact() ? mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject() : NULL
6871  );
6872  }
6873 
6874  SetState(AIR);
6875  GetPos()[Y] += 1.0f;
6876  DUMP_POSITION;
6877 
6879  // Do extra point rail logic
6880 
6881  // trigger the appropriate script
6882  GetObject()->SelfEvent(CRCD(0xb8048f1d, "PointRail"));
6883 
6884  return;
6885  }
6886 
6888  // Check for lip trick
6890 
6891  float LipAllowSine = sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x8157c5d9, "LipAllowAngle"))));
6892  if (pNode->GetFlag(LIP_OVERRIDE))
6893  {
6894  LipAllowSine = sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xf3b6f95e, "LipAllowAngle_Override"))));
6895  }
6896  float HorizSine = sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe2a85fbb, "LipPlayerHorizontalAngle"))));
6897  float VertCos = cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x61079462, "LipRampVertAngle"))));
6898 
6899  if ((mAllowLipNoGrind // This flag makes lip tricks always happen, hooray!
6900  || (
6901  GetVel()[Y] > 0.0f // going upwards
6902  && Mth::Abs(GetMatrix()[Y][Y]) < HorizSine // fairly horizontal skater
6903  && GetMatrix()[Z][Y] > 0.0f // Facing fairly up in the air
6904  && Mth::Abs(m_current_normal[Y]) < VertCos // last poly we were on was near vert
6905  && Mth::Abs(GetMatrix()[X][Y]) < LipAllowSine // skater pointing fairly straight up
6906  )) && !no_lip_tricks)
6907  {
6908  // Reset a bunch of stuff.
6909  GetVel().Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
6910  DUMP_VELOCITY;
6911  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
6912  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
6913  SetFlagFalse(LAST_POLY_WAS_VERT);
6914  SetFlagFalse(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
6915  // SetFlagFalse(LEAN);
6916 
6917  // Make sure any other balance trick is stopped.
6918  mp_balance_trick_component->stop_balance_trick();
6919 
6920  m_pre_lip_pos = GetPos();
6921 
6922  // Into the lip state
6923  SetState(LIP);
6924 
6925  // Snap the position
6926  GetPos() = rail_pos;
6927  DUMP_POSITION;
6928 
6929  // Pop the skater horizontal
6930  Mth::Vector u = m_current_normal;
6931  u[Y] = 0.0f;
6932  u.Normalize();
6933  GetMatrix()[Y] = u;
6934 
6935  GetMatrix()[Z].Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
6936 
6937  #if 0 // old code
6938  // GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(m_matrix[Y],m_matrix[Z]);
6939  // GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
6940  #else
6941  GetMatrix()[X].Set(
6942  -GetMatrix()[Y][Z],
6943  0.0f,
6944  GetMatrix()[Y][X],
6945  0.0f
6946  );
6947  #endif
6948 
6949  ResetLerpingMatrix();
6950 
6951  // Update the "Require_Lip" flag so lip only gaps don't need to wait on frame
6952  GetSkaterGapComponentFromObject(GetObject())->UpdateCancelRequire(0,REQUIRE_LIP);
6953 
6954 
6955  // Trigger the lip on event.
6956  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_LIP_ON);
6957 
6958  mp_trick_component->mUseSpecialTrickText = false;
6959 
6960  if (!GetObject()->GetScript())
6961  {
6962  GetObject()->SetScript(new Script::CScript);
6963  }
6964 
6965  // Run the lip script.
6966  GetObject()->GetScript()->SetScript(CRCD(0x1647cf96, "LipTrick"), NULL, GetObject());
6967  GetObject()->GetScript()->Update();
6968 
6969  // Set the mDoingTrick flag so that the camera can detect that a trick is being done.
6970  mp_state_component->SetDoingTrick(true);
6971 
6972  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
6973 
6974  return;
6975  }
6976 
6977  // no lip trick, so we rail
6978 
6979  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
6980 
6981  const CRailNode* pStart = mp_rail_node;
6982  const CRailNode* pEnd = pStart->GetNextLink();
6983 
6984  Mth::Vector dir = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart);
6985  dir.Normalize();
6986 
6987  // Now, we've get a rail
6988 
6989  // check for collision in moving from m_pos to rail_pos
6990 
6991  m_col_start = GetPos();
6992  m_col_end = rail_pos;
6993  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
6994  {
6995  // check distance from the rail to the collision point
6996  if ((rail_pos - m_feeler.GetPoint()).LengthSqr() > 6.0f * 6.0f)
6997  {
6998  return;
6999  }
7000  }
7001 
7002  if (GetFlag(IN_ACID_DROP))
7003  {
7004  MESSAGE("GRINDING FROM ACID DROP");
7005  DUMPV(acid_hold);
7006  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7007  GetVel() += acid_hold;
7008  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7009  }
7010 
7011  // we need to check if this is the end of the rail and we are going to come off it next frame, then we don't want to get on it....
7012 
7013  // check first if we are not moving much in the XY and if not, then se the XZ velocity to the matrix[Z], so we always go forward
7014  if (GetVel()[X] == 0.0f && GetVel()[Z] == 0.0f)
7015  {
7016  GetVel()[X] = GetMatrix()[Z][X];
7017  GetVel()[Z] = GetMatrix()[Z][Z];
7018  }
7019 
7021  // Mick: Start of patch
7022  // (For Oil Rig type problem with steep rails)
7023  // if we are moving forward, then rotate velocity onto a horizontal plane
7024  // so we don't seem to be going backwards up steep rails when we jump onto them
7025 
7026  #if 0 // old code
7027  // Mth::Vector flat_vel = GetVel();
7028  // flat_vel[Y] = 0;
7029  // if (flat_vel.Length() > 10.0f)
7030  // {
7031  // GetVel().RotateToPlane(Mth::Vector(0.0f,1.0f,0.0f));
7032  //}
7033  #else
7034  if (!from_walk && GetVel()[X] * GetVel()[X] + GetVel()[Z] * GetVel()[Z] > 10.0f * 10.0f)
7035  {
7036  GetVel().RotateToPlane(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
7037  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7038  }
7039  #endif
7040 
7041  //
7042  // Mick: end of patch
7044 
7045  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetVel());
7046 
7047  // sign is which way we are going along the rail
7048  float sign;
7049  if (dot == 0.0f)
7050  {
7051  // if the dot product can not determine the direction (pull up from hangs), choose randomly
7052  sign = Mth::Rnd(2) ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
7053  }
7054  else
7055  {
7056  sign = Mth::Sgn(dot);
7057  }
7058 
7059  if (sign < 0.0f)
7060  {
7061  // will be going backwards along the rail
7062 
7063  // if the rail stick point is this last point, then we don't want to snap to it as we will immediatly fly off,
7064  // and the point might be coincident with a wall or the ground and that will cause problems
7065  if (!pStart->GetPrevLink() && mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) == rail_pos) return;
7066  }
7067  else
7068  {
7069  // same for going forward along the rail
7070  if (!pEnd->GetNextLink() && mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) == rail_pos) return;
7071  }
7072 
7073  // Now we want to see if the rail has a trigger, and if it does, trigger it....
7074  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_LAND_ON);
7075 
7076  GetPos() = rail_pos;
7077  DUMP_POSITION;
7078 
7079  // Now we'v got onto the rail, we need to:
7080  // 1) kill velocity perpendicular to the rail
7081  // 2) add a speed boost in the direction we are going.
7082 
7083  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
7084  SetFlagFalse(TRACKING_VERT);
7085 
7086  // if we are transitioning from wall to rail, then snap him upright
7087  if (GetState() == WALL)
7088  {
7089  new_normal(Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
7090  ResetLerpingMatrix();
7091  }
7092 
7093  SetState(RAIL);
7094 
7095  // don't play the rail sound when coming onto a rail from walking
7096  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(mp_physics_control_component->GetStateSwitchTime()) != 0)
7097  {
7098  // play sound based on pre-rail velocity
7099  mp_sound_component->PlayLandSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), mp_state_component->m_terrain);
7100  }
7101 
7102  float old_y = GetVel()[Y];
7103  GetVel().ProjectToNormal(dir); // kill perp velocity
7104  if (from_walk && Mth::DotProduct(GetVel(), GetMatrix()[Z]) < 0.0f)
7105  {
7106  if (GetVel().LengthSqr() < Mth::Sqr(1.1f * mp_walk_component->s_get_param(CRCD(0x896c8888, "jump_adjust_speed"))))
7107  {
7108  GetVel().Set();
7109  sign = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetMatrix()[Z]));
7110  }
7111 
7112  }
7113  GetVel()[Y] = old_y; // except for Y
7114 
7115  GetVel() += dir * sign * GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x457bb395, "Rail_Speed_Boost")); // add speed boost
7116  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7117 
7118  // Ken stuff ...
7119  bool Rail_RightOfRail = false;
7120  bool Rail_Parallel = false;
7121  mRail_Backwards = false;
7122 
7123  if (sign < 0.0f)
7124  {
7125  dir = -dir;
7126  }
7127  // dir is now the unit vector pointing along the rail in the direction we will be moving on the rail
7128 
7129  // Calculate which side of the rail we're on
7130  #if 0 // old code
7131  // Mth::Vector d = rail_pos - m_last_ground_pos;
7132  // Mth::Vector side_vel(d.GetZ(), 0.0f, -d.GetX());
7133  // if (Mth::DotProduct(dir, side_vel) < 0.0f)
7134  // {
7135  // Rail_RightOfRail = true;
7136  // }
7137  #else
7138  float side_vel_X = rail_pos[Z] - m_last_ground_pos[Z];
7139  float side_vel_Z = -(rail_pos[X] - m_last_ground_pos[X]);
7140  if (dir[X] * side_vel_X + dir[Z] * side_vel_Z < 0.0f)
7141  {
7142  Rail_RightOfRail = true;
7143  }
7144  #endif
7145 
7147  // Bad ledge detection
7149 
7150  // Calculate the up and down offsets for collision test.
7151  m_col_start.Set(0.0f, GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xe4d79235, "Physics_Ground_Snap_Up")), 0.0f, 0.0f);
7152  m_col_end.Set(0.0f, -GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x9cd7ed5c, "Rail_Bad_Ledge_Drop_Down_Dist")), 0.0f, 0.0f);
7153 
7154  // Add the rail pos, so start and end are now above and below the rail.
7155  m_col_start += rail_pos;
7156  m_col_end += rail_pos;
7157 
7158  // Calculate a side offset, using the rail direction rotated 90 degrees.
7159  Mth::Vector Off(dir[Z], 0.0f, -dir[X], 0.0f);
7160  Off *= GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x31669752, "Rail_Bad_Ledge_Side_Dist"));
7161 
7162  // Add the offset and do the left collision.
7163  m_col_start += Off;
7164  m_col_end += Off;
7165  bool LeftCollision = get_member_feeler_collision();
7166 
7167  // Move across to the other side and do the right collision.
7168  m_col_start -= 2.0f * Off;
7169  m_col_end -= 2.0f * Off;
7170  bool RightCollision = get_member_feeler_collision();
7171 
7172  // Bit of logic to get whether it's a bad ledge or not.
7173  mBadLedge = (LeftCollision && !Rail_RightOfRail) || (RightCollision && Rail_RightOfRail);
7174  mLedge = LeftCollision || RightCollision;
7175 
7177 
7178  float RightDot = Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetMatrix()[X]);
7179  float FrontDot = Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetMatrix()[Z]);
7180 
7181  if (Mth::Abs(RightDot) < GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd0688d4e, "Rail_Tolerance")))
7182  {
7183  // The skater's right vector is close to perpendicular to the rail, so the skater must be pointing fairly parallel to it.
7184  Rail_Parallel = true;
7185 
7186  // Use the front vector to determine forwards/backwards, since the front vector is fairly parallel to the rail.
7187  if (FrontDot < 0.0f)
7188  {
7189  mRail_Backwards = true;
7190  }
7191  }
7192  else
7193  {
7194  if (GetFlag(FLIPPED))
7195  {
7196  RightDot = -RightDot;
7197  }
7198 
7199  // The skater's right vector is fairly parallel to the rail, so use it to determine forwards/backwards.
7200  if (RightDot < 0.0f)
7201  {
7202  mRail_Backwards = true;
7203  }
7204  }
7205 
7206  mp_trick_component->mUseSpecialTrickText = false;
7207 
7208  if (!mp_trick_component->TriggerAnyExtraGrindTrick(
7209  Rail_RightOfRail,
7210  Rail_Parallel,
7211  mRail_Backwards,
7212  GetFlag(FLIPPED))
7213  )
7214  {
7215  do_grind_trick(CSkaterPad::sGetDirection(
7216  control_pad.m_up.GetPressed(),
7217  control_pad.m_down.GetPressed(),
7218  control_pad.m_left.GetPressed(),
7219  control_pad.m_right.GetPressed()
7220  ), Rail_RightOfRail, Rail_Parallel, mRail_Backwards, GetFlag(FLIPPED));
7221  }
7222 
7223  // (Mick) Set m_rail_time, otherwise there is a single frame where it is invalid
7224  // and this allows us to immediately re-rail and hence do the "insta-bail", since the triangle button will be held down
7225  m_rail_time = Tmr::GetTime();
7226 }
7227 
7228 /******************************************************************/
7229 /* */
7230 /* */
7231 /******************************************************************/
7232 
7233 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_lip_physics ( )
7234 {
7235  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
7236  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
7237  SetFlagFalse(IN_RECOVERY);
7238 
7239  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos()))
7240  {
7241  GetPos() += mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
7242  DUMP_POSITION;
7243 
7244  // this is close to correct, 'cept that but because of rotation, it's not quite right
7245  m_pre_lip_pos += mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
7246 
7247  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->IsRotated())
7248  {
7249 
7250  GetMatrix() *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
7251  m_lerping_display_matrix *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
7252  }
7253  }
7254 
7255  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
7256  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x1a5eab7, "rail_highlights")))
7257  {
7258  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node), mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7259  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node) + Mth::Vector(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()) + Mth::Vector(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7260  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7261  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(mp_rail_node->GetNextLink()) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7262  }
7263  #endif
7264 
7265  // Update any balance control required.
7266  if (mp_balance_trick_component->mBalanceTrickType == CRCD(0xa549b57b, "Lip"))
7267  {
7268  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->GetCheat(CRCD(0xcd09e062, "CHEAT_PERFECT_RAIL")))
7269  {
7270  // Here, set the flag. It may seem redundant, but the above line is very likely
7271  // to be hacked by gameshark. They probably won't notice this one, which will
7272  // set the flags as if they had actually enabled the cheat -- which enables us
7273  // to detect that it has been turned on more easily.
7274  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->SetGlobalFlag( Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0xcd09e062, "CHEAT_PERFECT_RAIL")));
7275  mp_balance_trick_component->mLip.mManualLean = 0.0f;
7276  mp_balance_trick_component->mLip.mManualLeanDir = 0.0f;
7277  g_CheatsEnabled = true;
7278  }
7279  mp_balance_trick_component->mLip.DoManualPhysics();
7280  }
7281 
7282  handle_tensing();
7283  if (maybe_flag_ollie_exception())
7284  {
7285  // Trigger the lip jump event.
7286  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_LIP_JUMP);
7287  }
7288 
7289  // lip tricks are very rail-like when determining which world sector you've just tricked off of
7290  if (mp_rail_node)
7291  {
7292  if (mp_rail_man->GetNodeArray())
7293  {
7294  const CRailNode* pRail = mp_rail_node;
7295  Script::CArray* pNodeArray = Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5, "NodeArray"));
7296  Script::CStruct* pNode = pNodeArray->GetStructure(pRail->GetNode());
7297  pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9, "name"), &m_last_rail_node_name, Script::ASSERT);
7298  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_last_rail_node_name);
7299  }
7300  }
7301 
7302  m_lip_time = Tmr::GetTime();
7303 }
7304 
7305 /******************************************************************/
7306 /* */
7307 /* */
7308 /******************************************************************/
7309 
7310 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_rail_physics ( )
7311 {
7312  SetFlagFalse(SPINE_PHYSICS);
7313  SetFlagFalse(IN_ACID_DROP);
7314  SetFlagFalse(IN_RECOVERY);
7315  SetFlagFalse(AIR_ACID_DROP_DISALLOWED);
7316 
7317  // First of all we apply the movement due to contact; best to do it first, as then we will be on the rail we are moving along
7318 
7319  if (mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact())
7320  {
7321  // need to update the transform of the rail manager
7322  // no need to do this
7323  CRailManagerComponent* p_rail_manager_component = GetRailManagerComponentFromObject(mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject());
7324  Dbg_Assert(p_rail_manager_component);
7325 
7326  p_rail_manager_component->UpdateRailManager();
7327 
7328  if (mp_movable_contact_component->UpdateContact(GetPos()))
7329  {
7330 
7331  GetPos() += mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetMovement();
7332  DUMP_POSITION;
7333  if (mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->IsRotated())
7334  {
7335  GetMatrix() *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
7336  m_lerping_display_matrix *= mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetRotation();
7337  }
7338 
7339  }
7340  }
7341 
7342  // set default rerail time
7343  m_rerail_time = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x2b4645ad, "Rail_minimum_rerail_time")));
7344  // and dissalow any overriding of this
7345  SetFlagFalse(CAN_RERAIL); // dont allow rerailing after coming off a segment
7346 
7347 
7348  if (maybe_flag_ollie_exception())
7349  {
7350  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_JUMP_OFF);
7351 
7352  m_rerail_time = static_cast< Tmr::Time >(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xbf35053, "Rail_jump_rerail_time")));
7353 
7354  SetFlagTrue(OLLIED_FROM_RAIL);
7355 
7356  // when we jump off a rail, then raise him up one inch, so we don't collide with the top of a fence or something
7357  GetPos()[Y] += 1.0f; // up one inch......
7358  DUMP_POSITION;
7359  }
7360  else
7361  {
7362  switch (mp_balance_trick_component->mBalanceTrickType)
7363  {
7364  case 0:
7365  case 0x0ac90769: // NoseManual
7366  case 0xef24413b: // Manual
7367  case 0xa549b57b: // Lip
7368  break;
7369 
7370  case 0x255ed86f: // Grind
7371  case 0x8d10119d: // Slide
7372  mp_balance_trick_component->mGrind.DoManualPhysics();
7373  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->GetCheat(CRCD(0xcd09e062, "CHEAT_PERFECT_RAIL")))
7374  {
7375  // Here, set the flag. It may seem redundant, but the above line is very likely
7376  // to be hacked by gameshark. They probably won't notice this one, which will
7377  // set the flags as if they had actually enabled the cheat -- which enables us
7378  // to detect that it has been turned on more easily.
7379  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->SetGlobalFlag( Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0xcd09e062, "CHEAT_PERFECT_RAIL")));
7380  mp_balance_trick_component->mGrind.mManualLean = 0.0f;
7381  mp_balance_trick_component->mGrind.mManualLeanDir = 0.0f;
7382  g_CheatsEnabled = true;
7383  }
7384  break;
7385 
7386  default:
7387  Dbg_Assert(false);
7388  break;
7389  }
7390 
7391  // Get the rail segments
7392 
7393  const CRailNode* pStart = mp_rail_node;
7394  const CRailNode* pEnd = pStart->GetNextLink();
7395 
7396  const CRailNode* pFrom = pStart;
7397  const CRailNode* pOnto = NULL;
7398 
7399  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
7400  if (Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x1a5eab7, "rail_highlights")))
7401  {
7402  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7403  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) + Mth::Vector(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) + Mth::Vector(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7404  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7405  Gfx::AddDebugLine(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) + Mth::Vector(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f), MAKE_RGB(Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256), Mth::Rnd(256)), 0, 1);
7406  }
7407  #endif
7408 
7409  Mth::Vector dir = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart);
7410  float segment_length = dir.Length();
7411  dir *= 1.0f / segment_length;
7412 
7413  // sign is which way we are going along the rail
7414  float old_sign = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetVel()));
7415 
7416  // Get gravity force
7417  Mth::Vector gravity(0.0f, GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0xd1f46992, "Physics_Rail_Gravity")), 0.0f);
7418 
7419  // Project gravity onto the line we are on
7420  gravity.ProjectToNormal(dir);
7421  GetVel() += gravity * m_frame_length;
7422  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7423 
7424  // sign is which way we are going along the rail
7425  float sign = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(dir, GetVel()));
7426 
7427  // sign might have changed here
7428  // so could do the "flipping on a rail" thing
7429  // .................
7430 
7431  if (sign != old_sign)
7432  {
7433  // Note, we JUST flip the "Backwards" flag, as we want to stay in essentailly the same
7434  // pose as before, and as the sign of our velocity dotted with the rail has
7435  // changed, then all we need to to is tell the code we are
7436  // going in the opposite direction to what we were going before, and the
7437  // target vector will be calculated correctly.
7438  mRail_Backwards = !mRail_Backwards;
7439  }
7440 
7441  // check to see if we are on the last segment of the rail
7442  // this logic could be folded into the logic below but it's perhps clearer to have it here
7443  bool last_segment = false;
7444  if (sign < 0.0f)
7445  {
7446  if (pStart->GetPrevLink() && pStart->GetPrevLink()->IsActive())
7447  {
7448  Mth::Vector v1, v2;
7449  v1 = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart);
7450  v2 = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart->GetPrevLink());
7451  v1[Y] = 0.0f;
7452  v2[Y] = 0.0f;
7453  v1.Normalize();
7454  v2.Normalize();
7455  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(v1, v2);
7456  if (dot < cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x76c1da15, "Rail_Corner_Leave_Angle")))))
7457  {
7458  // there is more, but angle is too sharp
7459  last_segment = true;
7460  }
7461  else
7462  {
7463  pOnto = pStart->GetPrevLink();
7464  }
7465  }
7466  else
7467  {
7468  last_segment = true;
7469  }
7470  }
7471  else
7472  {
7473  if (pEnd && pEnd->GetNextLink() && pEnd->GetNextLink()->IsActive())
7474  {
7475  Mth::Vector v1,v2;
7476  v1 = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd);
7477  v2 = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd->GetNextLink());
7478  v1[Y] = 0.0f;
7479  v2[Y] = 0.0f;
7480  v1.Normalize();
7481  v2.Normalize();
7482  float dot = Mth::DotProduct(v1,v2);
7483  if (dot < cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x76c1da15,"Rail_Corner_Leave_Angle")))))
7484  {
7485  // there is more, but angle is too sharp
7486  last_segment = true;
7487  }
7488  else
7489  {
7490  pOnto = pEnd;
7491  }
7492  }
7493  else
7494  {
7495  last_segment = true;
7496  }
7497  }
7498 
7499  // Now we need to see if we have gone beyond the end of the rail segment
7500 
7501  float extra_dist = 0.0f;
7502 
7503  float length_along;
7504  if (sign < 0.0f)
7505  {
7506  // going backwards, so it's the distance from the end of the segment
7507  length_along = (GetPos() - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd)).Length();
7508  }
7509  else
7510  {
7511  // going forwards, so it's the distance from the start
7512  length_along = (GetPos() - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart)).Length();
7513  }
7514 
7515  if (length_along > segment_length + 0.1f) // 0.1 inch, so we don't get stuck
7516  {
7517  // remember this, so we can move along next segment
7518  extra_dist = length_along - segment_length;
7519 
7520  // gone off the end of the segment
7521  if (sign < 0.0f)
7522  {
7523  if (pStart->GetPrevLink()
7524  && pStart->GetPrevLink()->IsActive()
7525  && Rail_ValidInEditor(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart->GetPrevLink())))
7526  {
7527  if (!last_segment)
7528  {
7529  // go onto previous segment
7530  GetPos() = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart);
7531  DUMP_POSITION;
7532  mp_rail_node = pStart->GetPrevLink();
7533  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
7534  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO);
7535  }
7536  else
7537  {
7538  skate_off_rail(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart));
7539  }
7540  }
7541  else
7542  {
7543  skate_off_rail(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart));
7544  }
7545  }
7546  else
7547  {
7548  if (pEnd->GetNextLink()
7549  && pEnd->IsActive()
7550  && Rail_ValidInEditor(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd), mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd->GetNextLink())))
7551  {
7552  if (!last_segment)
7553  {
7554  GetPos() = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd);
7555  DUMP_POSITION;
7556  mp_rail_node = pEnd;
7557  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
7558  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO);
7559  }
7560  else
7561  {
7562  skate_off_rail(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd));
7563  }
7564  }
7565  else
7566  {
7567  skate_off_rail(mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd));
7568  }
7569  }
7570  }
7571 
7572  if (GetState() == RAIL)
7573  {
7574  // recalculate start, end, dir, as we might be on a new segment
7575  const CRailNode* pStart = mp_rail_node;
7576  const CRailNode* pEnd = pStart->GetNextLink();
7577 
7578  Mth::Vector dir = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pStart);
7579  dir.Normalize();
7580 
7581  // sign also may have changed, now that we are auto-linking rail segments
7582 
7583  // sign is which way we are going along the rail
7584  float sign = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(dir,GetVel()));
7585 
7586  m_rail_time = Tmr::GetTime();
7587 
7588  GetVel().RotateToNormal(dir);
7589  GetVel() *= sign; // sign won't be on a new segment
7590  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7591 
7592  float facing_sign = mRail_Backwards ? -sign : sign;
7593 
7594  // z is forward
7595  Mth::Vector target_forward = dir * facing_sign;
7596 
7597  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z] = Mth::Lerp(m_lerping_display_matrix[Z], target_forward, 0.3f);
7598  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z].Normalize();
7599 
7600  #if 0 // old code
7601  // m_lerping_display_matrix[Y].Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
7602  // m_lerping_display_matrix[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(
7603  // m_lerping_display_matrix[Y],
7604  // m_lerping_display_matrix[Z]
7605  // );
7606  #else
7607  m_lerping_display_matrix[X].Set(
7608  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z][Z],
7609  0.0f,
7610  -m_lerping_display_matrix[Z][X],
7611  0.0f
7612  );
7613  #endif
7614  m_lerping_display_matrix[X].Normalize();
7615 
7616  m_lerping_display_matrix[Y] = Mth::CrossProduct(
7617  m_lerping_display_matrix[Z],
7618  m_lerping_display_matrix[X]
7619  );
7620  m_lerping_display_matrix[Y].Normalize();
7621 
7622  // adjust our Z value towards the new value
7623  GetMatrix()[Z] = target_forward;
7624  GetMatrix()[Z].Normalize();
7625 
7626  #if 0 // old code
7627  // GetMatrix()[Y].Set(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
7628  // GetMatrix()[X] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Y],GetMatrix()[Z]);
7629  #else
7630  GetMatrix()[X].Set(
7631  GetMatrix()[Z][Z],
7632  0.0f,
7633  -GetMatrix()[Z][X],
7634  0.0f
7635  );
7636  #endif
7637  GetMatrix()[X].Normalize();
7638 
7639  GetMatrix()[Y] = Mth::CrossProduct(GetMatrix()[Z], GetMatrix()[X]);
7640  GetMatrix()[Y].Normalize();
7641 
7642  Mth::Vector m_movement(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
7643 
7644  // This is where we do the actual movement
7645 
7646  // if this makes us bump into the wall or the ground, then we should leave the rail
7647 
7648  Mth::Vector old_pos = GetPos();
7649  GetPos() += GetVel() * m_frame_length; // current movement
7650  GetPos() += extra_dist * target_forward; // any extra dist from previous segment
7651  GetPos() += m_movement; // movement due to contact with moving object
7652  DUMP_POSITION;
7653 
7654  // Mick: use "old_pos" to generate the direction
7655  // so it is guarenteed to be parallel to the rail
7656  // and m_pos might have been adjusted if we continued from
7657  // one rail to another (in-line) rail, like in the park editor
7658  Mth::Vector movement = GetPos() - old_pos;
7659  Mth::Vector direction = movement;
7660  direction.Normalize();
7661 
7662  bool always_check = false;
7663  if (!last_segment && Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark())
7664  {
7665  // in the park editor we can have tight curves that end in walls, so we want to always do the forward check
7666  // if we are on a segment that is horizontal, and leads to another segment that is also horizontal
7667  Mth::Vector from = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pFrom->GetNextLink()) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pFrom);
7668  Mth::Vector onto = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pOnto->GetNextLink()) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pOnto);
7669  from.Normalize();
7670  onto.Normalize();
7671  float delta = Mth::Abs(from[Y] - onto[Y]);
7672  if (delta < 0.01f)
7673  {
7674  // lines have a sufficently close Y angle
7675  always_check = true;
7676  }
7677  }
7678 
7679  // Only check for hitting a wall if we are on a segment of rail that has no more rail
7680  if (last_segment || always_check)
7681  {
7682  m_col_start = old_pos;
7683  m_col_end = GetPos();
7684  m_col_end += movement + (direction * 6.0f);
7685 
7686  // raise them up one inch, so we don't collide with the rail
7687  m_col_start += GetMatrix()[Y];
7688  m_col_end += GetMatrix()[Y];
7689  if (get_member_feeler_collision())
7690  {
7691  // if in the park editor, then ignore collision with invisible surfaces
7692  if (!Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark() || !(m_feeler.GetFlags() & mFD_INVISIBLE))
7693  {
7694  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF);
7695  // don't let him make this movement!!
7696  GetPos() = GetOldPos();
7697  GetPos()[Y] += 1.0f;
7698  DUMP_POSITION;
7699 
7700  // project velocity along the plane if we run into a wall
7701  GetVel().ProjectToPlane(m_feeler.GetNormal());
7702  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7703 
7704  SetState(AIR); // knocked off rail, as something in front
7705  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0xafaa46ba, "OffRail"));
7706  }
7707  }
7708  }
7709  }
7710  }
7711 
7712  // set the normal value, so the camera is not too confused
7713  m_current_normal = GetMatrix()[Y];
7714 
7715  // Add mGrindTweak to the score.
7716  // adjusted by the robot rail mult (1.0 to 0.1, depending on how much you've ground the rail)
7717  mp_score_component->GetScore()->TweakTrick(mGrindTweak * mp_score_component->GetScore()->GetRobotRailMult());
7718 
7719  // if we've already started doing a trick, then start remembering our trick chain
7720  {
7721  const CRailNode* pRail = mp_rail_node;
7722  Dbg_Assert(pRail);
7723 
7724  if (mp_rail_man->GetNodeArray())
7725  {
7726  Script::CArray* pNodeArray=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5, "NodeArray"));
7727  Script::CStruct* pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure(pRail->GetNode());
7728  pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9, "name"), &m_last_rail_node_name, true);
7729  mp_trick_component->TrickOffObject(m_last_rail_node_name);
7730  }
7731  }
7732 }
7733 
7734 /******************************************************************/
7735 /* */
7736 /* */
7737 /******************************************************************/
7738 
7739 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::ollie_off_rail_rotate ( )
7740 {
7741  float rot;
7742  if (mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_left.GetPressed())
7743  {
7744  rot = Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x38505ef3, "Rail_Jump_Angle")));
7745  }
7746  else if (mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_right.GetPressed())
7747  {
7748  rot = -Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x38505ef3, "Rail_Jump_Angle")));
7749  }
7750  else return;
7751 
7752  GetVel().RotateY(rot);
7753  GetMatrix().RotateYLocal(rot);
7754  m_lerping_display_matrix.RotateYLocal(rot);
7755 }
7756 
7757 /******************************************************************/
7758 /* */
7759 /* */
7760 /******************************************************************/
7761 
7762 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::skate_off_rail ( const Mth::Vector& off_point )
7763 {
7764  // we have skated off a rail; either it was the end of a rail or we hit a sharp corner
7765  // we need to see if there is another rail in front of us that we can continue skating on
7766 
7767  bool really_off = true;
7768 
7769  Mth::Vector a;
7770  if (Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark())
7771  {
7772  // in the park editor, we use the last point on the rail we just took off from as the start of the line to use for looking for new rails
7773  // so we don't get rail segments earlier in the list
7774  a = off_point;
7775  }
7776  else
7777  {
7778  // go back a step
7779  a = GetPos() - GetVel() * m_frame_length;
7780  DUMP_POSITION;
7781  }
7782 
7783  // use current pos, as we know that is off the end
7784  Mth::Vector b = GetPos();
7785 
7786  Mth::Vector rail_pos;
7787  CRailNode* pNode;
7788 
7789 
7790  // we need to tilt the line down, as the rail code currently fails to find a rail if the line we check is exactly parallel with it
7791  a[Y] += 6.0f;
7792  b[Y] += 6.1f;
7793 
7794  float min_dot = cosf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x76c1da15, "Rail_Corner_Leave_Angle"))));
7795 
7796  // Note: we are now passing in Rail_Side() of the current rail and velocity
7797  // so we can see if we switch from a rail on a left facing ledge to a rail on a right facing ledge, and try to inhibit that type of transition
7798  // in favour of one that retains the same side
7799  if (mp_rail_man->StickToRail(
7800  a,
7801  b,
7802  &rail_pos,
7803  &pNode,
7804  mp_rail_node,
7805  min_dot,
7806  mp_rail_node->Side(GetVel())
7807  ))
7808  {
7809  // Mick, in park editor, we also disallow this if the rail is the next or the prev rail node from our current node
7810  if (mp_rail_node != pNode && (
7811  !Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark()
7812  || mp_rail_node->GetNextLink() != pNode
7813  && mp_rail_node->GetPrevLink() != pNode
7814  ))
7815  {
7816  const CRailNode* pNewStart = pNode;
7817  const CRailNode* pNewEnd = pNewStart->GetNextLink();
7818 
7819  // check to see if our new position is within the two points
7820  Mth::Vector to_start = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewStart) - GetPos();
7821  Mth::Vector to_end = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewEnd) - GetPos();
7822 
7823  float mid_dot = Mth::DotProduct(to_start, to_end);
7824 
7825  // In game, the point must actualy be in the line, so mid dot will be negative
7826  bool ok = mid_dot < 0.0f;
7827 
7828  // Park Editor specific rail joining
7829  if (!ok && Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark())
7830  {
7831  // in the park editor, we let the user overshoot, so he sticks to tight curves that are between two pieces
7832  ok = true;
7833 
7834  // we need to ensure that the rail segment is a good continuation of the segment that we were just on
7835  // Namely that one of the new start/end points is close to the end of the rail that we just came off
7836  // and that the direction we will be going along is within 45 degrees of the direction we were going along before.
7837  // (NOT DONE HERE, as the following test is sufficent)
7838 
7839  // first a simple elimination, if the rail is longer than our velocity projected onto it then we can not posibly have overshot it!!
7840  Mth::Vector new_rail_segment = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewStart);
7841  Mth::Vector skater_movement = b - a;
7842  float new_rail_length = new_rail_segment.Length();
7843  if (new_rail_length > skater_movement.Length())
7844  {
7845  ok = false;
7846  }
7847 
7848  // now we could find the shortest distance between two line segments; should be within 2 inches
7849  // (ALSO NOT DONE)
7850 
7851  // bit of a patch for the park editor, it's gone past the end of the rail, so set him in the middle of the rail, so we can continue nicely
7852  // possible glitch here, but better than falling of the rail
7853  // It's going to be a small rail anyway, so won't look too bad.
7854  if (ok && mid_dot >= 0.0f)
7855  {
7856  rail_pos = (mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewEnd) + mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewStart)) / 2.0f;
7857  }
7858 
7859  }
7860 
7861  if (ok)
7862  {
7863  Mth::Vector newdir = mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewEnd) - mp_rail_man->GetPos(pNewStart);
7864  newdir.Normalize();
7865  if (GetVel()[X] == 0.0f && GetVel()[Z] == 0.0f)
7866  {
7867  GetVel()[X] = GetMatrix()[Z][X];
7868  GetVel()[Z] = GetMatrix()[Z][Z];
7869  DUMP_VELOCITY;
7870  }
7871 
7872  // sign is which way we are going along the rail
7873  float sign = Mth::Sgn(Mth::DotProduct(newdir, GetVel()));
7874  GetVel().RotateToNormal(newdir);
7875  GetVel() *= sign;
7876 
7877  mp_rail_node = pNode; // oh yes, this is the node
7878  GetPos() = rail_pos; // move to closest position on the line
7879  DUMP_POSITION;
7880  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO);
7881  set_terrain(mp_rail_node->GetTerrain());
7882 
7883  really_off = false;
7884  }
7885  else
7886  {
7887  // new position is outside this rail
7888  }
7889  }
7890  else
7891  {
7892  // its the same as this one
7893  }
7894  }
7895  else
7896  {
7897  // did not find any
7898  }
7899 
7900  if (!really_off) return;
7901 
7902  maybe_trip_rail_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF);
7903  SetState(AIR);
7904  GetPos()[Y] += 1.0f;
7905  DUMP_POSITION;
7906  FLAGEXCEPTION(CRCD(0xafaa46ba,"OffRail"));
7907 }
7908 
7909 /******************************************************************/
7910 /* */
7911 /* */
7912 /******************************************************************/
7913 
7914 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::maybe_trip_rail_trigger ( uint32 type )
7915 {
7916  // given that m_rail_node is valid, then trigger any script associated with this rail node
7917  // will search backwards for the first rail that has a trigger script, and then execute that.
7918 
7919  if (!mp_rail_node) return;
7920 
7921  Dbg_Assert(mp_rail_man);
7922 
7923 
7924  const CRailNode* pStartOfRail = mp_rail_node;
7925  const CRailNode* pRail = mp_rail_node;
7926 
7927  // no node array in rail manager indicates auto generated rails, so just return
7928  Script::CArray* pNodeArray = mp_rail_man->GetNodeArray();
7929  if (!pNodeArray) return;
7930 
7931  Script::CStruct* pNode = pNodeArray->GetStructure(mp_rail_node->GetNode());
7932 
7933  // find a rail node that has a "TriggerScript" in it
7934  uint32 value = 0;
7935  if (pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x2ca8a299, "Triggerscript"), &value))
7936  {
7937  // we got it
7938  }
7939  else
7940  {
7941  // did not get it, so scoot backwards until we detect a loop or we find one
7942  const CRailNode* p_loop_detect = pRail; // start loop detect at the start
7943  pRail = pRail->GetPrevLink(); // and the first node we check is the next one
7944  int loop_advance = 0;
7945  while (pRail && pRail != pStartOfRail && pRail != p_loop_detect)
7946  {
7947  pNode = pNodeArray->GetStructure(pRail->GetNode());
7948  if (pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x2ca8a299, "Triggerscript"), &value)) break;
7949 
7950  pRail = pRail->GetPrevLink();
7951  // The p_loop_detect pointer goes backwards at half speed, so if there is a loop
7952  // then pRail is guarenteed to eventually catch up with p_loop_detect
7953  if (loop_advance)
7954  {
7955  p_loop_detect = p_loop_detect->GetPrevLink();
7956  }
7957  loop_advance ^= 1;
7958  }
7959  }
7960 
7961  if (value)
7962  {
7963  // If this is different to last time, then set flag accordingly
7964  uint32 new_last_rail_node_name;
7965  pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9, "name"), &new_last_rail_node_name, Script::ASSERT);
7966 // printf ("%s,%s\n",Script::FindChecksumName(new_last_rail_node_name), Script::FindChecksumName(m_last_rail_node_name));
7967  if (new_last_rail_node_name != m_last_rail_trigger_node_name)
7968  {
7969  SetFlagTrue(NEW_RAIL);
7970  }
7971  else
7972  {
7973  SetFlagFalse(NEW_RAIL);
7974  }
7975  m_last_rail_node_name = new_last_rail_node_name;
7976  m_last_rail_trigger_node_name = new_last_rail_node_name;
7977 
7978 
7979  // if we are using the default node array, then set it to NULL, so TriggerEventFromNode can use this default, which is a lot faster
7980  if (pNodeArray == Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5, "NodeArray")))
7981  {
7982  pNodeArray = NULL;
7983  }
7984 
7985  mp_trigger_component->TripTrigger(
7986  type,
7987  m_last_rail_node_name,
7988  pNodeArray,
7989  mp_movable_contact_component->HaveContact() ? mp_movable_contact_component->GetContact()->GetObject() : NULL
7990  );
7991  }
7992 }
7993 
7994 /******************************************************************/
7995 /* */
7996 /* */
7997 /******************************************************************/
7998 
7999 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::handle_tensing ( )
8000 {
8001  if (!GetFlag(TENSE) && mp_input_component->GetControlPad().m_x.GetPressed())
8002  {
8003  // just starting to tense, so set the flag
8004  SetFlagTrue(TENSE);
8005  }
8006 }
8007 
8008 /******************************************************************/
8009 /* */
8010 /* */
8011 /******************************************************************/
8012 
8013 bool CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::get_member_feeler_collision ( uint16 ignore_1, uint16 ignore_0 )
8014 {
8015  // use m_col_start and m_col_end to set up m_feeler, then check for collision and if there is a collision, then get the various skater collision flags
8016 
8017  m_feeler.SetLine(m_col_start, m_col_end);
8018  m_feeler.SetIgnore(ignore_1, ignore_0);
8019 
8020  bool collision = m_feeler.GetCollision();
8021 
8022  if (!collision) return false;
8023 
8024  if (m_feeler.GetNodeChecksum() && m_feeler.GetTrigger())
8025  {
8026  // Given a node name, then find the checksum of the triggerscript in that node
8027  // note that this is VERY SLOW, as it has to scan the whole node array
8028  // it's usually only called once per frame, per skater, but might still be a good candidate for optimization
8029 
8030  // Now just clear the script, indicating it needed doing later
8031  m_feeler.SetScript(0);
8032  }
8033 
8034  // get any skating specific flags here
8035  uint16 flags = m_feeler.GetFlags();
8036 
8037  // get normal, as it's the kind of things we use in face flag determination
8038  Mth::Vector normal = m_feeler.GetNormal();
8039 
8040  // Make wallable default to off.
8041  m_col_flag_wallable = false;
8042 
8044  // Vert
8045 
8046  m_col_flag_vert = flags & mFD_VERT;
8047 
8049  // Skatable
8050 
8051  if (flags & mFD_SKATABLE)
8052  {
8053  // if flaged as skatable, than that overrides all other flags
8054  m_col_flag_skatable = true;
8055  }
8056  else if (flags & mFD_NOT_SKATABLE)
8057  {
8058  // if flagged as non_skatable, then that overrides all other flags
8059  m_col_flag_skatable = false;
8060  }
8061  else if (flags & mFD_VERT)
8062  {
8063  // if flagged as VERT, then it's the top of a QP, so it's skatable and this overrides the angle flag
8064  m_col_flag_skatable = true;
8065  }
8066  else if (flags & mFD_WALL_RIDABLE)
8067  {
8068  m_col_flag_skatable = false;
8069  m_col_flag_wallable = true;
8070  }
8071  else
8072  {
8073  // determine the skatablitlity based on the angle
8074  // if angle is > 5 degrees from vert, then it is skatable
8075  // here the y component of the normal is the cosine of the angle from vertical
8076 
8077  if (normal[Y] < sinf(Mth::DegToRad(GetPhysicsFloat(CRCD(0x3eede4d3,"Wall_Non_Skatable_Angle")))))
8078  {
8079  // get could possibly do another test here to see if there is a polygon beneath this meaning this is a QP
8080  // however, we want to be flagging the tops of all QPs
8081  m_col_flag_skatable = false;
8082  }
8083  else
8084  {
8085  m_col_flag_skatable = true;
8086  }
8087 
8088  }
8089 
8090  return collision;
8091 }
8092 
8093 /******************************************************************/
8094 /* */
8095 /* */
8096 /******************************************************************/
8097 
8098 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_jump ( Script::CStruct *pParams )
8099 {
8100  // Called by the Jump script command
8101 
8102  // play sounds before modifying the skater speed, as the sound volume and pitch are based on the pre-jump velocity
8103  bool play_sound = !pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xe13620a8, "no_sound"));
8104 
8105  switch (GetState())
8106  {
8107  case GROUND:
8108  mp_trigger_component->CheckFeelerForTrigger(TRIGGER_JUMP_OFF, m_last_ground_feeler);
8109  if (mp_physics_control_component->HaveBeenReset()) return;
8110 
8111  // K: Remember the last ground position for calculating which side of the rail we're on later.
8112  m_last_ground_pos = GetPos();
8113 
8114  if (play_sound)
8115  {
8116  mp_sound_component->PlayJumpSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), m_last_ground_feeler.GetTerrain());
8117  }
8118 
8119  maybe_straight_up();
8120  SetFlagTrue(CAN_BREAK_VERT);
8121  break;
8122 
8123  case AIR:
8124  if (play_sound)
8125  {
8126  mp_sound_component->PlayJumpSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), m_last_ground_feeler.GetTerrain());
8127  }
8128  break;
8129 
8130  case RAIL:
8131  if (play_sound)
8132  {
8133  Dbg_Assert(mp_rail_node);
8134  mp_sound_component->PlayJumpSound(GetObject()->GetVel().Length() / GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xcc5f87aa, "Skater_Max_Max_Speed_Stat")), mp_state_component->m_terrain);
8135  }
8136  break;
8137 
8138  default:
8139  break;
8140  }
8141 
8142  Dbg_Assert(pParams);
8143 
8144  int max_tense_time = GetPhysicsInt(CRCD(0xf733c097, "skater_max_tense_time"));
8145  m_tense_time = Mth::Min(m_tense_time, max_tense_time);
8146 
8147  float max_jump_speed;
8148  float min_jump_speed;
8149 
8150  bool from_vert = GetFlag(VERT_AIR) || (GetState() == GROUND && GetFlag(LAST_POLY_WAS_VERT));
8151 
8152  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xec6b7fc7, "BonelessHeight")))
8153  {
8154  if (from_vert)
8155  {
8156  max_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x39766891, "Physics_Boneless_air_Jump_Speed_stat"));
8157  min_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x4cdb18cb, "Physics_Boneless_air_Jump_Speed_min_stat"));
8158  }
8159  else
8160  {
8161  max_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x8851a76e, "Physics_Boneless_Jump_Speed_stat"));
8162  min_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x6e8efe38, "Physics_Boneless_Jump_Speed_min_stat"));
8163  }
8164  }
8165  else
8166  {
8167  if (from_vert)
8168  {
8169  max_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x9f79c8ea, "Physics_air_Jump_Speed_stat"));
8170  min_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x91b07824, "Physics_air_Jump_Speed_min_stat"));
8171  }
8172  else
8173  {
8174  max_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0x2ade3ad, "Physics_Jump_Speed_stat"));
8175  min_jump_speed = GetSkater()->GetScriptedStat(CRCD(0xc8815e43, "Physics_Jump_Speed_min_stat"));
8176  }
8177  }
8178 
8179  float jump_speed = Mth::LinearMap(min_jump_speed, max_jump_speed, m_tense_time, 0.0f, max_tense_time);
8180 
8181  // If any speed param is specified, then use that instead. Need by Zac for when small skater is doing scripted jumps in the front end.
8182  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xf0d90109, "speed"), &jump_speed);
8183 
8184  SetFlagFalse(TENSE);
8185 
8186  // if we have a very high downward velocity and we are landing on vert, then do not jump
8187 
8188  // when jumping, don't add in the current velocity if it is less than zero
8189  // this will give us nicer feeling jumps when
8190  // - comping down wall rides
8191  // - skating down slopes
8192  // - skating down the back of bumps, liks the speed bumps in CA
8193  // - landing on a QP
8194 
8195 
8196  if (GetFlag(VERT_AIR) && GetVel()[Y] < 0.0f)
8197  {
8198  // push outward (and upward) away from vert poly
8199  GetVel() += jump_speed * m_display_normal;
8200  DUMP_VELOCITY;
8201  jump_speed = 0;
8202  SetFlagFalse(VERT_AIR);
8203  }
8204  else
8205  {
8206  if (GetVel()[Y] < 0.0f)
8207  {
8208  GetVel()[Y] = 0.0f;
8209  DUMP_VELOCITY;
8210  }
8211  }
8212 
8213  GetVel()[Y] += jump_speed;
8214  DUMP_VELOCITY;
8215 
8216  // if pointing down, then jump down, as moving up will make us pass through whatever we are on
8217  if (GetMatrix()[Y][Y] < -0.1f)
8218  {
8219  GetVel()[Y] -= jump_speed * 1.5f;
8220  DUMP_VELOCITY;
8221  GetPos() += GetMatrix()[Y] * 12.0f;
8222  DUMP_POSITION;
8223  }
8224 
8225  // allow side jumps when jumping off rails or when late jumping in air after skating off a rail
8226  if (GetState() == RAIL || (GetState() == AIR && m_previous_state == RAIL))
8227  {
8228  ollie_off_rail_rotate();
8229  }
8230 
8231  // don't change the state until after sound is played, as the above switch relyies on the GROUND/RAIL state...
8232  SetState(AIR);
8233 
8234  m_last_jump_time_stamp = Tmr::GetTime();
8235 
8236  GetObject()->BroadcastEvent(CRCD(0x8687163a, "SkaterJump"));
8237 }
8238 
8239 /******************************************************************/
8240 /* */
8241 /* */
8242 /******************************************************************/
8243 
8244 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::start_skitch ( )
8245 {
8246  // Start Skitching, given that we've queue one up
8247  // Note, mp_skitch_object is a smart pointer so there is a slight possibility that it might have died but we check that
8248 
8249  // Mick: I'm using .Convert here. I'm not sure if makes any difference,
8250  // but it can't hurt and should compile the same.
8251  if (!mp_skitch_object.Convert()) return;
8252 
8253  mp_movable_contact_component->ObtainContact(mp_skitch_object);
8254  SetFlagTrue(SKITCHING);
8255  m_moving_to_skitch = true;
8256  move_to_skitch_point();
8257 
8258  // Mick: For some reason we sometimes get a NULL smart pointer here
8259  // so I'm checking again here, in addition to changing the code
8260  // to use .Convert
8261  if (!mp_skitch_object.Convert()) return;
8262 
8263  mp_skitch_object->SelfEvent(CRCD(0x35224f25, "SkitchOn"));
8264 }
8265 
8266 /******************************************************************/
8267 /* */
8268 /* */
8269 /******************************************************************/
8270 
8271 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::do_grind_trick ( uint Direction, bool Right, bool Parallel, bool Backwards, bool Regular )
8272 {
8273  int SubArrayIndex = 0;
8274 
8275  // Choose which array index to use.
8276  switch (Direction)
8277  {
8278  case 0: // Nowt
8279  SubArrayIndex = 0;
8280  break;
8281  case PAD_U: // Up
8282  SubArrayIndex = 1;
8283  break;
8284  case PAD_D: // Down
8285  SubArrayIndex = 2;
8286  break;
8287  case PAD_L: // Left
8288  SubArrayIndex = 3;
8289  break;
8290  case PAD_R: // Right
8291  SubArrayIndex = 4;
8292  break;
8293  case PAD_UL: // UpLeft
8294  SubArrayIndex = 5;
8295  break;
8296  case PAD_UR: // UpRight
8297  SubArrayIndex = 6;
8298  break;
8299  case PAD_DL: // DownLeft
8300  SubArrayIndex = 7;
8301  break;
8302  case PAD_DR: // DownRight
8303  SubArrayIndex = 8;
8304  break;
8305  default:
8306  Dbg_MsgAssert(false, ("Bad button checksum"));
8307  break;
8308  }
8309 
8310  // GetArray will assert if GrindTrickList not found.
8311  Script::CArray* pMainArray = Script::GetArray(CRCD(0x2ab3341d, "GrindTrickList"));
8312  Script::CArray* pSubArray = pMainArray->GetArray(SubArrayIndex);
8313 
8314  uint Index = 0;
8315  if (Right) Index |= 1;
8316  if (Parallel) Index |= 2;
8317  if (Backwards) Index |= 4;
8318  if (Regular) Index |= 8;
8319 
8320  // Initialise mGrindTweak, which should get set by a SetGrindTweak command in the script that is about to be run.
8321  ResetGrindTweak();
8322 
8323  CSkaterFlipAndRotateComponent* p_flip_and_rotate_component = GetSkaterFlipAndRotateComponentFromObject(GetObject());
8324  Dbg_Assert(p_flip_and_rotate_component);
8325  p_flip_and_rotate_component->DoAnyFlipRotateOrBoardRotateAfters();
8326 
8327  if (!GetObject()->GetScript())
8328  {
8329  GetObject()->SetScript(new Script::CScript);
8330  }
8331 
8332  GetObject()->GetScript()->SetScript(pSubArray->GetNameChecksum(Index), NULL, GetObject());
8333  GetObject()->GetScript()->Update();
8334 
8335  // Set the mDoingTrick flag so that the camera can detect that a trick is being done.
8336  mp_state_component->SetDoingTrick(true);
8337 }
8338 
8339 /******************************************************************/
8340 /* */
8341 /* */
8342 /******************************************************************/
8343 
8344 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::StopSkitch ( )
8345 {
8346  // If we were skitching, then stop it
8347 
8348  if (!GetFlag(SKITCHING)) return;
8349 
8350  SetFlagFalse(SKITCHING);
8351  if (mp_skitch_object)
8352  {
8353  mp_skitch_object->SelfEvent(CRCD(0x2739b86d, "SkitchOff"));
8354  mp_skitch_object = NULL;
8355  }
8356  mp_movable_contact_component->LoseAnyContact();
8357 }
8358 
8359 /******************************************************************/
8360 /* */
8361 /* */
8362 /******************************************************************/
8363 
8364 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::setup_default_collision_cache ( )
8365 {
8366  // reduced Y extent as this no longer subsumes the uberfrig
8367  Mth::CBBox bbox(
8368  GetPos() - Mth::Vector(FEET(15.0f), FEET(17.0f), FEET(15.0f), 0.0f),
8369  GetPos() + Mth::Vector(FEET(15.0f), FEET(8.0f), FEET(15.0f), 0.0f)
8370  );
8371 
8372  mp_coll_cache->Update(bbox);
8373  CFeeler::sSetDefaultCache(mp_coll_cache);
8374 }
8375 
8376 /******************************************************************/
8377 /* */
8378 /* */
8379 /******************************************************************/
8380 
8381 void CSkaterCorePhysicsComponent::update_special_friction_index ( )
8382 {
8383  if (m_special_friction_index == 0) return;
8384 
8385  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(m_special_friction_decrement_time_stamp) > static_cast< Tmr::Time >(1000.0f * Script::GetFloat(CRCD(0xf4813ad5, "Physics_Time_Before_Free_Revert"))))
8386  {
8387  m_special_friction_index--;
8388  MESSAGE("You earned a free revert!!!!");
8389  if (m_special_friction_index != 0)
8390  {
8391  m_special_friction_decrement_time_stamp = Tmr::GetTime();
8392  }
8393  }
8394 }
8395 
8396 }
